gallery.caption: Watch the sunrise from bed with a cup of coffee/tea in hand for a mesmerizing experience. The bed and the view is the centerpiece of this room. Cuddle up with your significant other and watch the sunrise or pull the darkening blinds down and sleep in for a little while!

Escape to our luxurious shipping container retreat and immerse yourself in the beauty of nature. With stunning views and thoughtful amenities, our Airbnb offers a unique and unforgettable experience. Unwind in the comfort of our cozy container, explore the great outdoors, and create lasting memories on a one-of-a-kind getaway.
The surrounding beauty is yours to experience and like no other, as there is so much space for you to explore!
Star gaze at night as this location is one of the best spots for it in the state!
Swing on by or go for walks around the 100 acre property!
Truly, enjoy any season at The Scenic Orchard!

Relax in our sparkling hot tub with complete peace of mind ‚Äì our Airbnb takes cleanliness and sanitation seriously. We drain, sanitize, and refill our hot tub with fresh water after every guest, ensuring a safe and refreshing soak for each visitor. Indulge in the ultimate relaxation experience, knowing that your health and safety are our top priority.
Enjoy breakfast outside on the patio and take in all the surrounding beauty!
A custom fire table made out of stamped concrete, sits on the patio with two modern Adirondack chairs for you to sit at! (Season: Summer)

The modern, yet unique design of this tiny house takes advantage of the minimal space. High end appliances, countertops and cabinets line the kitchen while the elevated dining bar allows you to enjoy any meal!
Relax with a cup of coffee in bed (Queen Purple Mattress)!
Experience the charm of our custom-made butcher block table ‚Äì perfect for dining or working at during your stay in our Airbnb.
Hang in the hammock, find your Zen with yoga outside or play yard games with your significant other - the opportunities are endless!

This gorgeous bathroom will make your skincare & hygiene routine feel even more luxurious. The large walk-in shower elevates any bathroom experience while the bidet on the toilet, with a heated seat, heated water and many cleaning options may be another unique amenity you‚Äôll want to add to your wish list.

Unwind and have fun with our selection of games ‚Äì the perfect way to enjoy some downtime during your stay. Our Airbnb's thoughtful amenities will keep you entertained and relaxed, whether you're cozying up with a board game or challenging friends to a round of cards. Make yourself at home and indulge in some good old-fashioned fun.
Surrounded by 3 windows, you can take in all the outdoor beauty during any season while laying in bed with your cup of coffee or tea!
During the warmer months take a seat by the wood burning fire pit or head on back to the patio and relax by the gas pit (pictured earlier).

hosts.about:
A small family business
Our Story:
A Syracuse University Alum (Emily) with a passion for travel and a Serial Entrepreneur who had his own business before the age of fourteen (Gabriel) teamed up together to create unique, one of a kind tiny houses which they use for Short Term Rentals. Now, not only siblings but business partners, thanks to their highly influential Dad who instilled the entrepreneurial spirit in both Emily (24)  and Gabe (26). Though, this isn't the first time they have all worked together - previously they created USA made products and sold them on Amazon. This is only a short sliver of their long journey of how they all got to where they are now!

description.summary:

The high-end amenities, peaceful atmosphere & special added touches make this more than just a stay but a beautiful experience you‚Äôll remember for years to come. Enjoy the scenic views, lounge in the hot tub & sit by the fire pit while feeling at peace.
description.space:
The Scenic Orchard

Relax and enjoy the beautiful views that stretch for miles while staying at this luxurious, private shipping container home nestled in the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains on a 100 acre estate.

The high-end amenities, peaceful atmosphere and personalized added touches make this more than just a stay, but a beautiful experience you‚Äôll remember for years to come. Enjoy the scenic views from any spot, lounge in the hot tub and sit by the fire pit while feeling at peace.

Message us to get 30% off Sept. & Oct. (of 2023) bookings made more than 1 month in advance of the check in date!

‚úî Outdoor Space (Fire Pit, BBQ, Hammock)
‚úî Hot Tub (drained, sanitized & refilled with fresh water after each guest)
‚úî Scenic Views
‚úî Heated Floors
‚úî 1 Comfortable Queen Bed (Purple Mattress)
‚úî Fully Equipped Kitchen
‚úî Coffee, Tea & Snacks
‚úî High-Speed Wi-Fi
‚úî Free Parking
‚úî Darkening Blinds


See more below!

THE SPACE

Step foot into this custom getaway and you will find yourself in your very own version of paradise. This was created to emphasize the natural, surrounding beauty which is shown in every aspect - from the large windows which allow natural light to cascade in, to having the getaway face the views - so you never have to miss a beautiful moment.

First you will drive into the 100 acre estate, taking in all the scenic views leading up to your getaway. Upon arrival at The Scenic Orchard, you will be greeted by fresh air, peacefulness and the perfect amount of seclusion without being too far removed. Once you're unpacked, pour yourself a lovely glass of bubbly and enjoy the hot tub with your significant other as the sun sets. 

After enjoying the luxurious outdoor atmosphere with all the amenities you didn‚Äôt know you needed, step back inside and craft a delicious dinner in the fully equipped kitchen while enjoying your significant other's presence. This romantic oasis is the perfect spot for you both to relax, truly enjoy each other's company and make ever-lasting memories. 


BEDROOM

Watch the sunrise from bed with a cup of coffee/tea in hand for a mesmerizing experience. The bed and the view is the centerpiece of this room. Surrounded by 3 windows, you can take in all the outdoor beauty while laying in bed with your cup of coffee or te! Cuddle up with your significant other and watch the sunrise or pull the darkening blinds down and sleep in for a little while! 


‚úî Smart TV with Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, ESPN, Youtube
‚úî Queen Bed (Purple Mattress)
‚úî Body Length Mirror
‚úî Nightstand w/ Lamp
‚úî Darkening Blinds
‚úî Under Bed Storage
‚úî Comfy Bed Linens




LIVING & KITCHEN AREA

Gaze at the beautiful views through the large windows while relaxing on the couch or sitting at the table! The modern, yet unique design of this tiny house takes advantage of the minimal space. High end appliances, countertops and cabinets line the kitchen while the elevated dining bar allows you to enjoy any meal!


‚úî Couch with Pillows & Blankets
‚úî Half Refrigerator/Freezer
‚úî Microwave
‚úî Stove
‚úî Oven
‚úî Nespresso Coffee Machine (with provided pods)
‚úî Chemex Pour Over Coffee
‚úî Toaster
‚úî Hot Water Kettle
‚úî Coffee, Tea & Snacks
‚úî Sink - Hot & Cold Water
‚úî Cooking Utensils
‚úî Glasses (Normal, Wine & Champagne)
‚úî Silverware and Dishes
‚úî Pots & Pans

Custom pieces created by the hosts themselves accent the getaway including the lighting that runs in the ceilings, the floating bed frame and custom fire pit outside! The architectural design, interior design and build was created by the hosts as well.


BATHROOM

This gorgeous bathroom will make your skincare & hygiene routine feel even more luxurious. The large walk-in shower elevates any bathroom experience while the bidet on the toilet, with a heated seat, heated water and many cleaning options may be another unique amenity you‚Äôll want to add to your wish list.

‚úî Walk-In Shower (Champagne Bronze Rain Head, Body Sprays, Handheld Wand)
‚úî Single Vanity (1 sink)
‚úî 1 Light Adjustable Mirrors
‚úî Toilet with Bidet
‚úî Towels (2 white towels, 2 gray towels, multiple washcloths, floor mat)
‚úî Spa Bath Robes
‚úî Hair Dryer
‚úî Essential Toiletries & Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Soap


OUTDOOR AREA

The surrounding beauty is yours to experience and like no other, as there is so much space for you to explore! Go for walks around the 100 acre property, find your Zen with yoga outside or play yard games with your significant other - the opportunities are endless!

‚úî Fire Pit
‚úî Hot Tub (drained, sanitized & refilled with fresh water after each guest)
‚úî Hammock
‚úî Covered Patio w/ Outdoor Seating
‚úî Acres of Lawn / Yard Space
‚úî BBQ Grill


GUEST ACCESS
The Scenic Orchard is exclusively yours (no shared spaces or amenities). Please make yourself at home! The hot tub and fire pit can be used at any time of the year - the BBQ grill is available from Spring to late Autumn.

Other than the already mentioned amenities, our home also comes with the following:

‚úî High-Speed Wi-Fi
‚úî Self Check-In 
‚úî Air Conditioning
‚úî In-Floor Heating
‚úî Free Parking



Other Things To Note

‚Ä¢ ADDITIONAL ACCOMMODATION ‚Ä¢
If the dates you originally wanted are already booked, don‚Äôt worry - we offer additional accommodation on the property. Please take a look at our host profile to see our other listings! 

‚Ä¢ SANITIZATION ‚Ä¢
With hired/trained professionals the getaway is properly sanitized and deep cleaned before your stay. This not only includes the inside but also the outdoor furniture and hot tub which is drained, sanitized, and refilled with fresh water after each guest. We want you to relax and have a peace of mind when enjoying the amenities.

‚Ä¢ NO PETS ALLOWED ‚Ä¢
Our home is not suitable to accommodate pets.

‚Ä¢ NO SMOKING ‚Ä¢
Please refrain from smoking! Any smoking evidence will result in odor removal and additional cleaning fees.


Thank you very much for your understanding.

description.neighborhood:
Foothills of The Adirondacks, New York
The perfect amount of seclusion without being too far removed. Located on 45+ acres Hickory Outlook is surrounded by natural beauty but is only 15-20 minutes away from a variety of restaurants, grocery stores, shops and the nearest NYS Thruway Exit.
description.transit:
The best way to get around is a vehicle - Uber and Lyft are available. 
Closest Airport: Syracuse Hancock International Airport (1 hour away)
description.interaction: This is a remote check in property - you do not have to meet up with the host. Host is available via Airbnb for any questions or concerns!
description.house_rules:
This is a self check-in property, you certify that you are willing and able to follow the instructions that you are being provided by Airbnb through either the house manual or the check-in guide.
All guests must be declared on the reservation through Airbnb. Need full names and contact information for any person staying.
If you have any undeclared guests there will be an additional charge and could lead to removal of the reservation if any of these people are deemed unsuitable guests.
NO PETS and/or animals allowed in or on property. $500 Fee for violating this rule.
If you have a complaint about any aspect of the property upon addressing this complaint to Airbnb , you are authorizing us to come into the property and to solve the problem, fix anything, repair the home or ensure the home is clean up to the standards that you require. We do not need permission to access the property if there is something that you deem unsuitable that needs remedy.
Occupancy Limit: Up to 2 people, if this number is exceeded these people will automatically be vacated for trespassing.
Smoking Fee: $300 per day smoking fee for each day you are in/at the property smoking when you are not supposed to be.
Late Checkout Fee: None authorized late check outs more than 30 minutes past check-out will incur a $50 late check-out fee. If you hold possession of our property for more than 2 hours we will charge you for an additional day (this does NOT award you possession for the additional day). It is penalty for holding possession beyond when you are supposed to as you can negatively impact future reservations and housekeeping. (Additional day is base rate without discounts)
Additional Cleaning Fee: If the property/home is extremely dirty after check-out beyond what a courteous guest would normally leave a home in there will be an additional $100 cleaning charge.
Violating any portion of house rules will be grounds for immediate termination of the reservation without refund.

WAIVER OF LIABILITY FOR HOT TUB: 
By booking The Scenic Orchard or Hickory Outlook guest accepts the below waiver for using the hot tub for themselves, everyone staying at the house and for any visitors of the guest who might use the hot tub , infrared sauna and in consideration of facilities provided by the host, I expressly agree and contract, on behalf of myself, my guests, my family and friends accompanying me, my heirs, executors, administrators, successors and assigns, that property owners and their heirs, servants, agents, contractors, and employees, shall not be liable for any damages arising from personal injuries (including death) sustained by me, or my guest in, on, or about the premises, or as a result of the use of the equipment, The Scenic Orchard & Hickory Outlook facilities and private hot tub and infrared sauna, regardless of whether such injuries result, in whole or in part, from the negligence of the owner, host, cleaners or co-host.

By the execution of this agreement, I accept and assume full responsibility for any and all injuries, damages (both economic and non-economic), and losses of any type, which may occur to me or my guest, and I hereby fully and forever release and discharge the property owners and their heirs, servants, agents, contractors, and employees, from any and all claims, demands, damages, rights of action, or causes of action, present or future, whether the same be known or unknown, anticipated, or unanticipated, resulting from or arising out the use of said facilities. I expressly agree to indemnify and hold the property owners and their heirs, servants, agents, contractors, and employees, harmless against any and all claims, demands, damages, rights of action, or causes of action, of any person or entity, that may arise from injuries or damages sustained by me or my guest.

I agree to be solely responsible for safety and well being of my guest and myself. I understand that the host does not provide supervision, instruction, or assistance for the use of the hot tub and infrared sauna.
The tenant understands that there are special risks involved in the use of a hot tub and infrared sauna. Tenant is aware there are potential dangers to children who are not carefully supervised, as well as any person using the hot tub or infrared sauna too long or if a person has health risks, is intoxicated, using any kind of drugs or medication, or is pregnant. Children under the age of 12 years old are not permitted to use the hot tub. Tenant agrees that he/she is responsible and liable for any damages that occur to the hot tub or infrared sauna through their or their guest's misuse or negligence.

Should Tenant or Tenant‚Äôs guests contaminate the water with glass, lotion, hair spray, liquids or suntan lotion by not abiding by the rules, Tenant agrees to an additional charge of $500.00 to cover the cost to drain, clean and refill the tub and remediate the contamination to the filtering system. 

Should Tenant or Tenant‚Äôs guests contaminate the infrared sauna with glass, lotion, hair spray, liquids or suntan lotion by not abiding by the rules, Tenant agrees to an additional charge of $500.00 to cover the cost to repair, and clean to remediate the contamination of the sauna.

In consideration of my anticipated stay, I agree, intending to be legally bound hereby, that the property owners and their heirs, servants, agents, contractors, and employees shall not be liable for my injury or death, or the injury or death of my invited guests. This Disclosure and Waiver of Liability is incorporated into the Terms and Conditions of my contract through Airbnb and other booking platforms including VRBO, Lodgify , or our website.

I agree to conduct myself in a controlled and reasonable manner at all times, and to refrain from using the hot tub or infrared sauna in a manner inconsistent with its intended design and purpose. I understand and acknowledge that the use of hot tub, infrared sauna involves risk, including permanent disability and death. By booking the house I agree to comply with the above release of responsibility for the use of hot tub and infrared sauna to the property owners and their heirs, servants, agents, contractors, and employees.

name: Custom Container Cabin *Hot Tub*Views*Near Dwntwn
title: Blue Ridge, Georgia

hosts.about:
Hello! I am a cohost and property manager along with my partner Michael. We are co-founders of White Pine Managment Solutions LLC.  We manage & market properties throughout the USA & Mexico! We ensure each guest feels welcome and at home in each of our managed properties. 

Brooke currently works in Product Marketing and Communications, and Michael is a DeKalb County Firefighter and works part time in residential construction. 

Our home base is northeast Georgia!

A job opportunity took us from New England to the Peach state of Georgia almost ten years ago.  The Blue Ridge mountains reminds us of Vermont, which is why we were drawn to this area.  

This property is unique and centrally located to many points of interest. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do!  

Maura & Steve

Please reach out to our fabulous Co-Host, Brooke, with any questions.

recent.comments: The Container House was a great cozy getaway. Loved the roof top! Lots of restaurants downtown and also enjoyed kayaking & hiking. Very cute and a great place to get recharged!

items.comments: The Container House was a great cozy getaway. Loved the roof top! Lots of restaurants downtown and also enjoyed kayaking & hiking. Very cute and a great place to get recharged!
Very clean and cozy. The decks were amazing!
Great place to stay for a 15th anniversary!
Maura's place was great! So many amenities: Hot tub, fire pit, disc golf, hammocks, and more! The rooftop deck was my favorite part. I highly recommend staying at Maura's place!
Maura‚Äôs place was perfect for a weekend away! The hot tub and porch area was wonderful and the location was super close to everything in blue ridge. Will definitely be back!
Awesome stay!
Perfect place for a weekend getaway. So relaxing and peaceful. Not too far away from anything if you get bored you can drive to almost anything you want within 15 minutes.

description.summary:
Experience a one-of-a-kind getaway surrounded by nature at our pet-friendly tiny home retreat. Lounge in the hot tub or relax in bed while admiring breathtaking views. Star-gaze from rooftop hammocks or gather around the propane fire pit. Enjoy activities like frisbee golf, cornhole, or hook and ring. Savor BBQ meals cooked on the grill and cozy up by the wood fire pit. 

Only 5 mins from Mercier's Orchard & Bear Claw Winery and 10 mins to DT Blue Ridge - perfect for couples and solo travelers.
description.space:
Step inside this 160 sq ft custom built container cabin (tiny home) & experience the magic of the mountains from this unique & custom retreat built just for you! 

‚òÖ INTERIOR ‚òÖ

‚úî Kitchenette: Complete with a butcher block countertop, custom tile backsplash, one-burner induction cooktop, microwave air fryer oven, mini fridge, and sink. 

‚úî Bathroom: Features a custom burnt mahogany barn door, sink, commode, and full-size shower. 

‚úî Bedroom Area: Rest comfortably on the queen bed or use the small folding table and side table with lamp and white noise machine. Stay connected with the smart Roku TV and high-speed internet. 

‚òÖ EXTERIOR‚òÖ

‚úî Lower Deck: Step outside and unwind in the hot tub for two, nestled close to a tree for a touch of nature. Admire scenic vistas of the mountains from the two rocking chairs.

‚úî Upper Deck: Relax under the stars or breathe in the fresh air while lounging in our hammocks, or cozy up by the fire table. There's ample space for morning yoga or simply enjoying the outdoors.

‚úî Fire Pit & Games: Enjoy roasting s'mores from the fire pit or friendly games of corn hole, frisbee golf, hook and ring. Grill available for guests to use! 

Suitable for two people with parking for two vehicles.  No smoking or parties allowed.
description.access: Guests have full & private access to all of the deck space, driveway, fire pit area, and 2 goal frisbee golf park.
description.notes:
This is a 160sqft tiny home that is equipped with a queen bed! 

The Blue Ridge Container Home is pet-friendly with a max of 1 dog under 30lbs and over 1 year old.

Blue Ridge Private Dog Park nearby on 1-acre of fully fenced land. You can reserve your time on the Sniff Spot! Park charges a fee of $10 per dog per hour.
description.neighborhood: Experience the best of both worlds. While you are at the Container Home you‚Äôll be surrounded by beautiful trees and forest. Enjoying peace & quiet. But you‚Äôre only a short 15-minute drive to Downtown Blue Ridge!
description.transit: Car is the best way to travel. Please note ride shares are difficult to find in this area. Recommended to bring a car or rent a car for your trip!
description.interaction: Our cohost Brooke is here to ensure a smooth and enjoyable stay. Don't hesitate to reach out to her through Airbnb messenger with any questions or concerns you may have.
description.house_rules:
+ No smoking
+ No parties
+ Please be respectful of the nature around you and leave it as you found it
+ No guests over the listing max (2 guests) unless approved by hosts in writing
+ Guests are responsible for the safety of children during their stay including, but not limited to the hot tub, fire pit, and fireplace areas
+ Maximum of 1 dogs per reservation. Pet fee $50.
+ Excess mess left at checkout is $250+ fine

name: Steel Away. Heightened. Coastal. Comfort.
title: Grand Tracadie, Canada

hosts.about:
Born and brought up on PEI, became who I am in New Brunswick. I started bar tending the day before I turned 19, quit the day after I turned 29. Worked as a carpenter and then a contractor for the next eight years, while the itch to move back grew stronger. 
Found a lovely lady from PEI and convinced her to marry me. Married up a few levels. Had two super-daughters and decided it was time to move back to The Island. Found a perfect little chunk and did everything we could to make it our own. 
And here we are.

recent.comments: The space was well thought out. Functional and relaxing. The many deck levels were so nice and beautiful views. There was a close access point to go paddleboarding.  The perfect place to relax and enjoy the PEI summer.  An amazing restaurant The Fin is just down the road.  Host was very quick to respond to any correspondence.

items.comments: The space was well thought out. Functional and relaxing. The many deck levels were so nice and beautiful views. There was a close access point to go paddleboarding.  The perfect place to relax and enjoy the PEI summer.  An amazing restaurant The Fin is just down the road.  Host was very quick to respond to any correspondence.
Thank you so much for letting us stay! Was an amazing mini honeymoon for us. Loved how peaceful and quiet it was. Thank you for being such an amazing host. Will definitely be back!

Wow! Such a creative structure with so many details that were really well done, like the hot tub, and sleeping area. The swing in the kitchen was surprisingly enjoyable! The sauna was a nice treat. Also, about 15 min away from many great PEI attractions.

It might be hard to imagine staying in a shipping container but the way Devin has converted it to be spacious and light-filled is amazing. The use of the roof area is the cherry on top - quite literally. The interior spaces are compact but cleverly laid out and the view is spectacular. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Very beautiful spot, enjoyed the top deck to relax and look out at the water! Airbnb was cute and clean
Devin‚Äôs place was perfect for our family of 3 getaway! He has done a great job converting the storage containers into a cool and relaxing Airbnb.

We had a lovely weekend at Devin‚Äôs, I love what he‚Äôs done with the space! He was quick to respond and very helpful. We loved being so close to so many things - beaches, the drive-in, Charlottetown but also having a quiet spot to come back to. We will definitely be back!

description.summary: Designed specifically for this picturesque piece of Prince Edward Island, these new Shipping Container Cottages allow for panoramic views from the end of Queens Point on Tracadie Bay. Fully functional kitchen with efficient tiny home appliances, full bath with corner shower, a Queen bed with a twin above it in the upper container and a twin on the main level. Three decks, two are rooftops. Hot tub is only operational from Sept - June, NOT July and August unless requested in advance.
description.interaction: We live on the same 6 acre property. I will be on the property but aside from an initial "hello" I won't be bothering you. Having said that, happy to chat if you're so inclined. I am working on the property but it is not intrusive in any way.
description.house_rules: Hot Tub and Sauna - standard stuff.

The space was perfect. The trails were great.

Perfect get away! The tiny home was awesome and a perfect size. There was 2.5 miles of trails to explore on property and a great little restaurant at the bottom of the hill. I will definitely be visiting here again!

description.summary:
Enjoy nature on the Delaware River in comfort and style in this modern farmhouse tiny home with mountain and river views. 

This 4 season tiny home features AC and heat with a dinette in the kitchen for 4 that can be turned into a bed for two children or one adult. Refrigerator, oven, and microwave round out this kitchen.  The bathroom includes a flush toilet, sink, and shower.

The bedroom features a queen size memory foam mattress with big windows that let plenty of light in if preferred.
description.space:
Outside, enjoy a fire pit with grill, Adirondack chairs, dining table and games.  

The tiny home is situated on 30 acres of wooded land with 2 miles of trails to explore, as well as a popular Restuarant with indoor and outdoor bars next door and Delaware River access right across the street for rafting, kayaking and tubing!  Close to the world renowned Bethel Woods concert venue, Big Bear ski resort, and smack dab in the center of famed hiking and outdoor activities the Catskills are known for.  This tiny home has everything you need to relax and enjoy nature in comfort and style.

gallery.caption: Fire Pit

hosts.about: Mom and business owner.

recent.comments: Great stay! Loved watching the animals and the place was very cute!

items.comments: Great stay! Loved watching the animals and the place was very cute!

Amber‚Äôs place is phenomenal, we really enjoyed our stay. The photos don‚Äôt do the place justice. We had everything we needed, and the animals were the cherry on top. The place is small but provides an unforgettable experience. We are very grateful. I would highly recommend. A great get away for couples.

Thank you amber for letting us stay in your cozy place! the house was so clean and tidy. it was so peaceful waking up in the morning and seeing all the farm animals. i loved the hot tub and my favorite was the outside shower. i highly recommend this place to anybody!

We loved Amber‚Äôs farm! Our stay was extremely enjoyable! We loved sitting on the porch in the morning and by the fire in the evening watching the animals on the farm and enjoying the peaceful surroundings. We loved meeting the dogs and cats of the farm too! The hot tub and outdoor shower were both very clean and the water was the perfect temperature! Inside the shipping container is very cozy and just enough room. It had everything we needed for our 4 day stay! We loved it, and hope to visit again!
My boyfriend and I loved the little home! Lots of animals to discover and we were cozy! I was sad to leave haha!!
Awesome stay! Very peaceful and scenic, just what you need for a restful and relaxing get-away

We loved our stay in Ambers place! Beautiful farm across to see all the sweet animals. Roscoe her dog came up to us and was very sweet. The hot tub was nice and we loved the outdoor shower! The tv wouldn‚Äôt connect even on our hotspots. But there was plenty to do with the fire pit and enjoying the quiet setting.

description.summary:
Get away from it all with this, rustic tiny home situated on a small farm.
Sit out front and enjoy the sunset while you watch the horses, donkeys, goats and cows. We do ask you do not feed the animals.
There is no wifi available,  you can use your hotspot on your cell device for the tv.
Microwave and grill with a side burner for cooking. No indoor stove or oven. 
Toilet and sink inside, shower is right outside. Close to downtown Wilmington and all the beaches!  Lots of local history as well !
description.space: Tiny home made from a shipping container.  Outdoor shower, fire pit and outdoor area with private hot tub area overlooking farm views. You can watch the animals play! Full size bed, half bath inside the home. Tv, mini fridge and small kitchen area.
description.access: All areas around the tiny house are included. But not further down the driveway,  this is a private residence.
description.notes:
No oven or stove inside. There is a microwave, Grill and Side burner. 
Shower is outside, right off the porch. There is no smoking allowed
description.neighborhood: Countryside
description.interaction: If anything is needed, feel free to contact me. We have extra firewood available and when the trash I will take it. A tour of the farm can be arranged. Fresh eggs can also be arranged, honey or other fresh farm produce as well when in season.  If there is an issue with the propane or the hot tub just let me know.
description.house_rules:
The area by the tiny house is the only area to be used for guests. We do have animals, and a small farm, this space is not for the guests. Visiting the animals can be arranged.  Please keep up all trash and DO NOT FEED the animals. 
It is by the woods and there is wildlife, please don't harm the wildlife. If you have an issue please call us. Do NOT cut down any trees or foliage. There is firewood avalible and additional can be purchased. Park in designated parking area only.

name: Forest Haven - Otium
title: Millersburg, Ohio

hosts.about: Hi! We are a family that has many passions, but a few of the ones that make us come alive the most are relationships, designing and hospitality, so this is a dream come true for us. We love nature, so we'll often be outside hiking, camping  or relaxing on our front porch. We love cooking, reading, making wood fired pizzas, traveling and learning. We have all personality types in our family, so there is never a dull moment!  When we travel we love finding unique airbnb places to stay. No boring hotel rooms for us! A few of our favorite destinations are Tulumn, Mexico, New River Gorge, West Virginia, The Highway 1 on the California coast. There's nothing like cruising down the highway in a convertible, with the fresh, piney smell of the Redwoods , and the wild crashing of the ocean and the moisture of the ocean in the air! We love life, and God has richly blessed us with one that is rich in experience, and we want to pass it on to you while you stay in our little corner of the world.

recent.comments: My boyfriend and I stayed here as a little getaway and we were very pleased by the peaceful nature. Yes, there are stairs to get down to the building so we suggest you try to pack enough for only one trip down. Some of the other reviews discussed that you can see the other building from your building; however, there is a privacy net/door and during the 4 day stay we did not once see or hear the other guests. The place looked exactly like the pictures, we enjoyed the new experience of outside showering (there is also an inside one for people who wouldn‚Äôt like that), along with cooking s‚Äômores and hotdogs over the fire. The lookout deck is gorgeous for viewing the sunset. If you‚Äôre someone who is looking for a place to stay to get away from society, this is the place you‚Äôre looking for. There is also a great bistro down the road called Rebecca‚Äôs Bistro that serves awesome gluten free options (my boyfriend is celiac). We will continue to recommend this air bnb to others, it‚Äôs a must stay!

She is extremely helpful and responsive, the place was just as we expected, and the amount of things to do in town are endless! It is definitely a camping trip vibe for those that may be iffy  with bugs. We do not mind this though, just wanted others to be aware if they are iffy with bugs :)

great place

‚ÄúOtium can be a temporary time of leisure, that is sporadic. It can have intellectual, virtuous or relaxing meaning. It originally had the idea of withdrawing from one's daily business (neg-otium) or affairs to engage in activities that were considered to be artistically valuable or enlightening.‚Äù
This trip to Otium was everything we needed it to be and more.

description.summary: As you descend the stairway into the woods you'll begin to experience the peace of Otium, one of two small shipping containers set into a clearing in the forest. The outdoor living space has lounging seats, chairs, natural gas fire pit, outdoor shower and an outdoor soaking tub! The inside of Otium is designed with the colors and textures of nature, seamlessly blending with the surroundings, but furnished with luxury linens and all the comforts of home! Check the list of amenities to see it all!
description.space:
This is a 20 foot shipping container home with a large outdoor living area! There's an outdoor soaking tub, shower, lounge seats, and chairs around a natural gas fire pit! The perfect romantic hideaway for 2!

Pets are not allowed on our beds and there will be a $20 fee added per bed if there is evidence of pets on the beds.
description.access: When you get to the address you'll see a long concrete driveway going down through orchard. Follow that down until you see a gravel driveway going off to the right, you'll see 2 huge oak trees with signs for Dwell Box parking. Park there, and as you continue on down the driveway you'll see a staircase with lights heading down into the woods. Follow that staircase down and Otium is to the left. Enjoy!

hosts.about: Administrative Assistant to The Box Hop

Hello! We are Emily & Seth. Along with our four kids, Mina, Emery, Estelle and Millie, we love traveling, exploring and all things coffee and food! We own five shipping container homes that we rent in the Hocking Hills region of Southern Ohio and we love people.

recent.comments: Very cute home in a secluded place!

Nice relaxing environment in which to unwind. I‚Äôm glad we didn‚Äôt use the hot tub day one or we may never have left the place!
Fantastic spot! Felt like a dream the entire time we were there.

The Boho Box Hop was private and peaceful. It was exactly like the pictures. Finding the property and check-in was super easy with the instructions provided.  Check-out instructions were simple and reasonable. 
We discovered one issue with the hot tub during our stay, but it didn‚Äôt deter from our enjoying the amenity. We let the host know and their admin responded within minutes. 
The overall location of the property is great as it‚Äôs close to a couple good restaurants and breweries as well as Lake Logan, and it‚Äôs an easy drive to many of the hiking locations.  
We would definitely consider the Boho Box Hop when returning to the Hocking Hills area.
Great little get away spot! Definitely recommend

The place was absolutely beautiful and the hosts did a great job decorating the entire interior. We were a little disappointed that there weren't any streaming services available that were originally explained in the description and there was no way to connect the DVD player. The oven did take a few tries to figure out, but the hosts were very responsible and were able to help us troubleshoot it. The bed was honestly the comfiest bed we have ever laid our heads on and we even took photos of the pillow and mattress brands to invest in them at home! Highly recommend staying here.

5 STARS!! This little place makes for an amazing getaway. It has the perfect off the grid feel. The place itself is beautiful, clean, and has everything you need. The patio and hot tub are an added bonus! The bed is comfortable and has an amazing view. Hocking hills state park is about 20 minutes away if you plan to go hiking. Check in and out were a breeze. Stay here, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Calendar for 2022 & 2023  is up to date (and pretty packed). Sign up to be notified of all cancellations and openings: www.theboxhop.com

The Boho Box Hop is the second design from the builders/owners of The Box Hop! A more intimate setting that is perfect for a couples getaway (though it sleeps four comfortably with the pull out bed on the first floor). 
You will have all the luxuries of a secluded getaway with solitude and peace while being only a few miles from the main highway (Route 33) and close to all that Hocking Hills has to offer.
description.space: The Boho Box Hop is made out of 2 intermodal shipping containers. It is unique in design and architecture. description.summary: Exclusive tiny home experience on 100 acres with outdoor spaces, hiking trails, and creek access. Enjoy solitude in nature for a girls' weekend, couple's getaway, or a fun family trip. Curl up with a good book on the comfy couch in the modern, cabinesque-style tiny home, or take a walk and clear your mind while enjoying the scenic creek and hiking trails.
description.space:
Enjoy our modern, beautiful tiny home nestled in nature with giant windows, a full kitchen, comfortable beds, and incredible outdoor spaces. There are hiking trails, a lawn for outdoor fun, and a private, romantic string-lit fire pit.

Inside the Tiny Home
Just because you're staying in a tiny home does not mean you have to compromise on comfort! The spacious 275 sq. ft. tiny home offers cozy lofts with memory foam beds, A/C, heating, a full kitchen and bathroom, a desk, and a comfy couch. We now have Wi-Fi! The couch may be used as a pull-out couch. Please bring extra pillows and linens if you plan to use the couch, as these are not provided.

The Off-Grid Toilet
The bathroom features an off-grid, composting toilet with a cartridge. It is easy to use and we provide instructions! Please note: you will need to dump out your own liquid waste!

The Property
The tiny home is privately nestled on 100 acres. There are other Airbnbs on the property, but they are out of sight. The only time you‚Äôd see others is on the road or trails. There are trails for your use. It is common to see wildlife such as deer, turkeys, rabbits, butterflies and more! There is also a creek that runs along the entire property, making for a fun wading spot or beautiful photos! We have an outdoor fire pit area that comes complete with skewers, a grill cover, and firewood. A picnic table is also right outside the tiny home for your use. Last but not least, there is a lawn area that is perfect for a picnic or kicking around a soccer ball. (Note: When booking your stay, you agree that you have read, understand, and agree to the Liability Waiver at the end of the listing description.)

This listing includes:
- All linens and pillows for both beds (king and twin).
- Hammock that you can hang anywhere.
- Outdoor dining and lounging furniture with a fire pit. One bundle of firewood is included*.
- A living area with a couch and a Bluetooth speaker.
- A modern, stainless-steel kitchen that includes a full sink, gas stove and oven, and a full fridge. I have basic cooking utensils, pots and pans, and basic cooking supplies. There is also a coffee pour over, kettle, local coffee grounds and coffee filters for your use. I have all basic silverware and dishes too.
- A full bathroom with a stand-up shower, towels, and a composting toilet. Toilet paper, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are all included.

*You can purchase more bundles of firewood for $8/each. One bundle is 8 pieces. Please arrange this with me ahead of time. 

About 20 minutes away from the home is High Falls State Park, which is a very fun place to go with hiking, a giant waterfall, kayaking, canoeing, etc. Admission is only $5 and is definitely worth the trip!

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS: 
Q: Will I have phone service?
A: I cannot guarantee that you will have service. Most people always have talk/text with some data. I know that Verizon doesn‚Äôt have great service. AT&T and Sprint seem to have the best.

Q: Is there Wi-Fi?
A: Yes, there is!

Q: Is the place fully cleaned between guests? 
A: Heath, safety, and well-being of our guests are of utmost importance to us. For this reason, we use a thorough and extensive process of cleaning the tiny home after each check-out.

Q: Can I bring my dog?
A: Dogs under 80 lbs are welcome for a $30 pet fee. Please ensure they are included in your reservation.
description.access: Make yourself at home (you know: within reason). A lockbox on the outside of the house is where your keys will be, so you can have them with you for effortless coming-and-going.
description.notes:
Notes
- Two guests are included in the original listing price. Any guests after that are $20 each (ages 4 and up).

- The road you take to get to our property can be mildly busy and road noise can be heard when you're outside.

- When you first arrive on the property, you will pull into a church's parking lot.  There is a dirt road that you will take to access the tiny house.

- The house requires some degree of self-reliance and understanding as it is on 100 acres of private land. Of note: The driveway to the house is not paved the entire way and may leave your car a bit dirty.

- The house is very much immersed in nature. Nature has bugs and animals. You WILL PROBABLY see both. There may even be an ant or similar such bug in the house. I promise it won't hurt you.

- While the house is very isolated and very peaceful, you may hear noise from other Airbnb guests and adjacent properties. It's common to hear the neighbors shooting guns too, but don't worry, they're nowhere close! (The closest neighbor is 500+ yards away, so you're good!)

LIABILITY WAIVER.
You understand that hiking and the use of the creek is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved with hiking and creek access. You accept full responsibility for any bodily injury arising from hiking and use of the creek and hold owner harmless. You understand there are potential dangers that hiking and the use of the creek may present to children who are not carefully supervised, as well as the danger to any person hiking or using the creek if a person has health risks, or if a person hikes or uses the creek while intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or while pregnant. You agree to be fully and solely responsible for any accidents you may incur. You understand the risks discussed above and agree that you will assume all responsibility for yourself and for the consequences of those in your party. You agree to waive any claim whatsoever against owner for accidents or claims arising from hiking or using the creek. All Airbnb Guests in my party acknowledge and agree that they have read and understand this waiver and they acknowledge that booking constitutes a binding and enforceable contract between Airbnb Guests and Airbnb Host.
description.interaction: You won't see me unless you absolutely need me!

hosts.about:
We are passionate about hosting!  We provide all the fine details and luxuries we would want on vacation so that guests can relax and feel restored when returning home.  As an Appalachian native, I share local information with guests about the best restaurants, trails, events and scenes in Asheville.  We also live in downtown Asheville, so we have a quick response rate should guests encounter any problems. 
My husband and I recently designed and built these cabins using our love of tiny homes, and the Scandinavian modern aesthetic. We also design home goods that represent the "cabin look.‚Äù Search Modcabins Asheville to learn more.
We look forward to being your Asheville host!

recent.comments: A great place to stay- one of our favorites! Peaceful and relaxing and always something to do including going in the hot tub, laying in the hammock, or sitting out on the porch with a fire and making s‚Äômores. We will most definitely be making a return trip!

Please message us if your dates are booked. We have 4 other cabins!

Featured on Design Network Tiny BnB, this new cabin is a nature lover's haven. Revel in the warmth of a wood-burning stove on a cozy open-air porch. Enjoy a private hot tub, patio with fire pit, babbling creek, nearby hiking trails and yard with games. Only 7 miles to downtown. This tiny house is pet-friendly!

Our other cabins:

description.space:
Curl up with a good book in the cozy window nook.  Climb the ladder to the loft to enjoy your favorite TV show or a movie on the plush sofa.  Enjoy cooking in a fully stocked kitchen with a hip Smeg fridge. The cabin's high speed WiFi allows guests to stay connected to work or school while enjoying a mountain getaway.

Please note the loft has a low ceiling and steep ladder which are difficult to navigate and not for young children or people with mobility challenges. The TV is in the loft.

This modern cabin has large windows that flood the space with light. The window locations were designed so that no neighbors are situated to see directly into the house. Window coverings are provided in the bedroom window to give privacy. 

Clothing storage is provided in the small bedside dresser and hangers on the closet door. There is additional space for suitcases under the nook bed.

Sounds are amplified in this mountain valley, so quiet hours are 10pm to 8am. Please keep music and barking pups indoors.
description.access:
This is a 3 cabin property, each with approximately 1 acre private space with hot tub, fire pit, Eno hammock and outdoor games.
The only thing guests will share is the driveway.
description.notes:
The only TV is in the low-ceiling loft, which cannot accommodate young children or people with mobility challenges.
This is a dog friendly property. Please note this is a tiny house so two pets maximum. Guests with pets need to agree to our lease with pet addendum listed at Modcabins dot com.
We do not keep wood stocked, so please bring wood (available at local grocery stores) if you plan to use the fireplace or fire pit.
Please note we are not available for check ins or check outs on Thanksgiving, Christmas or Easter.
description.neighborhood:
These 3 cabins are located on Shope Creek Road just 7 miles from downtown Asheville.  One mile from the cabins, the road dead ends at Pisgah National Forest hiking and biking trails.  There are miles of beautiful trails with rushing creeks, waterfalls and mountain vistas.  The large creek, perfect for wading, can be heard throughout the cabin property. This neighborhood includes many other vacation rental cabins, and is known for being a nature lover's paradise.
Each cabin is designed with its own private outdoor space, approximately 1 acre each, a private parking area, hot tub, expansive porch, hammock, outdoor games and fire pit. All cabins are pet friendly. Please keep pets leashed when outdoors.  
Other than the driveway, you will not share anything with the other cabin guests.
description.transit: Travel by car or Uber. During winter events, it‚Äôs best to have 4x4, although the cabin property is easily accessed in a two-wheel-drive.
description.interaction: Owner lives a short distance away, and is available via email, cell phone or text.
description.house_rules:
Lease with Pet Addendum
The parties agree this NC Lease may be signed electronically by typing signature 

MODCABINS LEASE

This Short-Term Rental Agreement is made between Mae Creadick, ‚ÄúOwner‚Äù of Buncombe County, NC and ‚ÄúGuest‚Äù as outlined in this online booking site through Airbnb or VRBO as of the date booked on that site. For good and valuable consideration, the parties agree as follows:

PROPERTY: The rental property identified in the Airbnb or VRBO booking site is fully furnished with amenities listed on the booking site.

RENTAL PARTY: The rental party shall be no more than allowed through the booking site.

TERM OF LEASE: As agreed to on Airbnb or VRBO, the lease begins at 4 p.m. on the Check-in Date and ends at 11 a.m. on the Check-out Date.

CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES: Due to high demand for the cabins and lengthy cleaning procedures between guests, we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late check-outs. Guest  will be charged $50/hour for early check-ins or late check-outs. This does not grant guest permission to check-in early or check-out late. Please be respectful of our housekeeper‚Äôs time.

MINIMUM AGE: Primary responsible party must be 21 years of age unless Guest has approval of Owner.

RULES: Guest agrees to abide by the Rental Rules attached as Exhibit A while at the property.

ACCESS: Guest shall allow Owner access to the property for purposes of repair, hot tub cleaning, trash removal, landscaping work and inspection.

RATE AND FEES: Fees are specified through the online booking site for this listing.

CANCELLATION POLICY: The cancellation policy of the booking site shall apply to this agreement. We highly recommend guests purchase affordable travel insurance when booking.

REFUNDS: If Guest wishes to cancel a reservation, the booking site refund policy shall apply. Owner is not responsible for guest‚Äôs inability to reach the property due to bad road conditions, or improper equipment. Guest agrees he or she is responsible for having a proper vehicle or equipment to travel to the property during weather events.

PLEASE NOTE: We have a strict cancellation policy. Please purchase travel insurance.

DAMAGE DEPOSIT. The damage deposit of the online booking site shall apply to this agreement. No charges will be incurred if the following provisions are met:

No damage is done to the cabin or cabin property, hot tubs or landscape.
No charges are incurred due to contraband, smoking, pets or collection of rents or services.
All check-out procedures are followed. Procedures are posted on-site in each cabin kitchen, and in our house manual on site.
All charges accrued during the stay are paid prior to departure.
No property is lost or damaged.
No early check-in or late check-out without prior approval of owners.
The renter is not evicted by the owner (or representative of the owner) or law enforcement.
PHONE AND WIRELESS: Owner provides wireless internet access during guest‚Äôs stay. The username and password will be available upon check-in. Guest agrees to bring their own cell phone to use via wireless service during their stay as there are no telephones on site.

The parties agree to the terms of this NC Short Term Rental Agreement, which the parties agree may be electronically signed by typing signatures.

Owner: M. Mae Creadick

Guest typed signature: ____________________________________________

Cell: ______________________

PET ADDENDUM FOR MODCABINS, LLC.

With permission of the owner, Guest may bring ______ pet(s), named _________________________________, ages ______________.  We LOVE puppies, but as their behavior is unpredictable, they are not allowed on the property.

Owner charges a minimal $50 pet fee as long as guest abides by this agreement, and leaves no trace of the pet after departure.
Guest agrees the pet will not be allowed on furniture, in hot tub or shower, and Guest will not use cabin towels for pet. Guest will bring towels and bedding to accommodate the pet.
Pet food should not be left outdoors which attracts wildlife.
Guest agrees the pet will be kept leashed outdoors for the safety of the pet from wildlife, and safety of neighbors and other guests on the property.
Guest agrees to clean up after their pet both inside and outside. Guest will remove pet fur from the cabin and pet waste from around the property and place bagged pet waste in exterior garbage cans. Any excessive cleaning due to pet, or damage caused by pet will be taken out of the security deposit. If the security deposit is not sufficient to cover damage, Guest agrees he/she will promptly pay Owner for any damage caused by pet.
No pets will be allowed on the property that have a history of property damage or harming people or other pets. Guest confirms that pet(s) has no history of property damage or harming people or other pets.
All pets must be current on vaccinations. Guest confirms that pet(s) is current on all shots and vaccinations.
Only Guest‚Äôs pet is allowed on the property.
Guest agrees to keep his/her pet under control at all times, so that the pet does not disturb other guests or neighbors. For example, guests must keep their pet from barking between normal sleeping hours of 9pm and 9am.
Guest agrees they will not leave their pet unattended indoors unless crated, or unattended outdoors. Guest will not allow pet to bark continuously outdoors or indoors with windows open, which disturbs neighbors. Guest agrees to keep the pet with them while away from the cabin for long periods during the day or at night. The Shope Creek area has active bears that have been known to harm pets, and it is not safe to leave pets tied up at the cabin.
Guest assumes any and all liability for any damage pet causes, or harm pet causes to the property or person of others. Guest agrees to hold Owner harmless for any damage or injury their pet causes others. Owner recommends Guest obtain renter‚Äôs insurance that covers pets. 
Approval of the pet is conditioned on Guest‚Äôs continued compliance with this policy.
Guest typed signature: ____________________________________________

Exhibit A‚ÄìRENTAL RULES

So that we may provide the best experience for you and our future guests, we ask that you agree to the following rules:

Secure Property and Garbage: Please lock the doors and windows when you leave the cabin. Do not leave food or garbage outside as this may attract unwanted critter visits.
No Smoking: All of our cabins are 100% smoke-free.
No Overnight Guests: People other than those in the Guest party set forth above may not stay overnight on the property. Any other person on the property is the sole responsibility of Guest.
Assumption of Risk: This cabin is privately owned; the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. Owners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premises.
Property Damage: If property inside or outside the cabin is damaged, please notify Owner so that repairs can be made, or items can be replaced before the next guest arrives. We understand accidents can happen. Guest agrees to replace damaged property.
Appliance Use: Only use appliances for their intended uses. Do not remove the wall-mounted remote for the minisplit heat and AC units.
Approved Pets Only: No pets unless signed and approved Pet Addendum and paid fee.
Parking: Parking for two vehicles is provided in designated spaces next to each cabin. Any illegally parked cars are subject to towing; applicable fines/towing fees are the sole responsibility of the vehicle owner. The cabins cannot accommodate vehicles with trailers or RVs.
Housekeeping: There is no daily housekeeping service. While linens and bath towels are included. We stock the cabins with enough bath and paper products for your first two nights; Guest is responsible for the remainder. Guest agrees to follow basic check-out procedures posted in kitchens on site.
Fireplace and Fire Pit: Guests provide their own firewood, available at local grocery stores. Guest agrees to exercise extreme caution using porch fireplace and fire pit. Do not use lighter fluid or gas to light porch fireplace fires. Fireplace screen must be used at all times. Fires will not be burned during ‚Äúno burn‚Äù periods as recommended by local officials. Guest agrees they will not leave fires unattended. Guest agrees they will extinguish fires using ashes or baking soda, and not dispose of hot ashes from fireplace or fire pit.
Water and Septic: PLEASE do not flush anything other than septic safe toilet paper down the toilet. No baby wipes or feminine products should be flushed at any time. If it is found products have been flushed and clog the system, Guest will be charged damages for repair
Kitchen Sink. There is no garbage disposal at the cabin. Please do not put any food, grease or other items down the sink that will clog up the system.
Storms: No refunds will be given for storms. Mountain roads can be curvy and steep and can be snowy or icy; please use caution and come prepared with AWD, 4√ó4 and/or chains to navigate Asheville roads. We do not refund due to road conditions or other effects from storms or other events.
Garbage: Please remove garbage when full and when you check-out. If mobility issues prevent you from removing garbage, please notify Owner so that we may accommodate you. Do not leave garbage on the porch which will attract unwanted critters.
Hot Tubs: Hot tubs are not to be used by children without adult supervision. Do not bring bath products, food, drinks or toys into hot tubs. Follow all hot tub rules posted on-site. Hot tubs are cleaned and treated prior to each guest‚Äôs arrival. Guests are responsible for any damages caused to the hot tubs.
Outdoor Spaces: Modcabins Shope Creek property is divided into three portions for use by separate cabins. Our A-Frame property is not subdivided. Please respect the space of the other guests, stay within the cabin‚Äôs designated areas, and be mindful of your noise level. Quiet hours begin at 10pm ‚Äì 8am. This is strictly enforced by property management. Sound is amplified in this mountain valley, so no house parties, outdoor music or fireworks.
Use of Loft: Some cabins offer a loft accessible by a ladder which is not suitable for small children under age 7 or adults with mobility issues. Note also the loft ceilings are very low. Due to low ceilings and smaller beds, the sleeping loft is more suitable for children. For younger children (age 7 and over), the loft should be used with adult supervision only. Please exercise extreme caution when using the loft ladder and loft. Ladder weight limit is 250 lbs. Only one person at a time should use the ladder. Guest agrees that small children (younger than 7) and adults over 250 lbs, or persons with mobility issues, will not use the loft or loft ladder, and only use the downstairs bedroom.
Airstream: Please, no pets or children in the airstream.
Indemnification: By consenting to these rules, you agree that you accept the conditions of the cabins. Modcabins, its owners and affiliates, are not liable for any personal injuries resulting from staying in or using the cabins. The signer indemnifies and holds Modcabins, is owners and affiliates, harmless against any and all such claims, including attorney‚Äôs fees incurred in defense of such claims.
Bridge and Creek: The cabin is located on property along the beautiful Shope Creek. Like any body of water, Shope Creek can be dangerous, especially during storms when the water moves very quickly and a person can be swept away in moments. Guest agrees to supervise children at all times at the creek and bridge, and exercise extreme caution with the bridge and creek. Guest agrees there will be no trespassing on the neighbor‚Äôs foot bridge located near the property.
Telephone: Modcabins does not provide telephones in the cabins. Therefore, guest agrees to bring a cell phone to the cabin for use in the event of an emergency. Our wireless service will allow guests to have cell phone service, but in the surrounding mountains and hiking trails, there is often no cell service.
Liability: Modcabins accepts no liability and will not pay any compensation where the performance of its obligations is prevented or affected directly or indirectly by or as a result of force majeure or any circumstances beyond its reasonable control including, but not limited to, flood, earthquake, extreme adverse weather conditions, natural disasters, other acts of God, acts of terrorism, fire or failure of electric power, gas, water, or other utility service, plant machinery, computers, vehicles or collapse of building structures. Modcabins will not be responsible for the loss or damage of any property left in or around a cabin. Modcabins will not be liable for any indirect, consequential loss or pure economic loss (whether caused by the negligence of the company, its employees, contractor, agents or otherwise). The company‚Äôs total liability shall not exceed the value of this contract. Nothing contained in these terms and conditions may be read or construed as excluding any liability for death or personal injury caused by Modcabins‚Äô negligence or liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation. These terms and conditions will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of North Carolina, without regard to conflict-of-laws principles.

hosts.about: 5 year Super Host, Nurse Practitioner, mother, daughter, sister, friend and social gatherer! Creative mind behind Riverside Hideout, a Tiny House Shipping Container, The Hideaway and Hillside Hideout, a Tiny house motorhome.

recent.comments: Super cozy, very private, comfortable stay!

items.comments: Super cozy, very private, comfortable stay!
Had a wonderful night at Ryann's place. It was very comfy.
Perfect!
Was a great getaway for the weekend. Close enough to town to be able to go get food and groceries. Loved just sitting in the hot tub and reading and spending time with friends
Amazing stay. Will definitely be back

We were not able to stay as long as we would have liked, but our short time at the container home (about 12 hours) was awesome. The home itself is absolutely adorable and perfect for a romantic getaway for two. The decor is super cute‚Äîespecially loved the kitchen island made from a bike frame. The shower was hot, the bedding comfy, and my favorite of all: there were ice cubes in the freezer. (Hooray for ice cubes! Thanks!!) If you follow Ryann‚Äôs clear instructions about getting up the driveway, you won‚Äôt have any problems. (The ‚Äúmini container‚Äù marker was extremely helpful!) I highly recommend Ryann‚Äôs home. We hope to stay again! Thanks !!

We had a lovely time and enjoyed the dollar bill game! I would say the only negative is the grill is in need of replacing. We had to finish our dinner on the stovetop because the grill wasn't hot enough. Thank you for the memories of this peaceful hideaway! Colleen N

description.summary: A unique oasis tucked into the woods & hills along Tuscarawas River. Mini kitchen, bedroom,  bath & living room. Sit on the patio & take in the views of the river from the hot tub. Near Ohio/Erie Canal trail, ProFootball Hall of Fame,  Amish Country  Berlin & Walnut Creek, Atwood & Tappan Lake, Historic Zoar, Swiss Festival & Wineries.
description.space:
The area is rural with rolling hills and forests. Park-like roads lead you to the 1/4 mile long, gravel,  " Steep" private drive that winds up through the trees. Not intended for Fast and the Furious cars.  This is country, well maintained country.  You'll reach the container atop the hill, surrounded by trees. 
Inside, a corner sleeper sofa completes the reading/lounge space large enough to spend the entire day gazing out the giant slider doors, large deck, gas grill and hot tub!
An eclectic collection of vintage, handmade and found items complete the fully stocked tiny kitchen, complete with single burner hot plate, toaster oven and microwave and Bluetooth radio. 
Down the hall, behind an antique door is a full, private bath stocked with amenities and a shower.  Baseboard heating and air conditioning with hot water are provided.  

At the back of the container is the colorful, comfortable queen bedroom that opens up to the outside through a picturesque slider door for lots of fresh air and natural light.
description.access: You will  have complete access to the whole container and the immediate surroundings. There is plenty of parking.  The container is up a hill and separated by the State Route and the River. In the fall/winter, you can clearly see the road and river. See Photo 55.
description.notes: Wifi is available for $8 for each night booked.  This Wifi is a secure and dedicated service to the container. Some cell phone carriers have very limited service inside and outside of the container.  AT&T and T Mobile being the weakest. Sprint is marginal. Verizon is very good. There is no TV.  If you need the WiFi service please mention it ahead of your arrival so I can make the password available to you.
description.neighborhood: Rural, countryside, park-like backroads. This area is unique because of it's central location to many attractions.  Riverside Hideout is located just 10 minutes from I77 which gives you quick access to many other attractions within an hours drive.
description.transit: There is no public transportation.  There is a gravel lot with parking for 2-4 cars. The GRAVEL, could be somewhat  rough- driveway is approximately a quarter mile long off the main road. Some call it steep, but hey, this isn‚Äôt New York.  We work hard to maintain the drive year round, but winter months can be challenging.  Heavy snows in Ohio may make drive impassable by a 2 OR 4 Wheel drive vehicle or a motorcycle. Please just communicate issues.  Communication is the key to life!
description.interaction: I live nearby and are just a phone call/text away if needed.
description.house_rules:
The space immediately around the Container is yours to explore (less than 100 yards).  
Absolutely no parties.  
No overnight guests past the 4 person occupancy.  
Fires must only be within the fire ring.  Please extinguish fire with water and never leave it unattended.  
NO SMOKING INSIDE THE CONTAINER. 
Please be nice to my bathroom door, it is 100 years old. 

The Container is cleaned and linens are washed with either Norwex cloths and Norwex laundry detergent OR Melaleuca cleaning supplies and laundry detergent.  Thieves oil is available for you to clean as needed.  We do not provide paper towels, but several cleaning reusable towels. 
 
DOGS: They are welcome! They MUST remain leashed while outside and CANNOT be left unattended in the container.  You must clean up after your dog inside and outside.  There are other dogs around and the road is close.  You will be held responsible for damage done by your dog.   


NO MINORS (under 18 may not  place the reservation), they also must be accompanied by an adult, over 18 at all times.  Do not leave children unattended.  

NO UNREGISTERED GUESTS.  The cost to add an extra guest is low,  just do it.  Sub leasing is not allowed.  
Per Airbnb policy, the person on the account must be staying in the container.  

 Pack and play and sheet for your use is  $10.   Please tell me if you want the Pack and play set up ahead of time. There is limited space when set up.  

CHANGES: Once you confirm, you need  my approval to change your length of stay or number of guests.  Altering these could result in a cancellation. 

CANCELLATION POLICY: Please see the cancellation policy. Airbnb fees are not refunded, ever.  Moderate.  Full refund if canceled 5 full days prior to arrival. Check in is 3 pm.  Cancellation less than 5 days out,  First night not refunded.  Subsequent nights are refunded at 50%, minus Airbnb fees.  

GUEST CHECKING IN:  The day of your arrival I will send you a code for check in.  I will not meet you at check in but with notice or reason, I may ask for proof of ID of registered guests.  

Airbnb PHOTO: I would love to be able to see your wonderful faces on your Airbnb account!  

CHECK-OUT:  I would love a quick in app message  when you head out.  
*Please wash and dry all your dishes and place them back onto the shelves/cabinets. 
*Please place all used towels in the metal basket in the bathroom.  
*Please turn the heat down to 55 when you leave (Winter Months).
*Please turn the air up to 76 when you leave (Summer Months). 
*Please take one more look around for your belongings. 
*Please be sure both slider doors are locked.
* I will handle the trash and linens. There is a square recycle can outside. 

Hot Tub Use
ÔÅ∂Follow the Warning Labels.  Be an adult.
ÔÅ∂Please do not turn up the temperature. It takes hours for it to elevate.
ÔÅ∂Please try not to bring rocks into the tub
ÔÅ∂If you spill a beverage inside the tub, report it so I know how to clean the tub.
ÔÅ∂When you remove cover, take it off towards the container and lay it up against the container.
ÔÅ∂Replace and lock the cover all 4 corners.
ÔÅ∂911 For Emergencies

name: Nova Cottage Tiny House Shipping Container
title: New Plymouth, Ohio

recent.comments: I had a delightful stay at this charming Airbnb! The cozy container cottage offered a serene retreat surrounded by woods and wildflowers. The thoughtful amenities, from the well equipped kitchen to the comfy bed, made me feel right at home. The hosts were incredibly hospitable, providing local tips that led me to some pretty memorable hikes. Exploring all Hocking Hills had to offer and enjoying the peacefulness of the countryside made for a perfect weekend getaway. I highly recommend this Airbnb for anyone seeking a relaxing and rejuvenating experience in the heart of Hocking Hills.

items.comments: I had a delightful stay at this charming Airbnb! The cozy container cottage offered a serene retreat surrounded by woods and wildflowers. The thoughtful amenities, from the well equipped kitchen to the comfy bed, made me feel right at home. The hosts were incredibly hospitable, providing local tips that led me to some pretty memorable hikes. Exploring all Hocking Hills had to offer and enjoying the peacefulness of the countryside made for a perfect weekend getaway. I highly recommend this Airbnb for anyone seeking a relaxing and rejuvenating experience in the heart of Hocking Hills.
Magical place. Shelly and Andrew did an amazing job with this place. 5 star service. Shelley was on top of everything. Truly wish we could stay forever.
Nova cottage was a clean, relaxing, and beautiful getaway! We would definitely stay again!

We absolutely loved our stay at the Nova Cottage!! We actually got to meet our hosts & they are a delight. We learned more about the property & the neighboring airbnbs ! It was amazing!!! We had so much fun getting to know them & peaking inside the Silo Airbnb as well! We learned Shelley‚Äôs husband built everything & it was awesome to hear the heartbeat behind it all. So impressive. They literally thought of it all & go above and beyond! Amazing hosts!!

We had a great stay at Nova Cottage. It is peaceful there with little traffic on the road but still convenient to Hocking Hills. We loved having the hot tub and the backyard porch. Although the house is small, everything is well designed and organized. It's a nice space for two people. We would definitely consider staying at Nova Cottage the next time we are in the area.
The home and property are perfect for a nice peaceful getaway after hiking all day. Shelly is also a great host and very responsive.

Quiet stay, quiet mind! This was the property we needed to connect to nature and unwind! The yard is beautiful just like pictures! We saw bunnies and birds, just a relaxing time! They left a nice thank you note, which we loved‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs about the little things! The space was clean and we felt at home. I would highly recommend for anyone looking to go solo or with a plus one. This was the quiet my mind needed.

description.summary: Our cozy Shipping Container is situated in the heart of the awe-inspiring Hocking Hills and Lake Hope State Parks. The flat, easy access driveway is suitable for all vehicles and motorcycles. The tiny house has 1 bedroom and 1 bath.  We offer a well stocked kitchen featuring an induction cook top, toaster oven, microwave and small refrigerator with freezer. All cooking and dining accessories are provided. Enjoy the generous 6 person hot tub, fire pit, electric fireplace, and Roku TVs.
description.space: Nova Cottage has a fully stocked coffee, tea and hot cocoa bar. We provide go cups so you can take your beverage with you! The front patio has rocking chairs perfect for watching the sun go down behind the hills. Our covered back patio has comfortable patio furniture, hot tub and macrame swing. Great for all types of weather!  We also offer a gas grill with propane. We are excited to host you soon!
description.interaction: We are always a phone call or text away if any thing is needed.

gallery.caption: The Green Creek Shipyard 2.0 - Not just a destination, but a complete experience!
Your own private oasis! So many amenities included at this getaway that really make this stay an incredible experience!
Talk about relaxation at it's finest! This is THE spot to be:)
So many details you can spot from up above here at The Green Creek Shipyard 2.0.
Smart Picture TV located in the living room - sign into your preferred streaming service to catch up on all of your favorite shows over your vacation!
The queen sized pull out couch in the living room is perfect for guest number 3 and 4 or use it for a cozy movie night!
Large custom built bench under the TV for storage. The small cabinet on the end stores a few card games to keep you entertained on rainy days!
Check out this 5 foot long charcuterie board bar top! Custom built and makes for a great breakfast spot.
It's a small space, but we stocked this kitchen with everything needed to cook up a special meal while on vacation!
Love, love, love a good Johnny Cash quote:)
Microwave and built in stove top in kitchen along with adorable vintage styled fridge. No oven.
We packed all we could in this 40 foot long container home!
Calling all coffee lovers! Enjoy the Chemex pour over coffee set up on a slower morning here at the container. (A drip coffee maker is also provided for those who need their fix faster:))
Check out the digital guest view guide for local recommendations, instructions, and personalized messages from your host!
Great perspective of the bathroom and hallway space in the container.
Small spacious can be luxurious! Check out the large rain shower in the full bath.
Light up your vanity mirror with just a touch!
We managed to fit a KING size bed in this small space:) With an incredible comfy, Helix mattress and soft quality bedding, this bed is extra hard to get out of in the morning:)
Comfy robes are provided for guests to use during their stay!
Speaking from experience this is a great place to wake up to:)
Sliding door in the bedroom opens right up onto the deck! Step outside and into the sunk in hammock!
Ideal nap destination! We have several over these all over this container property;)
Additional seating right outside the bedroom window of the container.
Grill and small dinette located under the 40 ft + covered deck!
Twinkling string lights brighten up the entire entertainment space below. Switch is located on the outside beam before walking down the steps.
The container property is chock full of amenities including a Hot Tub and Fire Pit area. Firewood is provided!
This back yard is something dreams are made of;)
Use the large stones to step across the water and settle on the swinging daybed located right under the container!
Turn on the waterfall to create the perfect background noise that really transforms this entire setting:)
Ideal nap space! I told you we had several:) Also, check out the hammock above!
Grab some s'more ingredients and have an incredible night under the stars (and lights).
Arial view of the private back yard space at the GreenCreek Shipyard 2.0. Check out that symmetry!
Large gravel area beside the container is perfect for a game of cornhole! Set is provided.
Custom corn hole game - satisfy your competitive nature with a rousing game in the afternoon while grilling out on the back deck!

You're never too old for a swing:) Custom built single swing located at the front of the container - Swing at your own risk! It does drop off on the backside so please be careful, especially if you have little children on here.
Plenty of parking in the gravel parking lot out front of the container.
Your experience begins the moment you turn in the drive!
The Green Creek Shipyard 2.0 was a huge undertaking but quite an accomplishment:)
Cantilevered over a retaining wall, this 40 foot container really makes a statement:)
Evenings bring stunning sun set colors around the container:) Both container projects are located on the same property but the space and foliage between provides lots of privacy.
Great shot showcasing the covered deck!
Aerial view of the container from above!
Designed and built by the Schlabach Siblings -  Reece, Heather, & Landon
Book your stay today and enjoy the immersive container experience!

hosts.about:
Hi there, my name is Landon! We have a company called BNB Breeze. We have really good online reviews come and check us out. Currently managing properties in 13 different states. 

I'm a husband and father to 3 incredible little boys. My all time favorite things to do, would have to be golf, exploring a downtown area, or relaxing all day on a beach. I  love brainstorming with like-minded entrepeneurs who are enthusiastic about new opportunities, just like me. I like to make things happen! Which is why I love what I do. 

Currently, I am helping homeowners from across the country manage there AirBNBs and welcome guests into their 2nd homes through BNB Breeze. We are a hands-on short term rental management company and mostly handle Airbnb listings and the logistical work that goes into managing these properties. Showcasing these properties to look their best and bring in higher returns for investors is just a small part of what I do. 

I'm excited to say that the company has grown to include many team members! Heather, Aj, and Barb are all working full-time to help BNBbreeze maintain all of the beautiful properties we manage. Additional part-time team members help round out our entire business. Working with with these folks is part of what makes this job so fun:)

I look forward to serving you and making your Airbnb experience one you‚Äôll love and remember for years to come!

Landon
