This is the perfect getaway for anyone looking to unwind and spend some quality time together. beautiful and comfortable

description.summary:
Check out this stunning custom built Shipping Container Home!!
Welcome to The Green Creek Shipyard 2.0.

Designed and built by 3 siblings, so much hard work and thoughtful consideration went into creating this magnificent retreat! We are SO excited for you and your loved ones to come and experience this unique and fun stay!
‚úîCustom Built Waterfall
‚úî Sunk in Hammock
‚úî Hot Tub
‚úî Fire Pit
‚úî King Bed
‚úî 40' Shipping Container
‚úî Swings
‚úî Covered Deck

See more below!
description.space:
After turning in the drive for the Green Creek Shipyard 2.0, you'll be transported to your own private retreat. We have created many many amazing amenities for you to enjoy. Park on the level gravel parking area and enter your own little world created just for you :) 

‚òÖ LIVING ROOM ‚òÖ
Once you enter the Container through the front door you will immediately be in the living room. 
Featuring a pull out sofa that can be used as another bed for 2 people (Full Size). 

‚úî Comfortable pull out sofa (also makes for an amazing movie night bed) 
‚úî 43" Frame TV (it is smart) 
‚úî Stylish design (fun fact: the European mount was the first piece that started the entire design) 
‚úî Reading Lamp 
‚úî Storage space 
‚úî Fast Wifi

‚òÖ KITCHEN & DINING ‚òÖ
The fully equipped kitchen comprises of ample cabinetry, spacious butcher block countertops and state-of-the-art appliances that allow for the effortless and fun preparation of your favorite meals.

‚úî Microwave
‚úî Stove
‚úî Toaster
‚úî Coffee Maker
‚úî Hot Water Kettle
‚úî Refrigerator/Freezer
‚úî Glasses
‚úî Silverware
‚úî Pots & Pans
‚úî Coffee station: Chemex pour over pot and coffee grinder made available with delicious Red Fox coffee beans
‚úî Dining Charcuterie Bar with Seating for 4
Yes you read that right :) we made a table out of a giant Charcuterie board. 

*There is no oven. 

‚òÖ SLEEPING ARRANGEMENTS ‚òÖ
One comfortable bedroom makes you feel like you are sleeping on clouds while providing maximum convenience through added amenities.

‚ôõ Bedroom: King Size Bed
‚ôõ Pull Out Sofa in the living room: Full Size 

‚ôõ Premium Pillows, Linens, and Sheets
‚ôõ Jack Daniels Night Stands: made from original barrels 
‚ôõ Built in reading lamps on either side of the bed 

‚òÖ BATHROOM ‚òÖ
The container features a full relaxing bathroom stocked with essential toiletries and clean towels, so you don't need to overpack for your trip.

‚úî Walk in Shower 
‚úî Rain Shower Head
‚úî Vanity (maybe the smallest you have ever seen :)
‚úî Mirror w/ built in light
‚úî Toilet
‚úî Towels
‚úî Hair Dryer
‚úî Essential Toiletries
‚úî Robes to use after the hot tub 

‚òÖ OUTDOOR AREA ‚òÖ
Immerse yourself in the magical outdoors by stepping out on the wraparound deck from the kitchen, offering a private setting where you can relax, sip your morning coffee, and gaze at the beautiful setting.
The outdoors is where this home Shines! 
We built a Waterfall!! We wanted to create the Ultimate relaxing getaway space and this waterfall feature adds the perfect tranquil sound to this remote getaway. 

‚úî Waterfall w/ a daybed swinging over top the water. 
‚úî Hot Tub w/ a small deck built around it. 
‚úî Wraparound Deck with Comfy Seating
‚úî Fire Pit with Adirondack Chairs (Firewood IS provided) 
‚úî Sunk in hammock
‚úî Magical String Lights
‚úî Propane weber Grill 
‚úî Custom corn hole boards 


Spend a memorable vacation in this elegant home where modern amenities and warm d√©cor mix with the highest comforts.


Built by the 3 Schlabach siblings - Landon, Heather, and Reece: a lot of creative design, hours of work, and plenty of healthy debating went into this project! We feel like the outcome is something incredibly special and we hope you love it as much as we do!
description.access:
‚òÖ Other Things to Note ‚òÖ 

While we are excited for you to enjoy your time at the container, please remember that a lot of time and effort went into this special project. Please treat the space with respect.

1. Pet Policy: **This property is NOT pet friendly. Please note: if we find an unauthorized pet in the home, we will ask for it to be removed immediately and charged an additional Non-Refundable fee of $400.
2. No Smoking: If any signs of smoking are documented, the renter agrees to pay a $200.00 / per day.
3. Quiet hours for the property are between 10:00 PM and 8:00 AM. Please keep the noise levels down over this time.
description.notes: Built by the 3 Schlabach siblings - Landon, Heather, and Reece: a lot of creative design, hours of work, and plenty of healthy debating went into this project! We feel like the outcome is something incredibly special and we hope you love it as much as we do!
description.transit: You most likely will need your vehicle to get around as we do not have many Ubers in the area.
description.interaction: We are just a quick message away! Happy to help if needed.
description.house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Hi there! We can't wait to host you during your stay! However, we do have to enforce some rules for the safety of our home and our lovely neighbors who we work diligently not to disturb.

1. All local residents must communicate with the host BEFORE booking.
2. The occupancy limit for this property is the same number of guests as your reservation at all times. Violation of this could lead to the immediate removal of all guests without refund.
3. No parties, no loud music, no boisterous behavior.
4. Renters will respect and follow all rules as outlined in the House Rules Section. 
5. Renters agree to not contact the host until they have read the House Manual - will be sent 2 days before arrival. 
6. Smoking is strictly prohibited and will result in an immediate $200/day penalty fee. ($200 for every day of the rental period).
7. Unless previously agreed upon with the host, there is a $50 late checkout fee for the first hour and a rate of $100/hr for each hour thereafter. 
8. No pets allowed. $400 fine if the rule is broken.
9. If by your fault of breaking any house rules, a scheduling conflict is caused with another guest, you may be charged the amount owing a discount or refund of said guest.
10. Repeated infractions of the house rules can result in dispatching our security team for immediate eviction with no refund. This will result in a $500 penalty additional to any applicable fees. 
11. Items left at the home will require a $25 fee to ship in addition to the cost of shipment. 
12. Booking your reservation is your confirmation that you have read and fully agree to the house rules.

hosts.about: Tiny Escapes was founded in 2018 by wife and husband co-founders, Bryanna and Stanley, with a vision of curating unique luxury tiny home experiences. Our mission is to create one-of-a-kind nature immersion experiences for the adventurous individual that support a deep connection with nature and a smaller footprint on the planet. To date, we have designed, built, and shared 5 unique tiny homes and have plans for several more in the future!

recent.comments: beautiful experience, the place is very cozy and has everything you need.

items.comments: beautiful experience, the place is very cozy and has everything you need.

Highly recommend! Such a peaceful, relaxing getaway! Everything is as pictured and described. Easy check in/check out, great communication with hosts, comfortable bed and space. The upper deck, hot tub and fire table were wonderful perks. Hope to visit again soon!

We loved this cozy container home and really enjoyed the hot tub! The upper deck was wonderful, especially for a meal. The outdoor fire table was so nice to sit around. Disconnecting from the outside world for just a little while is such a gift for reconnecting with nature, your partner, and even yourself!
Beautiful getaway weekend trip!  Loved the mini container... Has everything it needs.  Definitely recommend!  Will be back.
This place was a very unique and fun stay. We enjoyed everything about it. It was very relaxing and the hosts were helpful with any questions we had about the area.
Perfect getaway! Loved the hot tub! Deck and patio were awesome. Hosts made the most with the space available.

I needed to get away from work for a couple of days and found this little place. Perfect for a retreat! Matched the description completely. We didn‚Äôt even leave the house, we brought a few groceries with us and grilled out on the deck. The hot tub was the icing on the cake! We had a very relaxing time! Look forward to visiting their other Tiny House Escapes!

description.summary: Have it both ways with the Tiny Bunker - a retreat in nature AND a 5 minute walk to historic downtown Todd or a 15 to 20 min. drive to downtown Boone and W.Jefferson. Enjoy the well appointed Tiny Bunker and two decks, with private access to a hot tub, fire table, dining nook and comfy outdoor furniture. Cook meals in the Bunker's small kitchen or outdoor grilling area. Relax and refresh while experiencing the joy of tiny living!
description.space:
The Tiny Bunker was designed and built with the vision for simple yet comfortable living that supports a deep connection with nature and a smaller footprint on the planet. The meticulously designed 160 square foot Tiny Bunker makes use of every inch and lacks for nothing.

With the small interior footprint, the majority of the space is dedicated to two truly magical outdoor areas. The outdoor main deck is equipped with a hot tub, dining area, fire pit, and seating area to relax and enjoy nature in. The second deck brings you even further among the trees, accentuating the winter views of the mountains. Read a good book, take a nap, or enjoy the view of the trees while relaxing on the outdoor patio furniture on the second deck. You can expect to see birds, deer, and other wildlife about while you enjoy the outdoors.

The Tiny Bunker itself was built with all the essentials and packaged into a cozy, comfortable, and retreat-like space. With an emphasis on sustainability, the Cabin is powered from the nearby community solar garden and guests can reduce waste by recycling and composting on the property. Tall ceilings, well equipped kitchen,  unique high end bathroom, convertible working/dining area, and a comfy sleeping space with cozy sheets are a few of the features. Log in to your video streaming accounts and enjoy a movie while relaxing after a day of exploring. A complete coffee and tea bar, along with luxury shampoos/soaps are just a few of the other amenities provided.
description.access: Guests will have complete private access to the whole Tiny Bunker and two decks!
description.notes:
LOCATION: The Tiny Bunker is located on an approximately 3 acre plot of land with 2 other tiny house rentals that can be booked separately or, depending on availability, can be rented together. We emphasize privacy and have set up each home to maximize guest seclusion and minimize visibility of the properties from each other. We include photos of the view of the other properties in each listing so that guests have a good sense of the visibility/seclusion. Also to note, the Tiny Bunker is located in close proximity to NC 194, a lightly traveled paved road with occasional traffic. Guest should be aware that they will hear the occasional car pass by.

ACCESSIBILITY: To reach the Tiny Bunker, you must drive up a 150 winding gravel driveway to your tiny destination. We have never had a guest unable to make it up the driveway, but in the case of a major storm, there is a pullout across the road from the driveway where guests can park and walk up the short driveway.

PARKING: You will have one dedicated parking space for your use during your stay. We may be able to accommodate a second vehicle and ask that you request this from us prior to your arrival. If you will be towing a trailer, you can park it across the street in the large pullout.
description.neighborhood: Whatever you‚Äôre in the mood for, you will find it nearby. Historic downtown Todd is only a 10-minute drive, where you will find live music in the summer, the famous Todd Mercantile, and locals and tourists hanging out. RiverGirl Fishing Company and the New River are also located in downtown Todd and offer fishing, biking, kayaking, and tubing.  Just a 17-minute drive from the cabin is Elk Knob State Park with miles of hiking, biking, jogging, exploring, and a stunning view at the top. Appalachian Ski Mtn, the Blue Ridge Parkway, ziplining, golfing, hunting, and countless hiking trails are within 30 minutes of the property. Grandfather Mountain, many more hiking trails and countless wineries are within an hour's drive. It really is the best of both worlds with city life and nature readily accessible.
description.transit: You can walk to downtown Todd in 5 minutes or less. Highway NC 194 South is famous as a biking road and it takes approximately 1 hour to bike to Boone or Jefferson.
description.interaction: Check in is after 3pm and check out is before 11am. If you want to check in earlier or check out later, just let us know in advance and we will try our best to accommodate
description.house_rules:
Quiet hours after 9pm. Please remove shoes at door.

DO NOT PLACE HOT POTS/PANS directly on wood countertops or tables (this will cause burn damage!!).

ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside or near the Bunker. You will be charged a $500 smoke removal fee if any smoke smell is detected.

ABSOLUTELY NO PETS! Our insurance policy does not cover pets so we unfortunately have to be strict with our no pet rule. A $100 pet fee will be charged if any pet hairs or other evidence are found inside the property, in addition to any damage fees.

name: The Scandi - tiny home & sauna in Berlin Ohio
title: Millersburg, Ohio

hosts.about:
We believe that relationships are some of the best things in life. As hosts, we love providing spaces for couples, friends, and families to connect. 

We first met in Thailand and quickly discovered we shared a love of travel and together have explored over 30 countries. In 2017 we got married and moved to Ohio, where we decided to start hosting travelers who want to experience our little corner of the world. 

We've designed our properties with relationship and connection in mind, and it's our hope that all who stay at one of our properties get to experience the joy of connecting, relaxing, and spending time together. If you're the adventurous sort and want to experience what the area has to offer, we have a guidebook with all of our favorite things to do in Ohio's Amish Country.

recent.comments: This ‚Äútiny house‚Äù was absolutely lovely. We adored the location and enjoyed the amenities. Kevin and Liz were wonderful hosts!

items.comments: This ‚Äútiny house‚Äù was absolutely lovely. We adored the location and enjoyed the amenities. Kevin and Liz were wonderful hosts!

I really enjoyed my stay here. Loved the experience of staying in a tiny house. Kevin and Liz have clearly put a lot into making the Scandi great.  They mention their love of travel and some special touches do make it feel like a rural European getaway. The Sauna and fire pit area is so cool at night with the lit walkway to the cabin. Everything was super clean and i felt comfortable there quickly.  Would absolutely stay here again and maybe with better weather, take in more of Amish country.

This place is so beautiful and they have everything you need to enjoy your stay. They go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable. They left us cookies and a note, robes, slippers and eye masks which no other Airbnb has done. They had good coffee, filtered water (such a simple detail) yet no other host do it. The property is clean and so peaceful, we absolutely loved our stay. And the sauna and ice barrel were the cherry on top! Fully recommended, you will not regret your stay.

Kevin & Liz put a lot of thought into making their space cozy and welcoming, from the board games provided, the lil labels all over the space,  to the drip coffee and the home made cookies.  The fire pit kept us warm for hours, with plenty of firewood to use.  Highly recommend this getaway!

This was the perfect getaway in the middle of a really neat area. We loved all the thought and details that went into designing the space. Everything we needed was there. Kevin and Liz also were able to accommodate a parking request no problem. They communicated early and often. The online manual to the home helped us plan our visit in advance.
Such a cute tiny home right down the road from DT Berlin! This tiny home is in the perfect location and my husband and I loved the sauna and fire pit area.
We absolutely LOVED our stay! Everything was perfect!!! Perfect size, perfect location, LOVED the guide. We will be back forsure!

description.summary:
Most people think of a tiny home as a small, cramped space. Nothing is further than the truth. Intentional design in The Scandi maximizes its small footprint. 

12' tall ceilings make the space feel roomy and spacious. Big beautiful windows on all sides give you a sense of being close to nature. Watch your favorite show on the 55" 4K tv. A skylight and memory foam mattress let you fall asleep under the stars. The outdoor sauna, ice barrel and firepit are all yours to enjoy.  @tinystays_berlin
description.space:
Think Glamping - not Camping. A luxurious experience awaits you at the Scandi.
- Full bathroom with hot/cold running water. (No composting toilet) 
- AC/Heat
- Kitchenette equipped with all the basics. Full fridge/freezer, microwave, hot plate, silverware, pots, pans, etc.
- Coffee station! Complete with fresh beans from The Red Mug, a burr grinder, and everything you need to make yourself a pour-over (or drip coffee). 
- Solar-powered skylight over the bed lets you fall asleep looking at the stars. 
- Memory foam mattress. 
- Smart-home features. In addition to typical light switches, you'll be able to play music, dim the lights, and more through Alexa. 

- A 55-inch 4k TV, with subscriptions to:  Netflix, Amazon Prime, and live TV through Youtube TV.
- Outdoor firepit area. Firestarter and firewood are provided. 
- Ice Barrel. (Not available in winter months). The firepit area and sauna are exclusively for your use.
description.access: You'll be able to let yourself in with the keyless entry code we provide you with your check-in instructions.
description.notes: Our other tiny home (The Lux) on the same property. It's set up with a separate parking spot and path, so you'll still have plenty of privacy during your stay. Check it out in our profile!
description.neighborhood:
The Scandi is tucked back in a wooded area at the back of a small neighborhood. Once you park your car, you'll walk down a path through the woods to get to your personal  Eden. The deck, a firepit area, and an outdoor sauna are exclusively available for your use.

Located near downtown Berlin - the heart of Amish Country, local restaurants, coffee shops, and retail stores are less than a mile away.
description.transit: The Scandi is near the heart of Ohio's rural Amish Country, so bringing your own car is the best way to get around.
description.interaction: You'll get access to our guidebook, complete with everything you need to know about staying at The Scandi as well as all of our favorite restaurants and shops in the area. You'll be able to self-check-in with keyless entry, but if you would like to meet us, we would be happy to chat at a local coffee shop!
description.house_rules:
Absolutely no smoking in the tiny home or on the deck. A $200 fine will be charged if there is any evidence of smoking. 

The Scandi is set up for two people. A $20 per night per person fee will be charged for a third person. 

We understand your pet is part of the family and we are thrilled to have them join you. We ask that you add your pet to the reservation as there is an additional $50 pet fee. We also ask that no pet is left alone in the house unattended unless it is in a cage. Please be sure to clean up after your dog outside.

Beautiful little home nestled right in the backyard. The inside was so cute and comfortable. The hot tub was nice to have to relax and enjoy on a breezy evening. 

The only thing that was that we weren‚Äôt prepared for the dog that was between the 2 gates that we had to open to get in and out. I wish we had been notified that a dog was there. It was a bit shocking at first but then felt like we had to be responsible to not accidentally hit the dog with our car or let it out onto the busy road. 

Otherwise the house was great and we would definitely visit again. Thank you!

My boyfriend and I stayed with Kimberly for a few nights as part of his birthday celebration week! We were running around quite often to different activities  in Orlando so while we didn‚Äôt get much use of the hot tub or grill, we fell in love with the place, the attention to detail, thoughtful birthday package, and the full kitchen! We will definitely stay again, when in Orlando!!

The container was AMAZING. Looked just like the pictures. The hot tub was relaxing. Not a complaint, but I overlooked the fact that it was so close to the host‚Äôs home, but you would never know. The place is really worth the price.
Can‚Äôt say enough! Definitely a unique place to stay with great amenities. Well taken care of, and peaceful! Close to lots of great places to eat and things to do.

It was our first time travel together and Kim‚Äôs place was the best place to rest and make a lot of memories. Everything is clean and nice!!! You can make a dinner together since everything like pots, oils, cooking tools.

My friend & I had an amazing time at Kimberly‚Äôs place. I‚Äôve always wanted to stay in a converted shipping container & Kimberly‚Äôs Airbnb was the perfect space for my first experience. From the jump, she had very thorough & clear instructions. She was also proactive in making sure we had a comfortable stay. The place looked exactly like the pictures (looks even better in person) & is just beautiful overall. Even the beds hanging on the walls were comfortable. I told her I planned to sleep in one ahead of time & she already had the bed down so I didn‚Äôt have to struggle while doing it. The space is compact but had everything we needed. It was also close to many activities, restaurants & stores. I‚Äôd stay here again in a heart beat. The way she has designed, decorated & been intentional about every detail within the space is admirable. Amazing place. Amazing host.

description.summary:
Step into this brand new, unique experience: a shipping container transformed into a luxury 1 bedroom 1 bathroom suite. The space is perfect for couples, business travelers, tourists, and families. 

After a busy day in the parks or shopping, come back to a cozy outdoor paradise with lights strung up under a covered pergola. Lounge on the couch and enjoy a gas fireplace table, grill a meal, and soak your tired feet in the hot tub.
description.space:
You will find all of the amenities you need for an enjoyable stay including Wi-Fi, adjustable A/C, keyless entry, 2 dedicated parking spots behind the privacy gate, and more. 

The private bedroom has a comfortable queen size bed, and the bathroom has a fully stocked, full size stand up shower. 

You‚Äôll also find two pull down twin Murphy beds in the living room with ladders to climb up into the beds.

In the kitchenette you‚Äôll find a sizable retro refrigerator, microwave/convection oven, 2-burner stove top, sink and stocked dishes for four people. Enjoy k-cups provided for the Keurig or take a quick drive over to Starbucks. Or our favorite option, try our local coffee shops: ‚ÄúFoxtail‚Äù or ‚ÄúCups and Pups.‚Äù
description.access: Keyless entry is provided for an automated check in experience. The shipping container is located in the backyard with a dedicated driveway and tall privacy fence around the entire listing - parking, shipping container, and deck with hot tub, pergola, and grilling area.
description.notes:
This is a no smoking property
No pets allowed
description.neighborhood: Located in Orlando‚Äôs safe, family-friendly College Park neighborhood, only minutes from Downtown Orlando, Amway Arena, Camping World Stadium, and Winter Park. Disney theme parks are a short 25 minute drive, along with Seaworld, Universal, Mall of Millenia, and the popular International Drive. New Smyrna beach and Cocoa beach are only a short 45 min drive away, easily making that a fun day trip.
description.transit: There are two private parking spots behind a privacy fence for your stay. You can easily take a 15 min walk to Downtown College Park‚Äôs Main Street, Edgewater, with many restaurants and shops. Publix, our grocery store, is 1 mile away.
description.interaction: We live in the main house, so we are just a call or text away from anything you may need. We would like our guests to experience a secluded, private getaway.
description.house_rules:
Government issued photo ID is required to be uploaded to Airbnb. You must be verified by them.

‚Ä¢ We have already built in a later check out at noon, so if you are still on property after 12pm on your check out date, there is a $100 late check out fee for every hour you are late. Our check in time is at 4pm, so when we have a guest arriving the same day of your check out, we need adequate time to clean and do laundry for the next guest. 

‚Ä¢You may not exceed the number of people specified at time of booking. No other than these persons to spend the evening OR VISIT unless prior pre-approval.  House and property not to be used for entertaining. No exceptions, sorry. Any guest beyond the number listed on your itinerary will be charged a $50 penalty fee and we reserve the right to terminate your stay immediately (even in the middle of the night) without refund if you exceed the maximum occupancy AT ANY TIME.

‚Ä¢All guests must be 25 years of age or older unless accompanied by a parent or pre-approved by us.

‚Ä¢No pets, candles or smoking in the home or on property at all! If you are caught sneaking an animal onto the property or smoking on property you will be immediately vacated and charged a $250 extra cleaning fee. 

‚Ä¢The Internet may not be used for illegal activity.

‚Ä¢No marijuana (medical or recreational) or vaping on our property.

‚Ä¢Security cameras on the outside of property in use. This is for your protection and ours. 

‚Ä¢T.V. only has streaming abilities with your own login, no networks.

‚Ä¢We ask that you respect the fact that our home is in a residential area with working people, families and children, many of whom are our friends, including friends who live next door. Be aware of the city noise ordinance between the hours of 10 PM and 7 AM. If violated, you may be subject to a visit by the police if a complaint is made by neighbors and you may be asked to vacate the property immediately. If you have a problem with any of these rules, this is not the place for you but if these rules are followed, you will immensely enjoy your stay at the ‚ÄúShip Yard.‚Äù

name: The BLOCKHOUSE | Hocking Hills | Old Man's Cave 2m
title: Logan, Ohio

hosts.about:
We live in Cincinnati, OH with our two boys, Ethan & Rowan. Together, we embody an active lifestyle filled with nutrition and fitness. One of our favorite activities to do as a family is hike. In fact, some of our most cherished memories have stemmed from our hiking adventures, with Hocking Hills topping the list! That was the catalyst that paved the way for our desire to have our own little piece of paradise, which was a brief escape from the hustle and bustle of the everyday demands back home. From there, The Blockhouse was born‚Ä¶
 
Whether you‚Äôre looking for a little peace and quiet to get away from it all, or if you‚Äôre looking to blaze the trails and perhaps mingle with the locals, this place offers all that and so much more. It‚Äôs a little slice of Heaven, and we sincerely hope you enjoy the experience just as much as we do.

recent.comments: My family and I truly enjoyed our stay at The Blockhouse!  I loved that there was so much to see and explore nearby!!

items.comments: My family and I truly enjoyed our stay at The Blockhouse!  I loved that there was so much to see and explore nearby!!
What a fun container home in a great location!!
We enjoyed our stay so much! It was secluded and beautiful!
Great place! Very well stocked and comfortable. We loved the privacy, cool views and multiple outdoor areas to hang out. Thank you!

My friends and I had an excellent time at the Blockhouse. It was a beautiful getaway in hocking hills with lots of privacy. We visited hocking hills state park and went to hocking hills golf course during our stay. I would highly recommend this Airbnb and will likely stay here again!

We truly enjoyed staying at the Blockhouse with our young adult children!  It was a beautiful house among the trees. There are plenty of outdoor spaces to enjoy eating outside, playing cards, going in the hot tub, and stargazing, not to mention the hammocks and trails! So close to Old Man‚Äôs Cave and the Astronomy Park as well. Thank you to Kevin and Lisa for creating this place and sharing it!

Beautiful Home! We love everything about this place! The place was very clean, modern, had everything we needed to feel at home. Peaceful and just the perfect place for a family getaway. Hostess were very responsive! We can‚Äôt wait to go back!

description.summary: The Blockhouse was designed by hosts Kevin and Lisa. As the name implies, the building "blocks" of the home interlock together to create a fun, modern twist to a traditional cabin. It offers a little bit of everything to everyone in this secluded retreat nestled in the heart of Hocking Hills - just 1.5 miles from Old Man's Cave and Conkle's Hollow! Private trail, scenic views from the rooftop deck, modern interior, spacious hot tub and state-of-the-art entertainment setup, we have it all!
description.space:
You‚Äôll be equipped with many modern-day amenities. The premium kitchen offers high-performance appliances, along with all the everyday kitchen gadgets you‚Äôll typically find back home. Additionally, our whole-house water filtration system allows you to enjoy soft, filtered water direct from every tap! 

And when you‚Äôre ready to relax and recharge, our bedrooms offer a restful sanctuary, with each one offering a spectacular view of the tree-lined backdrop tucked just outside your windows.

At over 1500 sq ft, the Blockhouse can comfortably accommodate up to 8 people and features 3 bedrooms and 2 ¬Ω baths

1st Floor ‚Äì First bedroom (queen bed), Full Bath, Laundry/Mud Room, Chef‚Äôs Kitchen, Dining Room, Living/Sitting Room, Powder Room, Deck Surround with hot tub and 2 grills.

2nd Floor ‚Äì Deck with gas fire table, Full bath, Second Bedroom (queen bed + bunk twin bed), Third Bedroom (queen bed + bunk twin bed).

The Blockhouse offers 5 total beds (3 queens & 2 top twin bunks).
description.access: Our private parking can comfortably fit 4 cars and is even featuring 1 electric hookup for EV vehicles!
description.neighborhood:
We are located in the heart of Hocking Hills! Just a short leisurely walk from the cabin, you‚Äôll find our private wooded sanctuary that is truly breathtaking! There are 3 waterfalls, one with a 30-foot drop on the property, along with hemlocks that decorate the entire 20 acres in a beautiful canopy of seclusion. There‚Äôs no need to wander off the property to find adventure, for this property offers a labyrinth of trails that will lead you to countless rock formations and spectacular sights. 

However, even the most ambitious trailblazer will find there is plenty of adventure waiting right around the corner‚Ä¶. all located within 15 minutes of The Blockhouse. We are situated less than 2 miles from Old Man‚Äôs Cave and Conkle's Hollow‚Ä¶in fact, you can walk from the wooded lot straight into the state forest!"
description.transit: A 4-wheel drive car is recommended during the winter months, as the Blockhouse is at the bottom of a gravel drive which may be slippery in snowy/freezing conditions.
description.house_rules:
‚óè All guests must be listed on the reservation.
‚óè Copy of government-issued photo ID required.
‚óè If unusual deep cleaning is necessary after your stay, your security deposit will be subtracted by $200. It is the guest's responsibility to maintain the Blockhouse in a neat and clean condition throughout their stay.

description.summary: Enjoy the sounds of nature when you stay in the excape container, with the lake side view excape was designed for relaxation and reconnecting with nature. This is the only container home in Pennsylvania‚Äôs Laurel Highlands, located in the heart of it all!
description.space: excape container is located on 15 acres of wilderness, including a 4 acre lake. The container is limited on space yet spacious with its design, the bedroom consists of a twin sized bunkbed, and the living room couch transforms into a queen sized bed making the availability of guest‚Äôs to 4. We also have 1 full bath and kitchen, a front and back porch with sitting areas for both. Lastly we have a fire pit for you to create memories with!
description.access: Once you drive onto our driveway you are on the property, from there on all the wilderness and lake are there for you to explore and enjoy!
description.neighborhood: We are located in more wilderness then say a neighborhood, though we do have neighbors believe it or not, with that please be considerate of those neighbors.
description.transit: When you turn onto our driveway it‚Äôs a one way road, once you arrive at the container itself we have 1 parking space available for you. When leaving the container continue on the driveway until you get to end, then turn left and you‚Äôll be on Rock Canyon Rd once again!
description.interaction: I‚Äôll be available to offer any help throughout your stay, you‚Äôll be able to get in touch with me through the Airbnb app.

hosts.about: I was born and raised in Asheville. I lived in California for 10 years to attend school and then I moved back home to Asheville to practice dentistry with my father. I love camping, biking, running, playing at the lake, and going on adventures. I can‚Äôt cook so I have eaten just about everywhere in Asheville so if you need advice on where to go, I‚Äôm pretty hip to what's good. I have been told that Airbnb is my hobby and I have to admit that they are right! I love dreaming up ideas for cabins and spaces. It‚Äôs been so fun for me to do and I love getting to see people enjoy the spaces so please share photos with me on Insta gram under Pisgah Highlands.

recent.comments: Great place to get away from it all in the mountains.

items.comments: Great place to get away from it all in the mountains.
Amazing and peaceful location.....a very unique Airbnb!  the hosts were very accommodating and communicative.  We highly recommend staying here!!

Our stay at Haley‚Äôs container getaway was perfect! It is a true off-the-grid site with all the amenities you need for an enjoyable stay. It was dog friendly and had everything we needed in the kitchen for cooking (including a French press!). The hosts were very responsive and provided great local recommendations for hikes and restaurants that we utilized. The glass door, record player, and fireplace were our favorite parts!! Highly recommend!

Good experience for someone not ready to fully camp. The ac unit was broken when I arrived and Haley was quick to address it, but it couldn‚Äôt be fixed during my stay. It cooled off enough at night to sleep comfortably, but got pretty warm and humid during the day, a fan would be great to bring in summer months. The lot is heavily wooded and shady so things stay a bit damp. Loved using the fireplace and the kitchen/sink was very functional, nice that water jugs were there ready to go. The bathroom is an outhouse situation and I will note that it‚Äôs right on the deck so if you‚Äôre smell-sensitive it might not be the best thing. It was well-maintained but I did smell it a bit with the door closed, but it was summer and humid. The plus side is it‚Äôs easy to access in the dark. Overall a good low-key summer getaway, loved laying in bed with the garage door open and screen down while listening to the forest!
Great private place, was very peaceful and cozy!

We absolutely loved the container cabin! The tree coverage kept the area cool and the deck felt incredibly secluded and private. For those going after us - there are two baby nuthatch birds in a nest in the corner of the container near the outdoor fireplace. The parents were quite comfortable sharing our space and it was so fun to watch. 

The ability to open the garage door and keep the bugs out with the net was perfect. If it started to feel warm, we closed the garage door and the AC unit cooled the place down quickly! Everything was as described - however the picture of the toilet is different from the current layout with a variation of a portapotty that‚Äôs emptied weekly. The shower situation is doable - just keep your expectations minimal. I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs enough sunlight - at least when we went - to use solar heating, but we were able to heat a few pots of water and add it to the bag that way. Loved our experience and would highly recommend to others!
Great place!

description.summary: This modern, dog friendly retreat is a converted shipping container situated at the entry to our 125 acre mountain top retreat which backs up to Pisgah National Forest. Enjoy all the best hikes on the Blue Ridge Parkway just 4 miles away and then head 25 minutes into Asheville for all its amazing food, music, and beer.  We provide the luxury of electricity, heat and air conditioning, with a little taste of being off grid with an outhouse and an outdoor solar shower bag.
description.space:
Wake up to the crisp outdoor air amidst the trees! Hike our nearby trail along the creek or drive 4 miles to the top of Mount Pisgah and enjoy some of the best hikes on the Blue Ridge Parkway!  Kick back, build a fire, make some s'mores, play some records, pick up a book and enjoy being in the woods.

Our semi off grid cabin has the luxury of electricity mixed with the delight of still feeling like you're camping!   Cell service can be limited (a quick walk up the hill a bit will get you cell service if needed). We provide a comfortable queen size bed, an electric single burner stove top, a mini fridge, a water dispenser for drinking and cooking, coffee maker, a pour over/coffee press option and an outhouse that is emptied weekly. Rinse off using our year around camp solar shower in the outdoor shower space (weather permitting). The glass garage door on the front of the cabin opens to a wooded view and has a bug screen that can be rolled up and down.  During the summer there is a mini split air conditioning unit to keep the space cool.  During the winter, the mini split heater will keep the cabin warm (*if calling for below freezing temps please bring extra blankets to be sure you stay toasty warm at night) 

Please bring your own bedding including pillows/queen size sheets/blankets or sleeping bags.  We will have bedding available for your use if you cannot bring your own stored under the bed.  

We love dogs and know how hard it is to find a place that allows them to come on vacation with you! Potty trained, well behaved dogs of any size are welcome! Bring their crates and beds. They will need to be left in a crate if left indoors without you there.   

Our calendar is up to date and open a year in advance.  If you can't find the dates you want, check out our other cabins in the area by clicking on our airbnb profile or follow us on insta under Pisgah Highlands where we post last minute cancellations.
description.access:
This cabin is located on a 125 acres of private land.  We have other airbnb cabins located on the property but they are all very far apart from one another. 

Our favorite hiking and swimming holes are near the cabin on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Check out Black Balsam, Graveyard fields, Mount Pisgah, Skinny dip falls, Devils Courthouse and just hiking the Mountain to Sea trail. They often close the parkway for snow/ice conditions during the winter so be sure to check on road closure information before visiting.  Even if the Blue Ridge Parkway is closed, you can still park up there and hike on the Mountain to Sea trail.

Near the cabin, there is an easy hike into Pisgah National Forest that we enjoy hiking along the creek and letting our dogs play in the stream.
description.notes:
PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING:
Bring your own towels, pillows, queen size sheets/blankets or sleeping bags.

The solar camping shower and outhouse are outside in non climate controlled areas.  

We have no wifi and the cell phone service is limited at the container.  In some instances you can walk up the road to get better service. 

We will provide Basic cookware,  one burner stove top (it's an induction hot plate which means you have to use our magnetic pots and pans for it to work), mini fridge, coffee maker, tea pot and coffee press are provided. We provide a few 5 gallon jugs of water for cooking, showering and drinking.  You may want to bring your own drinking water.  You can refill your water bottles at our well during the warmer months.  

We have a record player there with a few records for you to try out!

We are dog friendly!  Any dogs, any size. We don't discriminate. They cannot be left in the container unattended unless they are in crates.

We have 2 other off grid cabins on this property.  All the cabins are very secluded from one another. This cabin is located closest to the entrance gate and our storage for our cleaning supplies is attached to this container.  

OUTDOOR SHOWER: We provide a  solar shower year around that is a bag you heat up in the sun or heat water up on the stove.  In the winter it may be too cold outside to want to shower outdoors. We have a list of alternative ideas for places to shower during the winter in our house manual.  Due to Covid- many of our options are not available right now. 

OUTHOUSE: We use a toilet service that come and empty on Mondays around noon. They will have to walk across the front deck to reach the toilet.
description.neighborhood:
Our gated property backs up to Pisgah National Forest and is situated at the very end of the road.  We have 3 other off grid cabins on our 125 acres...but they are all isolated from one another.  If you drive 4 miles up to the Blue Ridge Parkway, you will have access to some of the best long range views, hiking and swimming holes in the area. Check for Parkway road closures in the winter...although that's the best time to go hiking up there when no one else is there! Grab a sunset dinner at the Pisgah Inn or drive into Asheville and enjoy the amazing food, music and beer scene!  

Catch the Friday night drum circle at Pritchard Park in downtown Asheville, float the French Broad river in the summer, visit the Biltmore house, Tour New Belgium and Sierra Nevada Breweries.  Mountain bike in Bent Creek, Mills River and Dupont.  Find swimming holes! Go fly fishing. Hike to the top of Mount Pisgah or Black Balsam.  Ride the Lazoom tour.  Hit up Navitat's zip lines.  Look up the Downtown After 5 and Riverlink summer music series.  Enjoy touring all the breweries. Go on the Riverarts art stroll. Shop on Lexington Avenue and support my favorite places like Tops and LP's. Have drinks on the patio at the Grove Park Inn. Catch the sunset at one of the many roof top bars like Hemmingways.
description.transit:
The road leading to our cabin is mostly paved. There are some rough spots in the road leading up to our gate.  It is a steep grade, but can be navigated by any car. If you are scared of steep, back country,  rough, mountain driving then this may not be the place for you.  AWD is preferred but not necessary.  

If it snows we will reschedule or offer a full refund.
description.interaction: We tend to give our guests their space and let them adventure on their own, unless they ask for specific help on something.  We don't live on the property.  We prefer to do all our communicating through the airbnb platform unless you have an urgent need. Our house manual is very detailed and is always being updated to make your stay more seamless and stress free.
description.house_rules:
Check in is at 3:00 pm
Check out is at 11:00 am

Bring your own bedding- Queen size sheets/blankets/sleeping bags/pillows-  We will keep a spare pair of bedding folded up under the bed for guests who are unable to provide their own sheets.

Well behaved dogs are welcome. They must be left in a crate when owners not on the vicinity. Relocate their poos into the woods. Dogs must be kept on a leash while on the property to protect them and the other dogs on the property.

No candles, incense, cigarettes, e-cigs, or illicit drugs are to be used on the property. A $250 smoke clean up fee will be immediately charged. 

Due to rare but occasional snow conditions, the cabin may not be accessible by vehicle and we would have to reschedule your stay. We will give a full refund for snow conditions.

Camp fires are permitted as long as they are properly monitored and extinguished AND in accordance to county fire safety regulations during times of drought. Please don't use lighter fluid to start your fire. Place coals in the bucket and pour water on them.  Call the number provided to see if there is a burning ban. 

Bring a flashlight, and your own bath towel!  

We provide a solar shower bag for use in the outdoor shower. 

The toilet is an outhouse.  It is serviced on Monday mornings and the people have to walk across the deck to get to the toilet.  We have asked them to come as close to 11 as they can, but we don't have control over when that happens.

Please keep the gate to the property closed at all times for privacy and security

The use of our roads and property are at your own risk

The owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. We are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

description.summary: Step into this peaceful oasis inspired by the colors of the caves.  Every space has expansive windows bringing the outside into the comfort of your room.  Whether you are soaking in the hot tub, lounging in our hammocks or kicked back by the fire pit we hope you will love the feeling of peacefulness we have curated.  Located only 15 minutes to Cedar Falls and Ash Cave, and under an hour from Columbus.
description.notes: We strive to provide a five star experience for all who stay with us.  However, like all places especially those in rural locations, this cabin has it‚Äôs quirks that guest should be aware of before booking.  The cabin is located in a beautiful natural setting.  Sometimes the ‚Äònature‚Äô will find its way inside as well as on the porch.  Also, as you are lounging on the back porch you may get a visit from one of the several neighborhood dogs that roam the surrounding woods.  They are all very friendly and also respond very well to a stern "go home!" both of these issues are things that we are continually trying work on, however we want to our guest to be aware of before they book with us.
description.neighborhood: We are the second to last house on a dead-end street and part of a 20 acre parcel with 2 other cabins on it that are accessed with their own private driveways .  There are long term residents on either side of the cabin that can not be seen from our property but close enough that loud music will travel to them.  We ask that you help us be good neighbors by turning down the volume after 10 P.M.

For those looking for a different experience to that of your typical beach house, this place is for you. Not only is the home so unique, but it is within a 5 min walk to the beach. We spent a week in the tiny home with our small dog, and really enjoyed it. If I had a complaint, it would be that the pillows were a bit uncomfortable.
Beautifully simplistic. Exactly what you need and nothing more. The location is unbeatable.

We had a great stay at this house! It‚Äôs just a short walk to the beach and was a comfortable stay for two people. Shelly‚Äôs recommendations to eat were great! Will definitely have to come back in the future!
Very close to the beach. Small but comfortable.

Awesome little gem, perfect for a little getaway! And priced very well! Will

description.summary:
Located a short walk from the beach, these modern container homes offer everything a couple or small family could want for a fun surf trip or beach vacation.
The homes, recently profiled in the New York Times, Coastal Living and Apartment Therapy feature modern and well-equipped interior spaces situated in a peaceful and private setting.
description.space:
The Conchs are two shipping container houses that were thoughtfully constructed in an effort to create unique but low profile vacation rentals for visitors to Carolina Beach, NC. The containers are located on adjoining lots so that they can be rented independently or together for a larger group. The siting of the units on the lots ensures plenty privacy and lots of space to spread out.  If the container is not available for your dates see the listing for Modern Beach Container Home #1.
The architecturally engineered space measures 320 square feet and is comfortable inside and out. The interiors offer all the amenities you need plus some interesting details such as Casper mattresses, spacious bathrooms, Paperstone countertops, and original mahogany hardwood floors. 
Large teak outdoor showers are the best! (there is a spacious indoor shower) Canopies of hardwood trees provide shade so you can enjoy the ample decks and yard.
There is a public beach access at the end of the street which offers an easy beach entrance and parking spaces.

We do not provide sheets or towels - pillows and comforters are provided. Additionally we are taking all CDC recommended cleaning and disinfecting steps between guests. Seaside Linens can rent linens and we are happy to assist in any way.

Provided:
Coffee maker and filters
Soap
Shampoo
Paper towels 
Toilet paper
Pack light!

Bring:
Full or queen sheets
Bath towels
Beach towels
Sunscreen
Bathing suit
description.notes:
This container comfortably accommodates two adults and a small child. The space has a double bed and a day bed.
Most friendly pets are allowed for a $50 pet fee.

We do not provide sheets or towels - pillows and comforters are provided. Additionally we are taking all CDC recommended cleaning and disinfecting steps between guests. Seaside Linens can rent linens and we are happy to assist in any way.
description.neighborhood: The neighborhood is quiet and has a mix of year round residents and vacationers.
description.transit: Bike and golf cart rentals are available on the island. Uber cabs are also available as needed.
description.interaction: Interaction with guests will be very helpful but minimal unless requested. We will be extremely responsive but unobtrusive.
description.house_rules: Be respectful of the neighbors and nature. No parties. Please be mindful of the 3 pm check in and 10 am check out times. Pack light. Have a wonderful time!

hosts.about:
Hi there!  My name is Trey, and I've been living in Dahlonega for a few years now.  But the property has been in my family since the late 1800‚Äôs . Dahlonega is a great place to visit with a nice little downtown to explore, and you can't beat having the national Forrest at the end of the road!
I'm an avid outdoorsman and love biking, being on the water, skiing, camping, you name it.  Always happy to give advice for the best spots in the  surrounding areas- I am on the road for my work a lot, so I have plenty of knowledge about this great area!

recent.comments: The treehouse was as pictured, but it was clear that the place had not been clean before our arrival (the outside tub had not been cleared and cleaned, there was pet hair and dust all over the couch and throw blanket, the shower had also not been cleaned), also the washer/dryer was broken so we could not wash the items covered in pet hair for our use. The internet was also not working properly so we could only connect one device at a time and this prevented us from working from the house on the day we needed to. For the price paid I was disappointed in what was delivered, especially given the size of the cleaning fee (which is sufficient to cover the cost of a professional cleaning). I think if the cleanliness of the house can be improved (especially so that pet hair between stays is cleared and cleaned), this would be a magical place to stay for a short romantic weekend. We made the best of it because ultimately we did not spend much time at the actual home, but was a bit disappointed

description.summary: This Airbnb is for sale but still renting nightly. This is a a rare opportunity to own one of the top rated rentals in North Georgia on 2.8 private acres with pond and garage. Please contact me for more info.
description.space:
Peaceful and bright, lots of windows and natural lighting. Very outdoors oriented and perfect for outdoor enthusiasts looking for adventure and relaxing weekend get always alike. Wood burning stove, glass shower, outdoor soaking tub and outdoor shower, Hammocks, fishing pond with canoe, trails and roads to walk on property. 

WiFi is included, but the only provider available in the area is windstream and it tends to go out from time to time and cell service is limited. 

Plenty of amazing camping spots and camper hook up if needed, please send special request if so with details, or larger groups and special events.
description.access: 9 very private and peaceful acres with a fishing pond, fire pit, outdoor shower and soaking tub looking out to the Blueridge Mountain Sunsets! Full access to the land, around the old barn, and walking to the airport.
description.neighborhood: Less than 4 miles to downtown Dahlonega, 4 miles to Jake Mountain and Bull mountain trail systems, 6 miles to Ranger Camp. Only a 5 minute walk to Lumpkin County Guy Wimpy Airport, perfect fly in fly out destination! Also trophy trout streams with in walking distance. Perfect get away from the Atl heat. Adventurous, Relaxing, Romantic, or all of the above!
description.interaction: If you need any help please send over a message. Thanks,

name: The Roca Box Hop - Hocking Hills
title: Rockbridge, Ohio

hosts.about: Administrative Assistant to The Box Hop

Hello! We are Emily & Seth. Along with our four kids, Mina, Emery, Estelle and Millie, we love traveling, exploring and all things coffee and food! We own five shipping container homes that we rent in the Hocking Hills region of Southern Ohio and we love people.

recent.comments: This place is beyond any place the wife and I have every stayed before. It was quite, peaceful, and romantic. The perfect place to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We will be back in the future to check out the other places Emily and Seth have to offer.!

items.comments: This place is beyond any place the wife and I have every stayed before. It was quite, peaceful, and romantic. The perfect place to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We will be back in the future to check out the other places Emily and Seth have to offer.!

A truly magical, super special place. Nestled between 2 cliffs, isolated from everything (but super close to town and anything you may need), we did not feel like we were in Ohio.

We love Hocking Hills but had never brought the kids. Now, I believe this will be a yearly trip for us hopefully staying here again at Roca Box. The kids were fascinated by the use of 3 shipping containers to build & create this magical place, but the truth is, my husband & I were just as enamored. 

The Roca Box was well stocked with everything you could think of needing. Our favorite was enjoying the evenings out by the fire, making S‚Äômores, under the string lights and stars. I‚Äôm sad we didn‚Äôt explore the property until the last day. You do not want to miss exploring the 75 acres which consists of 2 waterfalls. You don‚Äôt have to really leave Roca your entire stay if you didn‚Äôt want to! 

We really hope to be back! Thank you for sharing your piece of heaven with the world, Emily & Seth!

Words can't adequately describe the magic of this place. Nestled in the most amazing spot in the woods, every room has a view that takes your breath away. You feel completely transported from normal life, yet you still have every amenity you could want. It was a trip I wished would never end, and I will absolutely be back.
Absolutely gorgeous house in the perfect location!! the inside and the outside were both amazing.
We had the best weekend: hiking, wildlife, and s'mores galore! Thank you for an amazing weekend in the cutest house we've ever seen.
Lovely location. Charming house. Great way to spend time with friends.
Absolutely wonderful stay!!

description.summary:
The Roca Box Hop - pronounced [ROH] + [KUH] is another build by the Box Hop team (Emily & Seth Britt). Roca means ‚Äúrock‚Äù in Portuguese, and we couldn‚Äôt think of a more fitting name for this house, a whimsical home wedged between towering rocks in the beautiful Hocking Hills area of Southern Ohio. 

Built using three containers - two 40‚Äô and one 20‚Äô has a private deck featuring a hot tub and a chiminea for those outside fire nights, nestled between the rocks.

The interior is decked out with a whimsical d√©co, filled with color and texture, bringing a touch of luxury to this rugged outdoor setting.

The Roca features two bedrooms, 1.5 baths, a hot tub, and a next-level custom design. The home is big enough to host 5-6 people. 

Lastly, it's worth noting that the property is a total of 75 acres, home to 2 waterfalls and a plethora of hiking possibilities right on site.

We are SO thrilled to share the newest Box Hop, the Roca, with you, and we cannot wait to host you.

Xo -
The Britt's

recent.comments: We had a lovely time at the Red Tower! If you love the outdoors and are into star gazing it‚Äôs definitely the place to book.

items.comments: We had a lovely time at the Red Tower! If you love the outdoors and are into star gazing it‚Äôs definitely the place to book.
Sherries is a great place to unwind, and be in touch with nature. The town of warkworth was adorable.

I had a lovely stay at the Red Tower and was exactly what I needed for a mini weekend getaway. It's such a unique tiny house, has everything you need and was super cozy. Sheree is a super responsive and really friendly host which helped me feel safe, right at home and well taken care of. I appreciated all the notes, suggestions of places to go, instructions on making a fire (first time for me and it was so easy) and all my questions answered. You'll definitely enjoy your stay.

Thank you Sheree! I hope to come stay again in the future :)

Sheree‚Äôs tiny house is the cutest vacation spot! We loved all the art details and cozy spots. Our personal favourite was reading in the swinging chairs under the gorgeous apple tree. The screened in porch was perfect for enjoying bug-free outdoors and the plunge pool was super refreshing before bed. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a unique and relaxing getaway!

This place was delightful. You stay in the red tower and there are some other really nice amenities on the property that you can use like an outdoor shower with warm water, a screened in structure where you can sit outside without being harassed by bugs as well as some really nice outdoor art installations. The whole place has kind of a magical, whimsical vibe.

We had a positive stay at the Red Tower. The host was very responsive and friendly. The pool and air conditioning were very welcomed in the summer heat. We enjoyed that all supplies were provided for grilling and the fire pit (you will need to bring your own marshmallow sticks). 

Pack lots of bug spray and insect killing spray for wasps/ants/mosquitos/earwigs. Although we made sure to keep the door closed, lights off, and food properly stored, there was still a ton of bugs in the cabin.

Perfect for a couple getaway from the city! 
It was a unique and fun experience, even just for one night. 
Like majority of the reviews say, do not forget bug spray! It was super essential on this trip, which was expected given the location.

description.summary: Unique "glamping" experience! Beautiful tiny home, (10 ft. x 10 ft. with a sleeping loft above),designed by an architect, set on the hillside in rural Ontario, just 4 K from the artsy town of Warkworth. 30 acres with walking trails through the woods, outhouse, (An outhouse is a small structure, separate from a main building, which covers a toilet, with no plumbing.) warm water outdoor shower, (not available in the winter),large deck for star gazing, fire pit small cooling off pool in summer.
description.space: The space is 10 ft. x 10 ft. with a sleeping loft.
description.access: The tiny house is located 200 ft. from the main house, guests will have the hilltop around the tiny house to themselves, where they can make a fire (weather permitting), lounge on the private deck, or go for a walk in the woods.
description.notes: There's heat and electricity in the tiny house, a small fridge, toaster oven, and hotplate.  Outside there's a small barbeque, a fire pit (weather permitting), and an outdoor sink and open air shower, with hot and cold water. Please note: THE WATER IS TURNED OFF FROM APPROX. NOVEMBER TO APRIL, DURING THAT TIME JUGS OF WATER ARE PROVIDED FOR WASHING AND DRINKING, BUT THE OUTDOOR SHOWER ISN'T IN USE. There's a screen room off the deck to sit outside during bug season. Please note: NO OPEN AIR FIRES FROM JULY 15- SEPT 15, unless otherwise specified, due to hot, dry conditions. The outhouse is about 50 ft. from the house. It's not a flush toilet, but rather a camping style, pit toilet, kept very clean.) There's 30 acres of walking trails through the woods. You will have the hilltop to yourselves. You'll have privacy, but please note: it's not a secluded location.
description.neighborhood: Nestled in the rolling hills of Northumberland County, in the middle of farm country. Just 5 K from the unique artsy village of Warkworth. Close to 3 conservation areas, 1/2 hr from Presquile Park. Lots to do in the area- summer festivals, concerts, farmers markets, hiking, swimming, boating, restaurants, wineries

hosts.about: We're a family of five that lived and worked in Asia for over 20 years and LOVE to travel the world. We now call Boone, "home" though we can still be found crossing the continents for work and play.   Our home was one of the highest occupancy vacation rentals in our area while we lived overseas. Now we get to live in it for a season. As of 2023 we have three kids in college or grad school so we're officially empty nesters.

recent.comments: Amazing time and place to stay, and hosts were super helpful  !

items.comments: Amazing time and place to stay, and hosts were super helpful  !
We had a delightful stay. It‚Äôs on our list of places to return to when we have time for a longer stay. 5 stars all the way around!
Loved the tiny home. Comfy beds and plenty of room for a small family.

Stacy and John‚Äôs tiny cabin was the perfect spot for a quiet and relaxing visit. It was perfect for my husband and me; and we‚Äôd love to bring our boys back sometime. The location felt quiet and secluded but was also a quick drive to town and great hiking spots. The hot tub was great after our hikes. We were also visited by a family of deer one morning. We loved watching them from inside the cabin. We had the pleasure of meeting Stacy and John and we really enjoyed our time with them. Highly recommend a stay at this tiny cabin and we hope to come back for another stay.
Came here with some of my girlfriends and i loved it! Met Stacy and John personally and they‚Äôre lovely!!

Beautiful location, lovely space. Detailed recommendations on activities and restaurants in the area. Also, I appreciated the little things like air purifiers and perfume-free detergent, since I‚Äôm sensitive to chemical fragrances.

Beautiful,  cute and comfortable home away from home. Very clean with upgraded amenities. The hot tub was divine after a long drive! The owners answered quickly and were very friendly. Wonderful experience and I would stay here again!! Loved it!! 5 stars!!!

description.summary:
RETREAT: This home is secluded, yet 6 minutes to town. Come and enjoy fresh air and a clean, healthy environment. Luxury 399 sq. foot  high quality interior furnishings. Two tv's, one electric fireplace, hot tub,  two mini-split ductless air con/heater units, wifi, fire pit, hot tub, cute covered porch , private, quiet neighborhood walks .

PETS: Let us know if you are bringing pets. we ask that you be sure they are in crates when you're not home and clean their paws and not allow on furniture.
description.space:
A beautiful forest setting where you can hear the birds all around, see bright red cardinals as well as deer and the occasional bald eagle or red fox.

If you've never stayed in a "tiny home cabin", you'll be shocked how roomy and comfy this is. Come enjoy your private mountain hide-away, yet very close to town. 

The kitchen is surprisingly large with a four burner stove, full size oven, large microwave and full size fridge/freezer with ice maker. There are ample supplies for cooking, plates, cups, bowls, etc. Plenty of towels. The loft is almost like it's own private space (kinda like a tree house for the kids)  with a queen memory foam mattress and a twin memory foam mattress, overhead light and place to store luggage. The loft windows look out on the tree canopy.

The hot tub is steps from the cabin and in a clearing so you can see the stars at night, have the fireflies around you in the summer, yet secluded and private.  (my husband told me to write that part.)

We invested in high end memory foam mattresses for the king bed and the queen and twin bed as well as a luxuriously soft and comfy velvety blue sofa. Two tv's--one in the bedroom and one in the family room. Both are 43" LG smart roku tv's.  There are also two mini-split ductless aircon/heater units so you can close the door to your bedroom and choose the temp that you want. 

Really cool exterior lights at night and a comfy and private covered porch.
description.access: The entire cabin and surrounding area are yours to enjoy.
description.notes:
If you're bringing a pet, please know that there are no leash laws in our area. There are some neighborhood dogs. ALL are friendly and you may see them during your walks in the area.

We've had the hot tub break once (due to a guest that mis-used it) in the entire history of the tiny home cabin. We started renting it in July of 2019. That said, should the hot tub break, there is no refund on your stay. We endeavor to keep it in great working order, but accidents happen and repairmen are swamped in our area, so it can take some time to get repairs done.
description.neighborhood: At the bottom of Canterbury Lane is the South Fork of the New River. Walk down the hill, play in the river, kayak, tube, or just take walks in the countryside.
description.transit: Uber and Lyft are available if needed.
description.interaction:
We don't bite.

We love to meet new people and hear your stories. 

Our feelings get hurt if you don't have a 5-star stay because of something we neglected to do. We will do our best to make it right, just let us know as soon as you see something amiss, not after you departed. We do get kinda perturbed if you don't have a 5-star stay because you didn't read the description, well. Thanks :-)
description.house_rules:
This is a no shoe tiny home, please leave your shoes at the front door.

We want ALL of our guests to have a 5-star stay. If you arrive and something is amiss, please do let us know right away so we can make it right. We're not perfect and do make mistakes. We'd rather correct it right away than hear about it after your stay. 

Just a reminder, that we like pets. But we have nice furniture and if you are out and about and don't take your pets, they need to be left in a crate. No pets on the furniture and please clean paws before entering. Being a respectful pet owner helps us to continue to not charge a pet fee.

We ask that you not hold large parties with guests outside of those that are already part of the rental.

No loud outside noises after 11:00 p.m. Sound carries in the mountains and that's the cut-off time for our local county ordinance.

Have Fun: Enjoy this beautiful area; Ask us questions via the Airbnb app if you need something. 

NOTE: There will be a $75 extra charge if there's a smell of marijuana, cigarette smoke or vaping inside the the cabin and we have to bring in a air purifier to clear the smell

AIRBNB HAS SUGGESTED WE WRITE THIS AS OWNERS OF HOT TUBS:  "update your listing description about its availability; that there are times where it is being repaired or is inactive. If this is clearly outlined and you are as transparent as possible prior to confirmation and check-in then if the guest proceeds with a cancellation, all refunds will be in accordance with your cancellation policy."

recent.comments: The home was beautiful, clean and exactly as pictured. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a family getaway. One of the best experiences we have had with any host.

items.comments: The home was beautiful, clean and exactly as pictured. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a family getaway. One of the best experiences we have had with any host.
Absolutely perfect! 10/10! Highly recommend!

Dianna thought of everything ! All the special details of the place really made it so special. It was exceptionally clean and I loved all of the decor. It was easy to check in and out. Will definitely consider staying here again :)

L3nee's Lay Up was awesome! Impeccably clean and furnished with everything you need. The basketball court and hottub provided great entertainment for the kids when we weren't out hiking. We also loved visiting The Barn on the neighboring property and petting the goats, dog, donkey and cows. The construction, design and decor of the house and surrounding properties was impressive. You can tell that a great deal of thought went into them. So modern and cool yet so cozy and welcoming. Location was great - easy drive to any of the hiking trails and the general store was just down the road.  We would definitely visit any of Creative Cabins properties again!

This place is amazing! It‚Äôs beautifully designed and decorated and felt spacious and comfortable. She truly thought of everything. She had supplies there in case you forgot (toothbrushes, q-tips, chargers, soap and shampoo like an hotel, etc.) and supplied plenty of options for the keurig with all the fixings. I wish I found this sooner since it‚Äôs a great distance to visit my son in Athens. He just graduated and it was an easy commute to and from campus. Everyone loved the basketball court inside and the jacuzzi and the fire pit and the outdoor swings. It was all just amazing! I‚Äôm a little sad I didn‚Äôt get to visit with the animals but I got to see them from the car a few times. The area is kind of a dead zone for service but the Wi-Fi was good in the cabin and truthfully, I liked not being bothered during my stay. It was the perfect getaway.

Me and my boyfriend stayed for 2 nights & we really enjoyed the stay. The hot tub was really nice and the basketball hoop was really nice too my boyfriend loved that the most. I also left my iPad mini there and she shipped it back to me right away I couldn‚Äôt go back and get it because I stayed 2 hours away but she helped me get my baby back Lols thank you soo much I would definitely recommend to everyone.
The house was wonderful and we loved everything about it!! If we had stayed longer we would have needed a washer and dryer, but thats literally the only thing "missing".

description.summary:
Welcome to our unique cabin rentals. My husband and I started our journey in February 2019 to bring a more unique modern lodging experience to the Hocking Hills. Being raised here and wanting to share our love for the area we decided to embark on a journey to building creative cabins. I hope you decide to stay at one of our creative cabins.

Attention: There is a Rental Agreement that will need to be signed within 48 hours of your booking via DocuSign that will be sent to you Airbnb email.
description.space: L3nee's Lay-Up is a unique cabin featuring a half court covered indoor/outdoor 10 foot basketball hoop. This unique cabin also features 2 shipping containers with private bedrooms (Queen size) and private bathrooms.

39 minutes from Athens, OH

We are right on OH-664, just 5 mins from the entrance of The Famous Old Man‚Äôs Cave.

We are Nestled on 30 acres of wooded terrain in Hocking Hills, Logan Ohio. We are right on OH-664, just 5 driving minutes from the entrance of The Famous Old Man‚Äôs Cave. (There is no walking trail from our property to Old Man's Cave)



The property is also gated for your security. There is also other cabins located throughout the property. You will see a sign on a tree after entering the gate on where L3nee's Lay-Up is located on the property.
