name: Luna Cottage Tiny House Shipping Container
title: New Plymouth, Ohio

recent.comments: I had a delightful stay at this charming Airbnb! The cozy container cottage offered a serene retreat surrounded by woods and wildflowers. The thoughtful amenities, from the well equipped kitchen to the comfy bed, made me feel right at home. The hosts were incredibly hospitable, providing local tips that led me to some pretty memorable hikes. Exploring all Hocking Hills had to offer and enjoying the peacefulness of the countryside made for a perfect weekend getaway. I highly recommend this Airbnb for anyone seeking a relaxing and rejuvenating experience in the heart of Hocking Hills.

items.comments: I had a delightful stay at this charming Airbnb! The cozy container cottage offered a serene retreat surrounded by woods and wildflowers. The thoughtful amenities, from the well equipped kitchen to the comfy bed, made me feel right at home. The hosts were incredibly hospitable, providing local tips that led me to some pretty memorable hikes. Exploring all Hocking Hills had to offer and enjoying the peacefulness of the countryside made for a perfect weekend getaway. I highly recommend this Airbnb for anyone seeking a relaxing and rejuvenating experience in the heart of Hocking Hills.

I loved EVERYTHING about this tiny house!  The location is very peaceful and private, which is exactly what my husband and I were looking for.  We rode our Harley from about 4 hours away and arrived into town a little earlier than expected.  It looked like it was going to rain, but there was no need to worry, Shelley had the place ready for us to check in!  We had ALL the comforts of home in this little space!  My favorites were the fire pit and that relaxing and  private hot tub!!!  Luna Cottage is amazing!!  We will be back!!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Shelley was extremely helpful and the place was beautiful. Location was quaint, peaceful, and clean! 11/10! Would stay again.

had a wonderful stay here with my boyfriend to celebrate our anniversary...it was everything we could have wanted and more. we got to go canoeing and hiking then come back to this perfect airbnb to cook dinner and relax in the hot tub. what a beautiful spot and excellent host. thanks so much for letting us enjoy this lil retreat!

My husband, two-year-old, and I had a FANTASTIC stay here earlier this month! Shelley and Matt truly anticipate their guests' every need, and the check-in/check out process couldn't have been easier. Thank you for making our first vacation as a family of three a breeze!

Husband and I loved this cottage! Only a short drive away from beautiful Hocking Hills state park. This was our first time visiting the area and Shelley‚Äôs cottage was a bonus! Just as advertised, private, quiet, and squeaky clean. We more than enjoyed our peaceful nature getaway.

Shelley and Matt -

Thank you both for the great stay in Hocking Hills! We really enjoyed your place. My husband and I loved the location as well - 20 to 30 minutes to each of the hikes we wanted to do, we felt like your place was centrally located and easy to get around. We also appreciated that you had Netflix for your guests - it was really nice to be gone all day and then come back at night and watch a movie. Being that there is no service only wifi - it was nice to be able to watch a TV show or movie at the end of the night. We hope to be back!

description.summary:
*New Shipping Container Tiny House*
Our cozy cottage is situated in the heart of the Hocking Hills and Wayne National Forest. The flat, easy access driveway is suitable for all vehicles or motorcycle. The tiny house has 1 bedroom and 1 bath. We offer a well stocked kitchen featuring a cook top, toaster oven, microwave and refrigerator with freezer. All cooking and dining accessories are provided. Relax in our Master Spa hot tub. Enjoy the firepit, electric fireplace and Roku TV.
description.space: Luna Cottage has a fully stocked coffee, tea and hot cocoa bar. We provide go cups so you can take your beverage with you! The front patio has rocking chairs perfect for watching the sun go down behind the hills. Our covered back patio has comfortable patio furniture, Master Spa hot tub and two macrame swings. Great for all types of weather. We also offer a gas grill with propane. We are excited to host you!
description.interaction: We are always a phone call or text away if anything is needed!

name: The NODE Prototype - By NOMAD.
title: Raleigh, North Carolina

hosts.about:
Hi, my name is Taryn! My son and I are local to the Raleigh area and love hosting guests. We enjoy everything that comes with providing a nice place to stay while someone is visiting the area. 

In our free time, we love exploring the city for festivals, farmer's markets and walking trails - basically anything to get out of the house! Raleigh has been a wonderful place to live and we hope you get just as much out of it for however long you're here!
Often travel for business or just for fun. Design and build houses, including my Airbnb that I run with Sandrine. I've been to 62 countries so far. Huge passion for everything international.

recent.comments: It's a lovely, stylish and well-appointed space - deceptively large for a tiny space!  Very comfortable.

items.comments: It's a lovely, stylish and well-appointed space - deceptively large for a tiny space!  Very comfortable.
What a wonderful stay we had at Zach‚Äôs place. Was perfect for a day and night away. Not only was it clean and tidy but also had all the essentials at the ready. Highly recommend!

My wife and I were able to stay one night in this beautiful place. It was just as described and we felt right at home. Zach was very responsive and provided easy instructions to follow. We cannot wait to go back and spend more than one night there.
Great location, very responsive, comfortable bed and the best blackout curtains.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Zach's Airbnb property, and I can confidently say that it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment I arrived until my departure, Zach's exceptional hospitality and attention to detail truly stood out.

First and foremost, the accommodation itself was remarkable. The house was beautifully decorated, impeccably clean, and provided all the comforts of home. The attention Zach paid to ensuring a comfortable stay was evident in every aspect of the space. The bed was incredibly cozy, and the amenities, including high-speed internet and a well-equipped kitchen, were top-notch.

Such a great stay! The host is extremely responsive and the space was pristine. Also, for those worried about privacy due to the large windows, DON'T BE! There are remote control  blackout curtains for instant privacy. I felt safe and comfortable. The bed was cozy and I loved the mood lighting, heated bathroom floor, and towel warmers for an added luxurious touch. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend if you're considering booking!
My favorite place to stay in Raleigh. I love the vibe of this place! Super clean and the bathroom is out of this world!

description.summary: In a first-of-its kind-project, The NODE throws all of the preconceived notions that typically come with the term "tiny house" completely out the window. Whether you're writing your next masterpiece, designing your latest project, or just catching up on emails, this space has everything you need to stay focused and productive.
description.space: Step inside and be greeted by a bright and airy living area, complete with plush furnishings, space saving techniques, and state-of-the-art technology. The large windows let in plenty of natural light, showcasing the striking design and clean lines of this beautiful space. The open-plan kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to whip up a delicious meal. The bedroom features a comfortable queen-size bed with luxurious linens, and the bathroom is a spa-like oasis with a spacious shower and designer fixtures. We hope you're ready for a truly unforgettable experience!

hosts.about:
I've had the privilege of living on this beautiful farm and woodland property since 1979.  It formerly was a commune in the early '70's!  Now, after additions to the house, a heritage turkey farm, chickens, woodland tea house, and many versions of the vegetable garden,  I look forward to sharing it with the GuestHouse visitors. 
My landscape design/build business has kept me creative and physically active for 43 years.  It's also allowed me lots of travel adventures, especially in the winter.
My heritage turkey farm fills my desire to provide local organic meat, and help preserve heritage breeds and sustainable farming.  
I live on the property with my partner and musician nephew,  poodle and cats, and a diversity of fauna and flora  :~)

recent.comments: Barb‚Äôs place is so cute, cozy and unique. We loved spending a long weekend amongst the trees and quiet sounds of nature. Her place had everything you‚Äôd need and then some. She was an amazing host and made sure we were well taken care of during our stay. We definitely would love to stay again sometime!

items.comments: Barb‚Äôs place is so cute, cozy and unique. We loved spending a long weekend amongst the trees and quiet sounds of nature. Her place had everything you‚Äôd need and then some. She was an amazing host and made sure we were well taken care of during our stay. We definitely would love to stay again sometime!
Beautifully peaceful locale in the woods. Quiet and gorgeous views, with good hiking nearby. Barb was very friendly and made this vacation amazing!

We had a magical stay at Barbara‚Äôs lovely,  very special place! We absolutely loved being secluded in the woods on Barbara‚Äôs gorgeous property. It was exactly the peaceful retreat we needed and hoped for. We loved exploring the grounds and meeting the turkeys, and we kept marveling at the wildflowers and peacefulness, and the ingenuity and artistry of the house itself. Barbara was an amazing host - she communicated clearly and frequently with us, and was super kind and helpful, and we also really appreciated the helpful guidebook, which gave us a lot of ideas re: places to visit. We loved our stay, wish we could have stayed longer, and we will definitely be visiting Barbara‚Äôs place again in the future! Thank you, Barbara!

The view and home were awesome.¬†¬†Perfect place for a relaxing, peaceful stay. Centrally located to Ithaca, Elmira, and Watkins Glen. Barbara is very responsive and very accommodating.¬†¬†For me, the highlight of our stay was walking the trail through the woods
Beautiful property and very peaceful.

Barbara‚Äôs Guesthouse is absolutely the best Airbnb in which I‚Äôve stayed. It was spotlessly clean, well-organized and stocked with all the essentials. I most enjoyed the beauty, quiet, solitude and lovely views. There are also several lovely towns nearby to explore within easy driving distance. Barbara is gracious and friendly and made sure my stay was the best it could be. I hope to return soon.

We loved this stay! Barbara is a welcoming and friendly host. The location is just over 30 minutes from Ithaca and Watkins Glen and overlooks a peaceful and lush valley (which you can enjoy from the deck and loft). It‚Äôs a well designed space and very clean. Lots of cozy spots for a cup of tea and a book. We brought our 4 month old and the set up worked great for an infant. The eggs were so delicious. We‚Äôd love to come back!

description.summary: A unique country GuestHouse artistically renovated from a repurposed insulated tractor trailer. Brilliantly designed to maximize space for a bedroom- queen bed, desk area. Full bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, eating and lounging area, comfy loft with a sleeper sofa.  Private, quiet woodland setting under dark night skies. The spacious sunny deck, shady patio, & firepit bring your experience more outside. Wifi. 1.6mi woodland trail. Turkeys, chickens, herb farm.  10% discount for repeat guests.
description.space:
The house is unique not only because it's made from a repurposed insulated tractor trailer, but also because it utilizes many recycled and repurposed materials, such as the 1960's bamboo kitchen cabinets, recycled hardwood flooring and windows, and many antique elements.

There's plenty of nature to explore on the 160 acres of forest and stream, along with the farm‚Äôs free ranging chickens and fenced heritage turkeys.  Gorgeous views of the Southern Tier‚Äôs undulating hills.  Lovely 1.6 mile trail on the property, through the woods and along the creek!

If you wish to venture out, we're located 13 min to Horseheads, 17 min to box store shopping mecca in Big Flats, 35 min to Ithaca, 35 min to Watkins Glen,  25 min to Corning, 55 min to Hammondsport, and anywhere from 17- 90 min to wineries and breweries in the Finger Lakes.  Also, 35 - 60 min to spectacular  water falls and gorges in the many State Parks.
description.access: The GuestHouse building and grounds are for you only.   Feel free to walk the farm areas (not the barn please - too messy), the dirt road we're on, and the woods and/or woodland trails.  My A-frame house and the 1939 log cabin on the property are our private residences.
description.notes:
10% discount offered to repeat guests!
PETS are welcome with an additional $25 fee.  They are not allowed on the furniture and must always be supervised.  If you have to leave them alone, they should be in a crate you bring, or your car.  If they are used to being on the furniture and you feel it would be difficult to keep them off,  please bring coverings to protect the furniture.
You must also please make sure your dogs don't bother the free ranging chickens across the road !!!   
I have a new Bernie-doodle puppy on the property ;)
description.neighborhood:
The GuestHouse is off a rural dirt road, 2mi from the town of Erin, NY.  The driveway is flat with plenty of parking.  The 2 other homes on the property are not visible, but are within a short walking distance.  The closest neighbor is .2mi away.  We're all friendly distant neighborly neighbors!
Erin is located at what I like to call the ‚Äúhub of the wheel‚Äù surrounded by Ithaca, Corning, Watkins Glen, Elmira, Sayre, and the Finger Lakes wineries, breweries, and parks.  Branch out to explore the Southern Tier and Finger Lakes, or visit for special events and locations such as the Finger Lakes Wine Festival, Watkins Glen Car Races, Cornell University,  Ithaca College,  Elmira College, and the Corning Glass Museum.
description.transit:
Park Hill Rd is a beautiful narrow two lane dirt road, off a state hwy.  In the spring it can be muddy and rutty during rainy weather.  In the winter, the town does a good job of keeping up with plowing and cindering.  It is not necessary to have 4wheel drive, but good tires are needed in winter and spring.
Uber will come to the GuestHouse!!
Bring hiking boots for getting around on the property!  And snow shoes for deep snow if you want to trek the woods,
description.interaction: Barb is available through texts or phone calls, and is happy to show you the highlights of the farm and how to walk the trails.  The on-site heritage turkey farm is unique in this country!
description.house_rules:
PET REQUESTS -
Dogs are not allowed on the sofas or beds.  If your dog is used to being on your furniture and will have a hard time staying off the Guesthouse furniture, please bring coverings to protect the beds and sofas.
There are free ranging chickens on our farm next door to the Guesthouse.  Please keep your dog contained to protect our chickens!!  
Thanks in advance for being responsible dog owners.  It's so fun to include our dogs and give them a country vacation too!!

hosts.about: Hello! I'm Lisa San Souci and I'll be your main point of contact.  My husband and I live in Bryson City with our 2 children. We designed, built and also manage all of our vacation homes.  It's truly our passion to help people have memorable getaways!
A single father who enjoys small town living in the Great Smoky Mountains.  I enjoy road and mountain biking the roads and trails in western North Carolina.

recent.comments: We had a great stay at Shipshak. Our location was great, so handy for Bryson City and yet so quiet as well. This is a great place to stay to explore the Smoky mountains and/or the Great Smoky Mountains Railroad.

items.comments: We had a great stay at Shipshak. Our location was great, so handy for Bryson City and yet so quiet as well. This is a great place to stay to explore the Smoky mountains and/or the Great Smoky Mountains Railroad.
The Ship Shak was so cute! The area felt safe. It‚Äôs is so close to downtown Bryson City!

Look no further!! This place was an Amazing stay for 2. River views were both beautiful and peaceful. The bed was really comfy, there was an ac, tv, fire place, everything was really thought through in the little container home.

Kyle and Lisa were wonderful hosts! They were attentive and made sure we made it in okay. Bryson City took me by surprise as there was so much fun things to do in a small town ! The home was perfect for the two of us. Make sure to check in the guest book next to the bed. We loved the hosts so much we booked another one of their property‚Äôs in the coming months. Recommend them to any one!

Perfect space to get away for a few days. It was the perfect size for my boyfriend and I. Equipped with everything you could need, the cutest little getaway. Would totally recommend anyone to stay here if the opportunity arises!
Amazing, great house to stay in great host.  No issues what so ever

Great location. Could walk to town to local restaurants or sit on the porch and watch the great Smokey mountain railroad driving by and watching the river. We will definitely visit again. 
It was a perfect stay!

description.summary: Stay ‚Äúinside the box", at our unique 20' shipping container. This studio space boasts gorgeous sweeping views of the Tuckasegee river. You may not want to leave the sounds and views of the river, even with charming downtown Bryson City less than one mile away and the entrance to the Great Smokies National Park with its walking trails and waterfalls only minutes away!
description.space:
Set on a beautiful river view property, our Shipping Container Studio home is the perfect location for your Bryson City getaway.  Watch the river go by from the comfortable chairs on the covered porch or fire pit area. The Great Smoky Mountains train, a scenic passenger train ride, also passes by a couple of times per day! 

Step inside the Ship Shak to discover a well appointed space, while small, has all the touches you expect:  a queen bed, kitchenette, flat screen internet TV, and a spacious bathroom with a shower.  

1 dog is allowed for a fee. Please review "house rules" for details.

What to Bring:
Firewood
charcoal
coffee for drip coffee pot
coffee condiments

*We provide a starter amount of toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags etc.  These are meant to last a day or two.  If you're booking a longer stay, you will want to bring more of these items.

* The kitchenette is equipped with dishes, utensils toaster oven, microwave, hot plate and some cookware.

*New queen mattress installed January 2023:)

Traveling with others? Check out our other homes located on this property.
*Time Flies on The River
  and
*Rivers Edge
airbnb.com/h/timefliesontheriver
airbnb.com/h/shipshak

Looking for something in Town?  Check out our downtown properties:
*Bryson City Tiny House 
 and
*The Bryson City Flat

Going tubing on Deep Creek?? Come see us at Deep Creek Lodge and Creekside Tubing!  We are located directly on the park boundary at 1881 Deep Creek Rd.  We offer tubing, food, ice, firewood, ice cream, bike rentals, Outpost store and a tubing discount for any of our Airbnb guests :). Tubing runs from Memorial Day to labor day.
description.notes:
1.  We have smart television which allows you to login to your favorite internet streaming provider.  We do provide You Tube TV service or you can watch the TV Plus app for free without a login.
2.  We do allow 1 dog for a fee.  Please review our house rules for those details.
3.  The kitchenette is has a microwave, toaster oven and hot plate for cooking inside.  The fire pit area outside contains a small charcoal grill and grilling grate that swings over the fire pit for cooking. You'll just need to bring along charcoal and firewood to complete the experience!
4. The Great Smoky Mountains railway runs in front of the property.  This is a scenic tourist train that runs during the day/evening/early night and is a big reason why people visit Bryson City.  It does not run during the night when people generally are sleeping.
5.  There are two other vacation rental dwellings on this property.  Each house has its own private outdoor space.
description.neighborhood: Ship Shak is located in the town of Bryson City but feels more remote and removed from town life.  You have access to Deep Creek, which is part of the Smoky Mountains  National Park, in minutes. AND! this location is less than a mile to the heart of downtown Bryson City.  It's really the best of both worlds! The house is located on the Tuckaseegee River with the Smoky Mountain Scenic Railroad and Old River Road fronting the property.  Guests enjoy watching the tourist train pass by, especially in November and December when it's decorated for the Polar Express!  Old River road is also a great resource offering  prime river access or take a leisure walk down the long dirt road!
description.transit: Getting Around:  Driving is our recommendation.  Biking and walking to town are options.  Be aware that there are not sidewalks between the house and town.  However, people do walk this section along the side of the road.  Traffic can be heavy along this stretch of road and the side of the road isn't well maintained.
description.interaction: The best way to be in touch with us is through the messaging center, but we are available via text or phone. Access for the Ship Shak Container home is through keypad door lock and allows for check in after hours.
description.house_rules:
Thank you for booking with us. Below are some common sense house rules that must be listed for Airbnb. We will also send you a standard Rental Agreement to sign upon booking that is required by the State of North Carolina for all short term rentals. 

1. Abide by the posted check-in and check-out times stated in the listing. Cleaners are working on a tight time table most days. Failure to follow this rule will result in a $60 per hour charge or partial hour charge. 
2. This is a no smoking property. You may smoke outside. All debris such as cigarette butt and related remains must be cleaned up and properly disposed of. Burn marks on the railings, outside furniture, etc. will result in additional charges. Smoking inside will result in immediate eviction and additional cleaning costs will be charged. 
3. Although this house is separate from the other buildings on the property, please respect the neighbors and keep music and outdoor noise from disturbing anyone. Quite hours are from 10pm-7am 
4. Dogs are allowed in some houses with prior approval. We are happy to be able to offer you accommodations that allow you to bring your Pup! We are dog lovers too and know what important family members they are. That said, please abide by our pet rules so that we may continue to offer dog friendly stays. Dogs are allowed for a fee. This fee helps pay for cleaning up pet hair. Any damage caused my your dog will be charged separately. *Guests must ensure that their dog(s) do not damage property, disturb the neighbors (barking etc), and please clean up after them on their walks. All pet refuse must be cleaned up by the guardian and properly disposed of. NO pets are allowed on the furniture at any time - for any reason! Any evidence of pets on the furniture will result in extra charges. If your pet needs to be crated when you are there or away to ensure they do not lay on the furniture or cause damage, then please bring a crate. We ask that they not be locked in the bathroom or other rooms for containment. Also, please do not bath your pet while staying here, as the hair creates drain problems. For homes with hot tubs, pets are not allowed in the hot tub. A $100 cleaning fee will be charged if there is evidence of them being in the hot tub. If the pet hair damages or breaks the hot tub, you will be responsible for replacement costs. All pets must be fully vaccinated and treated for fleas and ticks every month. Infestations resulting from an untreated pet will result in fees equal to or greater than what it costs for us to cover pest extermination charges. All dogs are required to be on leash and are never permitted to run loose. No biting dogs/pets are allowed on our property. Let us know if you are bringing your dog(s) prior to your arrival. The pet fee must be paid before check-out. We only allow dogs, no cats or other animals are allowed in our place. 
5. No rentals to people under 23 years of age unless accompanied by an adult or guardian. 
6. Each property will have reserved spaces for owner‚Äôs storage. Please be respectful and do not enter the private closets/cabinets. If you need something during your stay that is located in one of these areas, the owner may direct you to pull something from their storage but you are not permitted to do so without permission. 
7. Dispose of all trash in either the indoor or outdoor provided trash cans. If your stay is longer and the garbage cans fill, you can take your waste to the Swain Co. trash dump located on highway 19 just past the Ingles grocery store.
8. Leave the property orderly and undamaged 
9. Additional charges may result from but are not limited to the following the following:
damage caused to the property 
pet waste
human waste/vomit/excrement  
glitter 
silly string 
wax 
BB's 
paint ball 
rearranging furniture 
foul or excessive garbage left behind 
pets on furniture 
cigarette smoke/burns
pets in the hot tub or showers/bath tubs 
Noise disturbances 
Police involvement 
internet tv purchases 
10. We are happy to mail back items left behind for the cost of shipping plus a $20 service charge. 


CHECK OUT INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Clean and put away dishes. Do a thorough job so they are properly cleaned for the next guest :) 
2. Place dirty towels, bath cloths and dish cloths in the tub/shower.  Ensure all linens are accounted for.  Any missing, damaged, stained linens will result in request of replacement costs
3. Put all trash in garbage cans outside.  There are also large square garbage cans by our pump house for your use
4. Make sure coffee pot, stove and other appliances are turned off 
5. Remove all personal items including food you may have placed in the refrigerator or cabinets 
6. Leave the property orderly and neat 
7. Report any damage or lost items before check-out 
8.  If any furniture or other items were moved, put them back in their original place
9. Turn off lights
10. Lock the doors and windows

 Legal Stuff - Tenant agrees to hold harmless Agent and Owner from and against any liability for personal injury or property damage sustained by any person (including Tenant‚Äôs guests) as a result of any cause, use of hot tub, loft, fire pit or any other amenity provided, unless caused by the negligent or willful act of the Agent or the Owner or the failure of the Agent of the Owner to comply with the North Carolina Vacation Rental Act.  Tenant agrees that Agent or Owner or their respective representatives may enter the Property during reasonable hours to inspect the Property, to make such repairs, alterations, or improvements as Agent or Owner may deem appropriate, or to show the Property to prospective purchaser or tenants.  Tenant shall not assign this Agreement or sublet the Property in whole or part without written permission of Agent or Owner.

Mom + daughter duo 
Asheville, NC natives

recent.comments: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was perfect! Kathy + Kaycie were very responsive when we had questions about things. The view is wonderful and you are tucked away on a mountain. It is about a 25-30 minute drive to downtown Asheville but it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We loved it!

items.comments: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was perfect! Kathy + Kaycie were very responsive when we had questions about things. The view is wonderful and you are tucked away on a mountain. It is about a 25-30 minute drive to downtown Asheville but it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We loved it!
would love to book again! absolutely loved the location and how clean the home was. would recommend!

I‚Äôm a travel nurse that stopped here for a night on the way back to the coast of NC from the Midwest and this was EXACTLY what I needed. The place is secluded and private and quiet during the nights. It was super clean and was easy to use all the amenities. I was able to sleep without a white noise machine because the summer cicadas were so loud and peaceful. I even left some of my stuff in my car overnight and felt safe as a solo traveler. Thank you guys for the best one night stay I could have asked for on my way home. I‚Äôll definitely try to stay here more often during my trips back and forth to the Midwest!
Pristine, quiet spot, perched perfectly in the mountains.  It was exactly what we needed, and only a 20 minute drive to Asheville.
We loved everything about our stay! The home over looking the mountains was magical and home was perfect for a peaceful getaway.

Lovely new guest house in the woods. We had a delightful stay here and really enjoyed the pristine home and modern decor. It was out of a magazine! We hiked outside a Asheville, rode horses, ate delicious food and came back to this phenomenal home each day. Will book again!!
Great spot, very peaceful location, fantastic for a relaxing getaway

description.summary:
Want to be totally immersed in nature?  Your 289 sqft mountain escape is literally in the middle of the woods.

Your huge deck and cozy hot tub have a panoramic nature view with a seating area, fire table, and grill.

We opened mid November 2022 and are enjoying every guest we've hosted.

Traveling with friends, family or need more space? Check out all of our listings located on the same mountain!

Follow us on Insta - @stayinavl
description.space:
Your 289sqft home includes a cozy living room, a kitchen with frig, one burner cooktop and microwave, dining bar, bath, and bedroom with 40" Smart TV. Living room windows look directly at the treetops.

The bathroom has a fully tiled shower, heated floors, and fluffy robes as you step outside the shower. 

You will enjoy your huge deck in the middle of the woods. The hot tub is ready for you!  You have a cozy seating area, a propane fire table to warm your toes, and a grill to cook an amazing meal to be enjoyed on the deck or at the dining bar.  

A spare propane tank is available at the end of your parking spot in case the fire table or grill run out of propane during your visit.  

You will see a Ring camera pointing at outdoor entrance and road.

Your home is very modern. White walls and great decor welcome you into your living space.  Living area has a two person leather couch with a fuzzy couch throw for those chilly winter nights. Your 40" TV in the bedroom completes the setting for a relaxing night at home.  
You have total privacy once you arrive so we don't have window coverings.  Your total glass front oasis is too gorgeous to cover with shades.  

Your queen size bed has 100% cotton sheets and a duvet cover for your fluffy down comforter.  Two firm bamboo pillows and two soft pillows complete the equation for a restful and relaxing night. 

You will see three other homes as you drive to your tiny house.  We have a long term renter on a separate portion of the property with his own driveway. You may occasionally hear when he plays his guitar. You will pass another vacation rental on your way and then about 1/4 mile further down the driveway you will come to your private vacation rental. The road to your place is a Two Way road so please take it slow in case another car is on it's way in or out.

Gentle reminder that no type of smoking is allowed and pets are not allowed.  There will be a $325 ionization fee is smoking occurs.  Thanks for being considerate of our home!

We are in the middle of nature, so be prepared to share space with deer, bear, snakes, coyotes, bugs, and fireflies.

All linens are provided- we have thought of everything for your stay - but of course let us know if you need anything at all to complete your amazing stay in our beautiful mountains.

A couple of resources for your Asheville visit: romanticasheville on Insta and AVL Ride for your transportation needs.
description.access:
You have private access to the entire tiny house and the outside area. 

Your space only allows 2 people, and additional guests or visitors cannot be accommodated at any time during your visit.  You have gravel parking spots for two cars.

For our winter guests: snow is absolutely gorgeous in Asheville!  Sitting in the hot tub surrounded by snow is an incredible and relaxing experience. IF it snows during your stay, you won't be able to drive in and out and will need to park at the top of the driveway and walk about 400 yards to get to your home. Occasionally we have snow and ice that causes power to go out, and your well pump will not work without power, so you will not have water.  If this happens for a prolonged period of time, you're welcome to leave with a refund for any unused nights. Of course, let us know if either of these items would be a problem for you during our rare snowstorms, and we'll work with you.

For those who might not be used to driving in our beautiful mountains, the best way to climb out of the driveway is to put your vehicle in the lowest gear possible, gain a bit of momentum, then stay at that same momentum until you reach the paved flat spot near the top of the driveway.
description.notes:
Brand New Construction November 2022.

We have DirectTV and AT&T Internet.  Internet speed is usually between 5-10 MBps. You'll be able to check email, use social media, etc.  Working from this location is not recommended IF you need a super fast connection.

We have family members with severe allergies to smoke and pets, so unfortunately, we will have to charge a $350 ionization fee if either occurs.  Thanks for being considerate of our home!
description.neighborhood:
Your tiny home is on 4.5 acres shared by one other tiny home and our long term renter, Rob.   Once you get to your vacation spot, you have total privacy.  When you sit in the hot tub, you will feel like you're sitting in the middle of the treetops.

When we timed the drive, it took  20 minutes to get to the French Broad Chocolate Lounge in the center of downtown Asheville, and should be on your list of places to visit!  

You will see a Ring camera pointing at the walkway and road. 

The Blue Ridge Parkway entrance is 15 minutes away.  Cataloochee Ski Resort is 45 minutes away.  Max Patch is a must for those who love to hike.  We are 20-25 minutes from the Biltmore Estate.  For Christmas visitors, Biltmore is a must!  For those visiting in the Spring, make a plan to see the tulips, and Jazz Festivals at the Winery.  Fall Concerts at the Estate are so much fun!

For adventure seekers, Navitat Ziplining is a blast - you truly zipline through trees! And of course white water rafting is close by.
description.transit: Uber, Lyft, and AVLRide are available.  Car recommended.
description.house_rules: No Smoking. No Pets.

name: Happy Shack Mtnside-HIKER‚ÄôS HIDEAWAY ü•æ‚õ∞
title: Franklin, North Carolina

gallery.caption: View from the firepit area

hosts.about: Hi! My name is Natalie. My husband & I are Realtors and investors in the Tampa Bay Area and we own four ‚ÄúHappy Shacks‚Äù in some of our favorite spots that we like to spend time in. Happy Shack Ybor, Tampa, FL, Happy Shack Beachside-Treasure Island/Sunset Beach, FL & our tiny homes; Happy Shack Mountainside/Stargazer and Hiker's Hideaway located in Franklin, NC! We love the city, the vibe at the beach & we love to escape to nature in the mountains.

recent.comments: We definitely enjoyed our stay at Natalie's. It was a great base location from which to explore the area - including a stop at the local Mexican place in Franklin - don't let the location fool you (it's in a truck behind the Ingles.) The food was SOOOOOO good and they were great folks to chat with! The tiny house was a peaceful respite with deer passing through the backyard in the morning as we sipped our coffee. Hope to be back again soon!

items.comments: We definitely enjoyed our stay at Natalie's. It was a great base location from which to explore the area - including a stop at the local Mexican place in Franklin - don't let the location fool you (it's in a truck behind the Ingles.) The food was SOOOOOO good and they were great folks to chat with! The tiny house was a peaceful respite with deer passing through the backyard in the morning as we sipped our coffee. Hope to be back again soon!

This is definitely a spot that's meant for hikers & those who will be out and about for their stay near Franklin! It was a perfect fit for 2 people and the beds slept comfortably. The outdoor relaxation spots are unique, beautiful & private. 

If you are going to Franklin to spend time in the airbnb, this may not be the best fit for you. If you rent this tiny home to be outdoors and relax outdoors, I would suggest this space because of the fire pit, grill, corn hole, and big family style dinner table outside (right in the valley). 

Cool spot overall, but definitely meant for the renter that will be going & exploring.
Perfect little mountain retreat! Great birthday getaway. So peaceful and private! Cozy feels but spacious for a tiny house!
Natalie‚Äôs Place was a spectacular place to stay. We loved everything about it. We highly recommend staying there and we will consider staying again.

I loved Natalie's place. It was beautifully tucked away in back of the wooded area.  It was serene and the sounds of nature was amazing. I woke up to deer in the area and it was peaceful to just watch them forge and graze. 

The tiny house so my style with the decor and furniture. I could see myself living in her home, for sure.  We did not bring my kids with us on this trip, but my husband and I can see our girls hanging out in the loft area. 

Natalie was responsive, informative of all the activities and surrounding areas. I never been to NC. I was looking to decompress and align my soul with God and Source, and I found that in her beautiful space.

I know it has been mentioned,  the internet would be an issue, and while internet would be great to have, I understand the circumstances of the situation as well.  This was a minor minor cink in the trip, it wouldn't change my mind of returning.

Location was ideal! Hiker's Hideway was private and offered great accommodations. Sitting on the covered porch in the morning with coffee was so peaceful. The gazebo and fire pit in the evening was incredibly relaxing. 

Absolutely recommend!
The hikers getaway was a gem hidden in the mountains, peaceful and breathtaking.

description.summary: Welcome to Happy Shack Mountainside Hiker‚Äôs Hideaway!! She may be tiny but she packs a big punch! Our tiny home is located in a small tiny -home community called Bear Pen Cove in Franklin, NC. Just 12 minutes from downtown Franklin, yet you are in your own peaceful world in the woods with gorgeous long-range mountain views! Your home base when exploring the Great Smoky Mountains. Perched on the back ridge of the community on 4.73 acres of land w/long-range mountain views. You will fall in love.
description.space:
The Happy Shack Mountainside-Hiker‚Äôs Hideaway is a brand new tiny house vacation rental available for you!  The home is nestled in up on a ridge at the very back of a tiny home community.  We designed the firepit area to be a magical and natural oasis for you to enjoy with a gazebo made out of trees from our land, a swing, a corn hole area and even a nature picnic table. 
In late summer we will be building a deck on the front of the home which will provide even more outdoor enjoyment. 

As you may already know, while in the mountains you can lose cell service, although our cell and personal hotspots work just fine (AT+T). We do have LIMITED WIFI. We encourage our guests to utilize their own personal hotspots as we only have limited WiFi, just 100mb of WIFI per month via a hot spot at the tiny. 

Treat this time as a true getaway and try to unplug, get out and explore nature! 

Also, please note and print out the directions that we send to you. Our home is not located via GPS, so the directions will take you to a church that is located just before you turn down the hill into the community. We provide detailed instructions on how to navigate up to the tiny home. ;)
description.access: When entering the community, please remember that you cannot see our tiny from the entrance. You have to drive up a steep hill to get to it. Also, please note that there are permanent residences here, so please DO NOT STOP at any of the private residences.  Do not stop at the first home that you see on your left or at any of the other tiny homes. We want to keep our neighborhood as peaceful and as private as possible. Hiker‚Äôs Hideaway is the very last home in the community and tucked into the back ridge. Please not that when you park, you will need to reverse straight back and turn around to head back down the hill to depart. We do not have a circular drive.
description.notes:
Absolutely NO PETS. Due to the owner‚Äôs severe allergies and asthma and our past experiences with our other rentals with guests sneaking in pets, we have to enforce a strict $500 fine for any signs of pets. 

Same goes for smoking and vaping. No smoking in or on the property. Any evidence of will result in a $500 fine.
description.neighborhood: Hiker‚Äôs Hideaway is located in a quaint tiny house community called Bear Pen Cove.  We are just 12 minutes from downtown Franklin where there are shops, grocery stores, coffee shops, breweries and more. There are approximately 30 tiny homes speckled throughout the community. Most of the homes are in the lower valley and our home is located up a steep hill on the back ridge of the community. There are just 7 tiny homes on the back ridge and we own 4.75 acre as with just two homes on the acreage, Hiker‚Äôs Hideaway and Stargazer, so there is plenty of room to roam around and hike up the steep ridge, if you choose to do so.
description.transit: You will need a car that can handle a steep hill. There is no turn-around on our lot for parking, so you will have to back up and angle around to depart.
description.interaction: We will be texting you the day of your arrival to provide the access details. If there is an emergency, feel free to text or call us.
description.house_rules: NO PETS. NO SMOKING OR VAPING. $500 fee if evidence of.  NO SHOES INSIDE. MUST WAS DISHES PRIOR TO DEPARTING. $25 FEE FOR LEAVING DIRTY DISHES.

name: Shiva Tiny Home ~ Outdoor waterfall shower
title: Alachua, Florida

recent.comments: This was a amazing stay the outdoor shower was great and it has hot water and a good grounding experience with nature we loved the tiny house the inside is perfect and they have two tiny homes next to each other with their own private yard and entrance so it‚Äôs great if you want to bring another couple and still have privacy.

items.comments: This was a amazing stay the outdoor shower was great and it has hot water and a good grounding experience with nature we loved the tiny house the inside is perfect and they have two tiny homes next to each other with their own private yard and entrance so it‚Äôs great if you want to bring another couple and still have privacy.
This was one of our favorite stays on our trip! We stayed here to be close to high springs to kayak and it worked perfectly for us.
The home was lovely
This place is beautiful and the host are awesome. Will be coming back again for sure. Don‚Äôt think twice just book it!
It was our second time here and will continue to be our spot when visiting the springs.

Definitely enjoyed my stay!!! I was passing through from Miami to Atlanta and just needed a place to lay my head. I actually received more than that!! It was so peaceful and beautiful!!! I enjoyed a nice walk with my fur baby, sat out in the private yard with all the beautiful plants and pond. I especially enjoyed the outdoor shower ü•∞

I would definitely stay here again if passing through!

The tiny house was nice. I did not know it was in someone‚Äôs back yard and beside other tiny homes. The trailer in front of the tiny home has children and they played outside in the pool during the day loudly. We only stayed one night so we didn‚Äôt need much. If your like me and like to clean a little upon arrivals advise bring your own stuff because there was nothing in the house. Also bring your own blow dryer! Overall it wasn‚Äôt a bad experience.

description.summary:
SHIVA TINY HOME by Simplify Further ~ find us on IG for more pics/tours @simplifyfurther

Enjoy your own tiny home experience.

+Built in April 2022.

+10x16ft tiny house on wheels.

+Nearby to shops, restaurants, and cafes.

+Centrally located between Gainesville & High Springs.

+20 minutes to stunning, freshwater blue springs.

Is Shiva booked for your dates? Check out our other listings! Booking with a group? Parvati Tiny Home is located on the same property.
description.space:
Shiva is a 10x16ft tiny home on wheels with a queen bed in the loft and a rooftop patio. Our tiny homes are designed with height in mind so that people of all sizes will be comfortable walking around in the tiny homes.

This tiny home features a kitchenette with a 2 burner cooktop stove, including all the pots, pans, silverware, utensils and dishes you will need. The kitchen has a mini fridge and a stainless still sink.

The common area includes 2 cushioned benches for seating with a coffee table, a leaf kitchen table with two barstools, and bar window seating with 2 additional barstools.

The bathroom includes a standard flush toilet, mini sink, and full sized bath tub with shower head.

Enjoy your stay with all the basic amenities you will need such as bed linens and bath towels.

Please note that this tiny house is meant to be a fun and unique living space. It is not accessible for people with mobility issues and it is not particularly safe for children. 

Shiva Tiny home is located on a residential property with a main house and one other tiny home (Parvati Tiny Home).

Parking is available on the grass along the road or you can pull through the grass and park right next to Shiva.
description.access: You will have the whole tiny home to yourself!
description.neighborhood:
Alachua is a small town in northern central Florida. Our property is just a 15 minute walk to downtown Alachua where guests can find quaint shops and restaurants. We are a 5 minute drive from I-75 and Publix grocery store.

We are a 15-20 minute drive to Gainesville where guests can find all the shops, restaurants, malls, and entertainment they could need.

Just 20 minutes drive away guests will delight themselves by taking a swim in Florida's natural springs or rivers. Nearby are Gilchrist Blue Springs, Poe Springs, Head Springs, Ginnie Springs, and several others. Ichetucknee River is a beautiful 40 minute drive away where guests can float down for a relaxing day on a raft or inner tube.
description.transit:
We are walking distance from convenient stores such as Walgreens and CVS, gas stations, coffee shops, and small mom&pop shops.

Walkable food locations are Moe's Southwest Grill, Domino's pizza, and Mi Apa Latin Cafe.

Other than walkable places, guests will need a car for transportation as public transport is not readily available in Alachua.
description.interaction: We are just a short message away to help with anything guests may need!
description.house_rules:
No cooking of meat or fish on the property.  Vegetarian cooking only. 

Please remove your shoes upon entering the tiny home.

If you bring a pet please bring a blanket or towel from home to cover the couch or rug before allowing the pets to lay on it.

No pets in the beds.

Please pick up after your pets in the yard. Leaving behind waste from pets can result in an additional $20 clean up fee.

name: Cabin 1: Horses & Hot Tubs on Perry Lake
title: Brandon Township, Michigan

gallery.caption: A new hot tub sits right outside your door.
Meeting our horses is a highlight for many guests.
The primary bedroom is outfitted with a new Queen-sized Casper mattress, premium triple sheets, and a quilt.
An easy hike to our private dock provides access to Perry Lake.
Sleep under the stars in our queen-sized sleeper sofa.

The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans, and utensils for using the induction cooktop or microwave to prepare meals. A pancake griddle, an air fryer, or a crock pot can be delivered upon request.
A sleeping area with a queen-sized bed is at one end of the cabin and can be partitioned by pulling a curtain across the entry.
The kitchen is stocked with everything you need to enjoy a day or two away.
We are an adults-only property except for these special dates. Check the website for fun programming and kid-friendly activities that are offered during our Family Farm Days.

hosts.about: Fellow traveler and proud steward of Stillwater Stables, a 60-acre Scandinavian-inspired retreat dedicated to hiking, paddling, and horsing around.

recent.comments: Beautiful location and space! We celebrated our engagement here. Made great use of the hot tub at night and enjoyed the peaceful quiet surroundings. Even though there are two other cabins close by, the layout is intentional so we barely even saw or noticed them. It felt super private, and the space was clean and unique. Highly recommend as a fun/romantic getaway!

items.comments: Beautiful location and space! We celebrated our engagement here. Made great use of the hot tub at night and enjoyed the peaceful quiet surroundings. Even though there are two other cabins close by, the layout is intentional so we barely even saw or noticed them. It felt super private, and the space was clean and unique. Highly recommend as a fun/romantic getaway!
Rachel was kind, friendly, helpful. A fun getaway away from the standard busyness of life. Absolutely beautiful surroundings!

I stayed here for a few days with my wife on our honeymoon. The stay was absolutely wonderful, the house was cozy and clean and overlooked an amazing forest. Rachel was kind enough to not only let us visit the horses but walk them around and even let us feed them with her. It was a quick and easy walk to the lake through the woods and was an all around 5/5 star experience.
I had a great stay with my girlfriend at a very needed time for relaxing and getting away from our problems with work
We really enjoyed our stay and felt very relaxed. This is a great space!

Great place!!
Will definitely come back
Beautiful property.  Stylish and modern container home with amazing views. Tucked enough away to feel like secluded but a 15 min dirt rd drive away from a nice town

description.summary:
This is one of 4 guest cabins on the property. We are an adults-only venue except for special Family Weeks. Check out the images to see our kid-friendly dates.

The High Line cabin is an upcycled shipping container located on The Ridge section of the property. It's cantilevered above an old-growth forest, perched  70‚Äô above Perry Lake. Finished in 2022, the premium interior feels fresh and modern. Guests enjoy lake access, encounters with horses, bird watching, and acres of hiking trails.
description.space:
Your cabin is an upcycled shipping container. Brand new in 2022, its clever design is stocked with goodies like heated towel bars, quartz countertops, and fast WiFi. Huge, fixed windows make it feel light and modern (but don‚Äôt worry‚Ä¶ there are shades in case you need a break from all that nature!). Around you are a mix of open horse pastures, densely wooded trails, and a natural lakefront. 

This cabin is nearby other units but has been carefully placed to offer a private, 360-degree view of the surrounding wilderness.

Stillwater Stables also hosts a revolving art show; guests will find their cabins filled with original art from local artists that is available for sale.
description.access: Guests can enjoy the trails that wind throughout the property and can access the lake via our new dock. There‚Äôs also a paddle boat available to use.
description.notes: Your cabin is tucked into the woods! It gets dark and the footing can be tricky so please try to check in during daylight hours. If this is not possible, let us know and we will assist you.
description.neighborhood: As I bet you can imagine - our farm is located in a rural area! Expect to drive about 2 miles along a dirt road before you arrive at the turn into our driveway, which is almost a quarter mile long.
description.transit:
Your car will be the best way to explore the area. 

Also, we have a private ride service provider (a former Uber and Lyft driver) that services the farm. Please request that information after booking.
description.interaction: We live on the property so you'll likely see us around! We are happy to greet you, share time with the horses, or answer any questions you have, but otherwise expect to have a very quiet and private experience.
description.house_rules:
Special Events and Commercial Use:

For extra guests, special events, or commercial use - please reach out to us while booking to discuss your plans. Additional fees, permits, or accommodations might be required. 

Read This Before Entering the Hot Tub:

The detergents, oils, and chemicals found in body lotions, deodorants, and makeup will clog the spa filters and foul the water so you must remove these before entering. If special cleaning is needed to restore the spa water after your stay, then a materials fee of $75 will be assessed along with any additional costs resulting from issuing refunds or cancellations to the guests who are scheduled to arrive after you (and who will not be able to use the hot tub due to this servicing).

Neutral Scent Policy:

We aim to provide a scent-neutral environment to ensure that each guest experiences a healthy, comfortable, and enjoyable stay. Please respect the next visitor by not using heavy perfumes, medicinal oils, cannabis, or air fresheners.  Burning, vaporizing, smoking, diffusing, or cooking anything that can be detected in the air or on the fabrics after your departure could violate this policy and you may be charged up to a $250 restoration fee.

name: Forest Haven - Ela
title: Millersburg, Ohio

hosts.about: Hi! We are a family that has many passions, but a few of the ones that make us come alive the most are relationships, designing and hospitality, so this is a dream come true for us. We love nature, so we'll often be outside hiking, camping  or relaxing on our front porch. We love cooking, reading, making wood fired pizzas, traveling and learning. We have all personality types in our family, so there is never a dull moment!  When we travel we love finding unique airbnb places to stay. No boring hotel rooms for us! A few of our favorite destinations are Tulumn, Mexico, New River Gorge, West Virginia, The Highway 1 on the California coast. There's nothing like cruising down the highway in a convertible, with the fresh, piney smell of the Redwoods , and the wild crashing of the ocean and the moisture of the ocean in the air! We love life, and God has richly blessed us with one that is rich in experience, and we want to pass it on to you while you stay in our little corner of the world.

recent.comments: Simply Amazing!  Incredible Stay!

items.comments: Simply Amazing!  Incredible Stay!
The place and location were beautiful and peaceful.  A great place to relax and enjoy nature.
We loved it

This was amazing . Just as gorgeous as I saw in photos. Charming decor and attention to detail . Graciously allowing our dogs ( for which we took extra care and have extra gratitude).  A gorgeous sanctuary from the every day grind. My husband said this has been the most relaxing vacation weve had in a long time
Everything was perfect, place was super neat. Beautiful scenery.
Wonderful stay, I‚Äôm still dreaming of that soaking tub!

This is a wonderful place for a relaxing getaway. It feels remote and has privacy in the woods with an amazing view of the valley from the nearby overlook. We enjoyed using the outdoor shower and HUGE tub. There was plenty of hot water. We enjoyed the outdoor gas fire pit - perfect at night when the temperature cools down. Although it felt remote, it is located just down the road from the restaurants Der Dutchman and Rebecca's Bistro. We ate at both during our stay and were very happy with the convenience of good restaurants so near our Airbnb. This was the perfect stay for my husband and me - relaxing and giving us a chance to appreciate nature without having to rough it. We hadn't realized that there was an indoor shower at this location as well, so there are three bathing options at this one tiny container house.

description.summary: As you descend the stairway into the woods you'll begin to experience the peace of Ela, one of two small shipping containers set into a clearing in the forest. The outdoor living space has lounging seats, chairs, natural gas fire pit, outdoor shower and an outdoor soaking tub! The inside of Ela is designed with the colors and textures of nature, seamlessly blending with the surroundings, but furnished with luxury linens and all the comforts of home! Check the list of amenities to see it all!
description.space:
This is a 20 foot shipping container home with a large outdoor living area!  There's an outdoor soaking tub, shower, lounge seats, and chairs around a natural gas fire pit! The perfect romantic hideaway for 2!

Pets are not allowed on our beds and there will be a $20 fee added per bed if there is evidence of pets on the beds.
description.access: When you get to the address you'll see a long concrete driveway going down through orchard. Follow that down until you see a gravel driveway going off to the right, you'll see 2 huge oak trees with signs for Dwell Box parking. Park there, and as you continue on down the driveway you'll see a staircase with lights heading down into the woods. Follow that staircase down and Ela is to the right. Enjoy!
description.neighborhood: Walnut Creek is an amazing little town that is very safe!  Filled with hardworking down earth people that will welcome you while you stay!
description.interaction: We are always available to answer questions, but will give you space if you desire no contact! The day of arrival you will receive a message about check in details!
description.house_rules: 10pm to 9am quiet hours. Please keep outside noise to a minimum during that time so everyone has peace!

name: New Modern shipping container home with hot tub
title: McArthur, Ohio

recent.comments: The place itself was cute and clean.  It was a little hard to find but when i called they were happy to help. The area didn‚Äôt feel safe for me. Confederate flags, F Joe Biden flags everywhere. Trucks and cars with no mufflers were driving by often and at night. We ended up leaving the location two days earlier than expected, but the owner was responsive and refunded me for one day. If this place was in a better location, i would have given a much better review

items.comments: The place itself was cute and clean.  It was a little hard to find but when i called they were happy to help. The area didn‚Äôt feel safe for me. Confederate flags, F Joe Biden flags everywhere. Trucks and cars with no mufflers were driving by often and at night. We ended up leaving the location two days earlier than expected, but the owner was responsive and refunded me for one day. If this place was in a better location, i would have given a much better review

The Airbnb was extremely cute, as well as throughly cleaned. The host was also responsive no matter the hour of the day, and very friendly!! This was my first Airbnb experience and it is safe to say I now have high expectations!! I would absolutely recommend this stay to anyone in the hocking hills area.üòå
Great Place! A bit far from some activities but overall a great place and time!

Great place to stay. Close enough to all the hiking that hocking hills has to offer but far enough away to stay away from traffic. My wife and I enjoyed staying in the shipping container house and it was just the right size for the two of us. The house had everything you could need, besides and oven,  to cook there instead of going out to eat.
We enjoyed our stay. Everything was very clean. The couch futon bed was not comfortable for sleeping, but that is to be expected for a futon bed. The queen size bed was very comfortable.

Wonderful stay! Everything as advertised and a short trot from all attractions. It was nice to hike and explorer than drive back to our comfy stay. Will definitely return. Amazing way to spend my 30th birthday.

I highly recommend this location. It is close to all of the activities to enjoy in hocking hills. There is an amazing winery within walking distance. It‚Äôs clean. It‚Äôs comfortable. It‚Äôs quiet. When it was time to check out and go home I didn‚Äôt want to leave!

description.summary:
For a stunning and unique vacation getaway, The Siverly House has so much to offer. 

This brand new one-bedroom, one-bath modern shipping container home offers 3  French doors,  high ceilings, and lots of windows for a spacious and modern feel.

Step from your cozy bedroom suite onto the private deck to enjoy a relaxing evening soaking in the 3-person Hot tub while taking in the stunning night sky or stroll over to the tasting room at Le Petit Chevalier vineyard and winery right next door.
description.space:
Spend the day kayaking, canoeing, swimming, or fishing on lake Logan (34 min. drive) or lake hope(24 min. drive)

Only 10 minutes to Ash Cave, 19 minutes to Old Mans Cave, and just a short drive to many other outdoor excursions that Hocking Hills and Vinton county has to offer.

‚Ä¢ Well-equipped kitchen (full-sized refrigerator with ice maker, 2 burner  cooktop,  hood range,  microwave, toaster, coffee pot, blender, glassware, dishware, silverware, pots, pans, and cooking utensils)
‚Ä¢ 2-person high-top bar
‚Ä¢ All linens and towels provided
‚Ä¢ 1-Bedroom with a queen-size bed with large windows
‚Ä¢ High-Speed Internet
‚Ä¢ 43" smart tv in the living area 
   (login to your favorite streaming service)
‚Ä¢ USB charging station in the bedroom and living room
‚Ä¢ Spacious bathroom (with rain shower head, hair dryer, Anti fog mirror, shampoo,  conditioner, body wash, and hand soap)
‚Ä¢ Sofa bed (The back reclines into a full-sized sleeper.)
‚Ä¢ Air Conditioning / Heating 
‚Ä¢ Large 10'x40' Deck
‚Ä¢ Outdoor dining table with umbrella
‚Ä¢ BBQ Gas Grill (propane included)
‚Ä¢ 3-person hot tub with easy lift cover
‚Ä¢ Fire pit area 
‚Ä¢ Firewood is available on-site and can be purchased for $5.00 a bucket.
‚Ä¢ Fun games like chess/checkers, corn hole, playing cards

There is No Smoking anywhere inside the house or on the deck area. A $200 fine will be charged if this house rule is broken.
description.access: Guest have full access to the private parking, home, deck, and hot tub.
description.notes:
Holiday checkouts are restricted:

At The Siverly House, we deeply care about our team's well-being and work-life balance. As part of our commitment to promoting a positive and healthy work environment, we have implemented a policy to not allow holiday checkouts.

What This Means for You: 
During holiday periods, we kindly ask that our guests refrain from scheduling checkouts on the holiday itself.  Instead, we encourage you to plan your checkout day around the holiday, allowing our team and fellow guests to enjoy the holiday as well.

Our Commitment to Quality: 
Please rest assured that our commitment to providing exceptional service remains unwavering. while we won't be facilitating checkouts on holidays, our team will still be available to assist with any inquiries or issues that may arise during your holiday stay with us.

Thank you for your understanding and support in our effort to prioritize the well-being of our team members. We firmly believe that fostering a positive work environment translates into a better experience for you, our valued guests.

Warm regards,
The Siverly House Team
description.neighborhood: In the Heart of Hocking Hills
description.house_rules: The hot tub cover must be closed and corners latched when not in use.  This will prevent access from curious children and wind from blowing the cover away.

name: Mountain Getaway Cabin in Hocking Hills
title: Hocking Hills, Ohio

gallery.caption: Hocking Hills Getaway
Hocking Hills Cabin in the Woods
Modern Mountain Cabin
Airbnb Hocking Hills
Hocking Hills Modern Cabin

hosts.about: Hi everyone!  We are Vicki, John & Audrey and we live in Northern Ohio.  We love real estate and investment properties.  We fell in love with Hocking Hills, Ohio and thought it would be fun to buy some property and build a spectacular house with luxury accommodations and up to date features - so we did!  Come check it out!

recent.comments: Beautiful cabin! Very clean with new amenities.

items.comments: Beautiful cabin! Very clean with new amenities.

Awesome stay with my adult kids to celebrate my birthday. This truly feels like a retreat...very peaceful, well maintained & private. Love walking right up the road outside the home to see beautiful cliffs and a "cave house". Plenty of room to spread out for 7 of us & plenty of space to all gather. LOVE this place! Highly recommend!!

Vicki and John were great to work with! They answered all of my questions in a timely manner and were very helpful. The cabin is a gem! Absolutely beautiful with stunning views. The cabin is equipped with everything that you need and more! It was a very comfortable and relaxing stay. We will definitely be back!

Wonderful Location and beautiful place! The space was perfect for our seven guests! The outside areas were our favorite. We had the added bonus of watching a night time thunderstorm from the incredible porch. This place was well stocked and had everything you needed for the perfect stay! We were close to all the hiking around hocking hills!
Such a beautiful place!
Location was great, house was spectacular. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for anything more. I‚Äôd highly recommend a stay here.

This cabin was wonderful!  It was exactly as the pictures represented and had every amenity we needed.  We had a beautiful girls weekend celebrating each other and this cabin was the perfect place to have a relaxing weekend.  Location wise it was about 20-30 minutes from most of the major attractions in the Hocking Hills area, including restaurants.  However, I feel that the trade off for the tranquility of the area was well worth having to drive a short while for those things.
I can not stress enough how lovely it was to have the top deck where we could hang out and enjoy ourselves during the day, and then when the insects became too much at night the screened lower deck to continue enjoying nature at night.  We also used the lower deck to have a yoga class, which was amazing with fans to cool us and the birds providing the soundtrack.
The kitchen was well stocked.  The bed linens were comfortable and there were plenty of towels that were ready and clean for us.  Loved this place!

description.summary: Enjoy a modern mountain cabin in Hocking Hills, Ohio that showcases luxurious accommodations while being surrounded by the still quietness of nature. A home that comfortably sleeps up to 8 with two master king suites and a lower level bedroom with 3 full size beds with separate full bath. Two separate inside living areas each with large flat screen Smart tvs, wifi throughout the home.
description.space:
Two sprawling upper and lower decks.¬† ¬†Feel like you are in the treetops on the upper deck while dining, reading, enjoying the gas fire or absorbing nature while relaxing in an adirondack chair from high above.¬†The screened in lower level boasts a hot tub, ping pong, corn hole, ample seating and another cozy gas fireplace.

A firepit for roasting s'mores or simply relaxing to the sounds of a crackling fire is also provided.¬† A starter set of firewood and fire starters are provided for each stay.

The cabin is equipped with a self check- in via a remote keypad entry. A 4 digit key code will be provided prior to your reservation.

I'll Have S'More cabin has a private driveway with plenty of parking for the specified number of guests. Snow plow service is provided but an all wheel drive or 4 wheel drive vehicle is recommended during snow/winter season.

The cabin is professionally cleaned with environmentally friendly natural cleaning products.

An exclusive line of natural hygiene products (body wash, conditioning shampoo, and dishwashing soap) are provided for guests.

The kitchen is fully stocked with all the kitchen necessities: pots/pans, bakeware, utensils, blender, toaster, etc. needed to provide whatever level of meal you and your guests choose to prepare.¬†

There is plenty of hiking on the almost 4 acres provided at the I'll Have S'More property.¬† A tranquil meadow area with flowing creek on the front side of the property and breathtaking, beautiful rock formations abound the back hillside of the property.

We want you to enjoy the beautiful nature, exploration, quietness and rest provided at the I'll Have S'More cabin.
description.access:
24 hours prior to check in guests are provided with the physical address of the property and their unique 4 digit code to access the programmable front door lock during their stay.  No hassle with arriving prior to an office closing to acquire the keys.

There is plenty of hiking on the almost 4 acres provided at the I'll Have S'More property.¬† A tranquil meadow area with flowing creek on the front side of the property and breathtaking, beautiful rock formations abound the back hillside of the property.¬† I'll Have S'More boasts a rugged landscape of cliffs, caves, seasonal waterfalls, and an impressive overlook.¬† It provides a pristine example of the iconic Hocking Hills terrain, but without the crowds.¬† All guests, regardless of experience, are advised to stay on the natural trails, respect the rugged terrain, and to exercise caution at all times due to the hazards presented by the landscape.¬† In consideration of the license to rent and stay at the I'll Have S'More cabin, all guests appreciate and assume the risks associated with these activities and the landscape hazards, and agree to hold the landowners harmless from any liabilities which could arise from such activities.
description.notes: Beautiful rock formations and terrain are conducive for safe exploring with extra caution advised on the I'll Have S'More property.  Again all guests, regardless of experience and age, are advised to stay on the natural trails, respect the rugged terrain, and to exercise caution at all times due to the hazards presented by the landscape.¬† In consideration of the license to rent and stay at the I'll Have S'More cabin, all guests appreciate and assume the risks associated with these activities and the landscape hazards, and agree to hold the landowners harmless from any liabilities which could arise from such activities.
description.neighborhood:
The I'll Have S'More cabin is located in the Hocking Hills region, in Rockbridge, Ohio.  Rockbridge hosts numerous Hocking Hills tourist destinations.

Approximate driving distances to the cabin in Rockbridge, Ohio:

hosts.about:
SPACECRAFT X DESIGN
 OBJECTS‚Ä¶SPACES....ENVIRONMENTS

SPACECRAFT X DESIGN is a full service renovation interior x exterior design/build studio in Halcottsville, NY that specializes in remodeling homes for photo/rental ready for weekend home owners from inception,  ideation through implementation. The scope of the projects range from full gut renovations, new home additions, kitchen x bath remodels, landscaping design, interior decor to bespoke furniture x objects. 

With a keen eye on current x evolving design trends but a decided proclivity for a less trend driven approach x a more timeless aesthetic that is formulated by a deep understanding of the clients x properties inherent nature x needs. 

SCX is a multi-disciplinarian studio that executes projects with 5 cross pollinating roles in tandem or singular according to the needs or stages brought in. 
1. INTERIOR ARCHITECT: reconfiguring the old layouts or crafting new spaces x custom builds.  
2. INTERIOR DESIGNER: Choosing the objects of the remodeled space relevant to build. 
3. INTERIOR DECORATOR: choosing the decor objects of the finished remodeled space. 
4. LANDSCAPE DESIGNER: Synthesizing the interior x exterior environments into a holistic vision.
5. GENERAL CONTRACTOR/ PROJECT MANAGER:  Overseeing all timing x execution with subcontractors. 

*All projects are solidified on working boards used as visual communication tools for clients x to help maintain a cohesive x synergistic thread from the macro end product to the micro details x finishing work. 

The future forward upgrade investments ultimately optimizes income for second home owners by increasing nightly rental rates or re-sale value of the home through the value add cumulative lens effect of design. SCX collaborates with local Catskills mountains lumber mills, engineers, contractors, lighting designers, craftsmen x craftswomen to create x transform the ordinary x overlooked  objects, spaces x environments into something extraordinary.  

SPACECRAFTX 1 is a transformed single wide trailer/ mobile home x is an early CRAFTed SPACE project of SCX inspired by the renovations of shipping containers into modern glass dwellings.  It is a pleasure to share my home x work with visitors from around the world.  Site launching soon.
