items.comments: Great location. Had a great time
Great stay and great host! Had a very relaxing weekend here and the house had everything we needed!
Great getaway oasis

We really enjoyed our stay! Gorgeous views and extremely private location. A perfect tranquil weekend retreat. The house was mostly as pictured, the floors were a bit messed up throughout which they said they were fixing. There wasn‚Äôt AC in the bedroom but there was everywhere else. We didn‚Äôt take advantage of any of the add on goods and services but it was really nice to have the option!

Everything about this trip was healing, from the land to the curation of the home, to the infrared sauna, to Young's beautiful and generous energy. I have traveled a lot and I've never felt instantly at home like this. This is a sacred space. Also it was even larger than I expected! Such a generous and comfortable space. I loved cooking in the kitchen, stargazing at night, waking up to the mountain range and I used the spa/sauna every day followed by the magical shower (with eucalyptus spray!). My routine became grounded, calm and regenerative. Margaretville has adorable stores and there's an incredible farmer's market on Saturdays. Everyone is friendly and accommodating. And there are magical local spots to dip into the water. I wish I could move up here. Young, thank you for a truly transformative experience AND for welcoming not only me but my kitty, Count!! We are forever grateful and will absolutely return!
great, secluded get away....local towns were cute and plenty of hikes to do.

My husband and I booked this place for our anniversary. We wanted peace, coziness, and easy access to hiking. Thankfully, we were able to bring along our two big dogs to enjoy the outdoor with us. 
This property is even more stunning and roomy in person. The bed and couches are comfortable, the deck and views are gorgeous, and we did not feel like we were missing anything. Two bathrooms is a plus and, of course, having a yoga studio, sauna, fire pit, and jacuzzi are bonuses. As someone who is paranoid about being in the ‚Äúmiddle of nowhere,‚Äù I did not feel unsafe at all. The people in Halcottsville are extremely friendly and welcoming. Young was very responsive, and instructions were simple.
Although there was rain for half of our stay, we never felt bored. We highly recommend Candace‚Äôs private yoga session, Susan‚Äôs Pleasant Pheasant Farm for kayaking/swimming, and Sweet Pea Supply Co for lunch and ice cream. Halcottsville neighbors other amazing towns. We cannot wait to return!

description.summary: Nestled into a private road of 10 acres in the charming hamlet of Halcottsville, NY is SPACECRAFTX1  SANCTUARY, a transformed single wide trailer with walls of glass sliders that showcase the ultimate designer MOTHER NATURE with her majestic mountain vistas, perennial x calming Japanese rock gardens.  SPACECRAFTX1  STARGATE (separate structure) is a  wellness studio for yoga, pilates, barre x meditation with an infrared sauna with chromotherapy for a DESIGN YOUR OWN self-care retreat experience.
description.space:
NATURE x PRIVACY are the key elements of the simple life in the CATSKILLS MOUNTAINS x SPACECRAFTX1 embodies that ideal. SANCTUARY (main home) x STARGATE (yoga, pilates, ballet, barre, dance, meditation x ceremony studio) is your own private boutique spa retreat experience in a self-contained ecosystem surrounded by peaceful lush forestry. The interior SPACE x exterior ENVIRONMENT was designed with a mindful intention of the SET x SETTING to fully optimize REST x RE-SET. The year 2020‚Äôs silver lining emphasized the concept that self-care is not a luxury but a necessity for holistic maintenance x fine tuning of our physical vehicles or spirit vessels- our personal SPACECRAFT to better navigate our brief journeys here on EARTH. 

SCX1 SANCTUARY is a child x pet friendly home with a fully equipped kitchen, 2 queen size bed bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms x a jacuzzi bathtub in the master bath. The expansive deck visually doubles the interior footprint x is bordered by a Japanese rock garden in the front x a vibrant garden of lilies, roses x peonies as an evolving color theater of TIME in the back. The surrounding land of SCX1 is imbued with an enchanting ENERGY x the STAR gazing views are exceptional.

SCX1 STARGATE yoga studio (equipped for 5- 4 guests plus instructor) is a tranquil SPACE that allows you to ‚ÄúDESIGN YOUR OWN RETREAT‚Äù from an evolving menu for mental, emotional, spirit x body wellness.  STARGATE is a soft x sacred DIVINE FEMININE container for powerful transmutations x quiet reflections facilitated by a variety of ‚ÄúORGANIC TECHNOLOGIES‚Äù of healing. We currently partner with excellent members of our upstate community in their specialized modalities for on site private sessions for massage, reiki, yoga x private chef. 

Collaborator bios, service description x price lists are sent post booking for you as hospitality options to review x self-schedule your upstate staycation. Coming soon: pilates, crystal therapy, breath work, mid-week intimate mini retreats w/ plant therapies i.e. cacao ceremonies. 

SPACECRAFTX1  X  BLUE LOTUS MASSAGE THERAPY
Analee Bergmann, LMT began her career in 2013 after graduating from the Hudson Valley School of Massage Therapy. She has a vast fascination with x respect for the human body x its innate ability to heal. Analee‚Äôs style is a balance of scientific knowledge x intuitive touch. Although trained extensively in Deep Tissue therapeutic techniques, her work is never painful or jarring but focuses on relaxation x comfort.

SPACECRAFTX1  X  DIAMOND HOLLOW HEALING-SHAMANIC REIKI HEALING
Sue Sparrow Bellamy, owner of Diamond Hollow Healing located in Andes, NY is a certified Shamanic Reiki Master Teacher, Healer x Artist.  Shamanic reiki healing is a gentle x relaxing, non- invasive, intuitive hands-on healing practice that utilizes universal life force energy-Qi or Chi. Sue merges traditional Usui Reiki with Shamanic Earth-honoring traditional techniques x tools such as plants, guided meditation, breath-work, aromatherapy, divination, drumming x BioMat which is a scientifically proven x FDA 510K backed infrared crystal mat to reduce pain x inflammation x boost relaxation, sleep x health

SPACECRAFTX1  X  TWISTED SISTER YOGA
Candace Rudd is the owner of TWISTED SISTER YOGA in Arkville established in 2021. With over 500 hours of Yoga Teacher training x 23 years of practice, Candace adheres to the ideology that mastering poses is just a small aspect of the yoga philosophy x it is more about positively changing the way we approach our lives x relationships with others. She offers a wide variety of options from beginner gentle stretching to advanced full flow vinyasa or a combination depending on the needs of the client(s) request. 

SPACECRAFTX1  X BKLYN W/ LOVE PRIVATE CHEF
Sophie Grant of bklynwithlove (Event x Local Culinary Experience Creators) has created sustainable community operations as a founder of the PHOENICIA FARMERS MARKET. Sophie has direct relationships with local farms x makers of pastured meats, foraged foods, peak season produce x local infused honey. This allows her to have a pulse on the freshest seasonal offerings to create menus that are a fusion of farm fresh ingredients with notes of mediterranean x middle eastern influences.  

*All additional services based on timing availability of specialist. We highly suggest to book in advance as schedules fill up.  At least 2 to 3 weeks prior contact for chefs required. 

*Past bookings have proven popular for celebration like honeymoons, babymoons, engagements, anniversaries, birthdays, bridal showers x kids free mom getaways. SCX1 is also a unique x inspiring remote office. 

*Bellaeyre is 20 mins. x Plattekill Ski Mountains 15 mins. distance.

*High-speed fiber optic-Turbo100mbps 

*Fire Pit x Charcoal Grill w/ smoker available.

*Portable booster seat x Graco pack- n-play w/ mattress available

**Pets are welcome x we ask to wipe paws- we leave extra towels for after runs. Please pick up after them on the lawn.

*** Please specify the correct number of people upon booking x bedrooms needed/ amenities are set up accordingly.

***SCX1 is available for commercial/ film/ photo x media shoots x event space. All rates are based on scope, scale x availability. For media- please do not instant book x send a query first.

description.summary: Have you ever wanted to try out a Shipping Container Tiny Home in Dutch Country? Well look no further. Perched on a hilltop overlooking the rolling Blue Mountains and Texas Longhorn cattle grazing, this sweet tiny home offers a stylish, relaxing getaway where you can slow down for a few days with your favorite human. Cozy up on the rocker with a good book, soak and relax in the hot tub or spend the day as you enjoy a morning coffee or evening cocktail taking in the scenic valley.
description.space:
Take your family away for the day to many near by attractions and shopping. You will be approx. 40 minutes from Hershey attractions, 30 minutes to Hollywood Casino, 15 minutes of Rausch Creek Off Road Park, 35 minutes to Christmas Village, 30 minutes to Yuengling Brewery (America's oldest brewery) and Cabelas. The lake offers boat access areas, playground, picnic pavilions, walking trails and fishing.

Enjoy hiking? The applachian trail is minutes away! Also, for those that enjoy cycling the Swatara Rail Trail within 10 minutes, Lebanon Valley Rail Trail is within 30 minutes and the Bartram/Schulkill River Trail for hiking or cycling just to name a few.

An entire spacious, light-filled, cozy tiny home all to yourselves with separate parking on our beautiful 8 acre property, our home has a deck, picnic area, and its own fire pit w/a view of the Blue Mountains so that you can watch the sunrise over the mountains, watch the cattle graze in front of you as you sit by the fire, and watch the moonrise at the days end. Whether you spend your days outside adventuring, or inside keeping cozy, the view is guaranteed to be beautiful. In the summer time make a 8 minute drive into Pine Grove, a small quaint town for a refreshing ice cream treat, Burkes Ice Cream is a must. 

We do live on the 8 acre farm as well, the driveway is shared and the house can be seen down the lane to the left at a distance, so you likely won't see us at all but we are there if you need anything. You are far away enough from all homes and buildings to enjoy privacy. 


Yes, there is a full bath with hot water, shower, flushing toilet.

description.neighborhood:
Pine Grove is a charming small town located near Schuylkill County, Pennsylvania. Here are some highlights about the neighborhood:

Scenic Location: Pine Grove is situated in a picturesque area surrounded by rolling hills, lush forests, and scenic parks. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside, take leisurely walks in the woods, and explore the natural beauty of the area.

Historic Downtown: The town's charming downtown area is home to a variety of shops, restaurants, and cafes, as well as several historic buildings and landmarks. Visitors can stroll along the streets, browse the local shops, and soak up the small-town charm.

Outdoor Recreation: The Pine Grove area offers plenty of opportunities for outdoor recreation, including hiking, fishing, hunting, and camping. The nearby Swatara State Park and Appalachian Trail are both popular destinations for nature lovers.

Local Festivals: Pine Grove hosts a variety of festivals and events throughout the year, including the popular Pine Grove Polish Festival, which celebrates the town's Polish heritage with food, music, and dancing.

Proximity to Larger Cities: While Pine Grove itself is a small town, it is conveniently located within driving distance of several larger cities, including Harrisburg, Reading, and Allentown. This makes it an ideal base for exploring the region and taking day trips to nearby attractions.

Overall, Pine Grove offers a unique blend of natural beauty, small-town charm, and easy access to larger cities, making it an attractive destination for visitors looking to experience the best of Pennsylvania.
description.transit:
Getting around Pine Grove is easy, with several transportation options available:

Car: The most convenient way to get around Pine Grove and the surrounding areas is by car. There is plenty of parking available in the town, including street parking and public parking lots.

Uber/Lyft: Ride-sharing services like Uber and Lyft are also available in town, providing guests with a convenient and affordable way to get around and explore the surrounding areas.

Taxi: Taxis are available, and can be easily hailed from the town center or booked in advance.

Public Transportation: While public transportation options are a bit limited, there are several bus routes that serve the town and connect it to nearby cities like Harrisburg and Reading.

Walking: Pine Grove is a small town, and many of the town's attractions are within walking distance of each other. Walking is a great way to explore the town's charming downtown area and enjoy its scenic surroundings.

Overall, my guests have several transportation options available they can use in Pine Grove, making it easy to get around and explore the town and its surroundings. And with plenty of parking available, my guests who choose to bring their own cars will have no trouble finding a place to park.
description.interaction: Will meet our guests during arrival to hand the keys only, but I'm always available if they need me.
description.house_rules:
Please take a moment to go over our booking policies and confirm your understanding. Be sure to send a message indicating you have read and agree to the rules.

1. Smoking of any kind is strictly prohibited in the property. ($400 fine for smoke odour removal)

2. Please be cautious of noise, especially after 10pm until 7am. Noise complaints are not tolerated and may result in full deposit charges. You may be asked to leave with no refund.

3. No additional guests are allowed in the home past the indicated number on your booking confirmation. This rule is to prevent large gatherings & parties and be fair to guests who do pay the extra fees. Third party bookings are not allowed. Only registered guests are allowed on the property, the place has a maximum capacity of 2 guests. Please do not invite additional guests.

4. The property must be maintained in good condition with no excessive mess. Extra cleaning costs may apply if necessary so we can effectively prepare for next guests.

5. Please note check-out time is by 11am and keys must be placed as instructed. We can often accommodate late check-outs if we know in advance, but last minute changes may result in $100 charge per each additional half hour stayed.

6. All bookings require the ID of the individual booking and the disclosure of the full names of all guests.

7. Please be mindful of the surrounding farm animals and wildlife and avoid making loud noises that could disturb them.

8. Please use the designated parking area and do not block any driveways or access points.

9. Please turn off all lights, appliances, and air conditioning/heating when not in use or when leaving the property to conserve energy.

10. Guests are responsible for any damage they cause to the property during their stay.

Thank you for your respectful cooperation in maintaining our home!
Please send a message indicating you have read and agree to the rules.

Carrie gave us so many great recommendations for the area and was always very responsive to messages. We just checked out and I‚Äôm already planning when we can come back!
Nice weekend getaway, very clean and well organized tiny home‚òª
'Mac' was a fabulous place for us to celebrate our anniversary! Cosy, clean and that soaking tub was amazing. Carrie was a super host.
Carrie‚Äôs tiny home was better the expected it‚Äôs off a beaten path leading to a beautiful oasis, great home away from home. I would stay again.
Mac was great! Carrie was an awesome host! 10/10 recommend. We will hopefully be making it back to visit!
This was our second time at Mac and it was better than the first! Carrie is amazing to work with and we can‚Äôt wait until the third time! üôåü•≥

description.summary: mac provides all the luxuries of large living + an expansive outdoor area. the outdoor tub/shower in the screened-in patio is your own private spa/lounge w privacy curtains! hanging chairs by the fire pit offer a serene and comfy nook. mac is a perfect base camp for the many trails, lakes, rivers, mtns + cute nearby towns or just stay put! mac is situated on a 1.34 acre plot in a modest neighborhood 2 miles from marion's cute main street. mac knows love is love and he welcomes all!
description.space:
mac provides a private, modern, romantic, tiny house experience. guests report they felt like they were at their own private lil spa. the feel is best described as being on a large, private lot in a quiet neighborhood. it is not ‚Äúout in the woods‚Äù or remote. 

mac is perfect for sticking w him the entire stay or using as a comfy base camp for the abundant outdoor activities the area has to offer.

mac has strong wifi, tuft and needle queen bed, full kitchen, 36 inch roku smart tv with hulu+, disney+ , espn+ and hbo max provided, walk in shower with waterfall shower head, desk, washer/dryer, ground coffee, coffeepot and pour-over gear, indoor and outdoor eating area, gas fire pit, gas grill and the guest fave- outdoor tub/shower with bath salts provided. 

the bluetooth ceiling speakers are amazing and easy to pair with your bluetooth equipped smart device to stream music. 

mac is great for couples and solo trips. i have had several solo guests who came for a getaway to recharge, write, explore and relax and they loved it.

if you would like to book - please read the "other details to note" section!
description.access: mac + outdoor tub + fire pit + mac's half of the acreage
description.notes:
PLEASE, IF YOU ARE NEW TO ABB OR HAVE NO REVIEWS -  Welcome! 

If you would like to book, please upload your picture ID to your profile prior to making the request, please read the entire listing and all the house rules to be sure mac is a good fit for you, I want you to be happy! on yr phone: scroll down for complete rules. (on a computer- scroll to bottom of page to find rules and click on SHOW MORE). 

Please give me your full name and home town & confirm with me in your first message that you have read the listing, rules, and that you understand that mac is located in a residential neighborhood. Thank you so much, this will make everything move faster.   :)

tiny house living - the outdoor tub has limitless hot water while the indoor shower has limited hot water due to tiny house sized water heater. you must restrict the flow inside for a longer hot shower. no one has ever had an issue but it is something you should know in advance. 

Please note: I do not accept pets but my neighbors next door have two cute tinies and accept dogs! They have awesome sunset views and are a wonderful, kind couple. The cabins are called Bitty and Itty Bitty and it is dog heaven over there!
description.neighborhood:
mac is an excellent base camp/vantage point for many different year round  adventures in beautiful and unique western north carolina. 

the friendly, charming town of marion won "north carolina small town of the year" in 2018, has a  cute lil downtown (The 310 District), an interesting history and an annual BIGFOOT festival!

mac and his companion cabin, mini, are situated on a 1.34 acre plot in a modest, quiet, residential neighborhood 2 miles from marion's historical main street. the large lot and the distance between mac and mini give both their privacy, especially in spring and summer when all the foliage is full. 

the linville gorge wilderness, blue ridge parkway, lake james state park, catawba falls, catawba river, mt mitchell, pisgah forest, linville caverns, linville falls, tom's creek falls, crabtree falls, little switzerland, table rock, hawksbill mountain, grandfather mountain and too many to mention beautiful places are not far away. (some of the mentions are a part of the greater linville gorge wilderness)

hike, explore, bike, golf, float, kayak, canoe, snow tube, ski, spelunk, hit breweries and wineries and more!

check out romanticasheville.com for a comprehensive guide.

the close proximity ( 5 miles)  to interstate 40 affords easy trips to the super charming towns of asheville, morganton, black mountain, old fort, and many more depending on how far you wish to travel.  burnsville, blowing rock, banner elk, & boone are all gems and gorgeous drives.
description.transit: i message my recommends when i send check in instructions. (the online guide is a work in progress.)
description.interaction:
Hi and welcome!
I am very responsive to messages and it is preferred to keep all communication on the ABB platform. 
Please feel free to call, though!
description.house_rules:
check in - 4pm
check out - 11am
quiet hours 10 pm to 9 am

thank you for your interest in mac! following are the rules/guidelines that i require guests to abide by, they are simple and meant to protect both you, me, and future guests! i want to say here that i love hosting and i am so grateful for my amazing guests!  

by booking mac you agree to abide by the following rules - please read in its entirety to be certain mac is a good fit for you. a booking made by a guest is a contract to adhere to the house rules, cancellation policy, and duration of stay. 

just as hotels require ID, i ask that u please upload your ID to your profile. 

two guest maximum - adults only - no unregistered guests on the premises - no infants, children or pets. 

non smoking property 

use outdoor grill if frying fish, cooking bacon, or anything comparable. i want mac to be a neutral zone for all guests upon check in. certain foods permeate the room and are impervious to my ozone machine. thank you!

absolutely no food/grease/grounds/waste - nothing but non-solidifying liquids are to go down the drains, the sink will back up and require a service call from a plumber at guest's expense. all food waste must be disposed of in the garbage. 

nothing but toilet paper can be flushed. no kleenex or ‚Äúflushable" wipes -  strictly TP.  this will keep the plumber away during your stay. 

mac is not a party house, he is very square.  :D                               

no dyeing of hair or clothes.

in freezing weather, guest agrees to follow protocol if using the outdoor tub. this may involve turning water source on and off and setting faucets to prevent freezing/bursting of pipes. 

*please note that I adhere to my cancellation policy with no exceptions. airbnb now offers travel insurance! credit cards often have it. insuremytrip is a great resource. (if a cancellation resulted in a booking by a new guest, I refund the original booker, but this is not always the case.)* 

for your safety, do not climb on the wooden slats surrounding mac and the hanging chairs as they will not tolerate weight. no monkey business.  :D

i do not accept animals. my neighbors next door have two cute tinies and accept dogs! the cabins are called bitty and itty bitty and it is dog heaven over there!

We had a great vacation. Very dog friendly. They had a huge yard to run and play in that was fenced in. Truly better than what I expected! Nice little touches of coffee and sodas in the fridge. We will definitely try and book again when we visit family.

We love vintage things and there was a great vintage store right next door.  If you‚Äôre looking for a private cozy place to stay then this is definitely the place!
We loved this place. Convenient to downtown Greenville. Hosts are very responsive. Our dogs loved the large, shaded yard.
My stay at the cottage container was wonderful! It was everything described and more! It has a very cozy vibe! I will definitely be rebooking again for the winter! John and sandy are THE BEST!

We had drove all the way from New Jersey and it‚Äôs safe to say that it was well worth the drive. I felt right at home at the container cottage and everything we want to go see from downtown to different restaurants was all within a 15 minute drive of the location. John and sandy made my stay incredibly enjoyable. Thanks again for having us!

What a great place for a short visit! Very convenient to everything Greenville has to offer. The home was very well equipped with everything we would have needed! Sleep easy knowing that the neighborhood is safe. A fire station is located just a block over. The entire interior of the home is crafted with reclaimed wood. A short drive to downtown. Fenced in yard and dog friendly. Just a street over from a busy highway to which we have no control over the sound that carries over.
description.space: This former shipping container has a full kitchen, private bathroom, and a queen bedroom, along with a dining room and living room. Fenced in yard that is pet (dog) friendly.

Just a short drive to Clemson University, Parris Mountain, Greenville Zoo, and all other attractions in the upstate of SC.

description.interaction: We live in Greenville and if needed are available.

items.comments: we had a wonderful stay. everything was so beautiful and peaceful. would recommend to anyone looking for a quick getaway.

There are 2 living quarters on this large hidden waterfront property - the larger Farmhouse that accommodates 10 people & the barn which accommodates 3 people. Both living areas are situated closely together yet offer enough privacy from each other. 

We stayed in the contemporary barn and the hosts were onsite at the farmhouse should we need any assistance. 

The barn is a beautiful updated space with a kitchenette that didn‚Äôt cause issue for us : namely no freezer available but a good sized bar fridge on site, a microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee machine all available for our use.

The bbq & hot tub is situated on the farmhouse grounds which is less ideal, however if renting the whole property this would be a non-issue for privacy & convenience. 

The trail to the water was not stroller accessible (a non issue for older kids) & I would however bring boots if you plan on venturing to the water. All in all, we found great value for the price, excellent location & space - thx you!

The cottage was pretty.  I just felt a lack of privacy when the gardener showed up and I felt like he could see into the cottage because the sunroom is floor to ceiling with glass panels and sliding glass doors on three sides.  The hot tub looked fine however it too was not private.

Very-well located property, at the end of a quiet street, next to a vineyard. Very relaxing and peaceful vibe. It‚Äôs about 15-min away from the top 3 vineyards in Canada. There are lots of good restaurant options nearby. Elynn is a responsive host and she shared good recommendations of activities to do in the area. We really enjoyed our time there.

Absolutely stunning place! It‚Äôs a quaint oasis set back from the hustle and bustle of Niagara and region. Elynn is kind and pleasant to talk to and deal with! Niagara is close to drive for those who want to visit. Highly recommend for a relaxing retreat!!
Great spot to stay!
Lovely place in a great location near vineyards

description.summary: Relax in Niagara‚Äôs wine country and enjoy the tranquility of being in a nature's paradise on the water. A mix of modern architecture and old-world charm makes this stunning century old barn, perched over 16th Mile Creek, an inspired vacation destination and offsite work location. Set amongst vineyards and orchards on an estate minutes from wineries, restaurants and downtown St Catharines, just off the QEW, our industrial chic wine country retreat sleeps 2 adults and 1 child.
description.space:
Just one hour from Toronto and¬†Buffalo, the Vineyard Barn's stunning spaces and storybook setting make it a great Niagara wine country escape for family, friends, and co-workers alike. It's that much better shared together; strolling through acres of vineyards and orchards, spending an afternoon on the sandy beach just down the water, bird watching for bald eagles perched on the tall pines, enjoying the stars and tranquil sounds of nature from the porch swing on the rooftop deck - simple pleasures to help disconnect and unwind. 

The barn's private, luxurious accommodations features 20 ft ceilings, polished and heated concrete floors, century¬†old barn board, chic living/dining areas and a separate den/bedroom with a day bed for lounging or sleeping.¬†The pass through kitchenette with a large island and comfy counter chairs acts as a great work space with high speed internet. A thoughtfully designed mix of vintage farmhouse furnishings and contemporary furniture makes for comfortable living. 

Unwind in the hot tub after a day of wine tasting or spend the afternoon reading on the rooftop deck with an oversized sofa swing overlooks vineyards and orchards. If you're lucky,  you may spot the family of Bald Eagles that nest in the twin pines. The multi-acre property has a number of lookouts and seating areas with water and vineyard views that guests are welcome to enjoy.¬†¬†

Less than 10 minute from 13th Street Winery, Cave Springs, Pearl Morissette and 15 minutes to 50+ local wineries, including Vineland Estates, Megalomaniac, 30 Bench, Angel's Gate and more. Only 25 minute from Niagara-on-the-Lake and Niagara Falls. Don't miss downtown Jordan Station, 10 mins away, with boutique stores, art galleries and bakeries. See our guide for more recommendations for hiking trails, wineries and restaurants.
description.access: Guests have full access to the property including the bbq and hot tub
description.notes: For groups of 10, there is a second unit located on the property. Please look for "Vineyard Farmhouse on the Water" on AirBnB for availability and booking details.
description.neighborhood:
The Vineyard Barn is very private, perched on the water amongst acres of vineyards and orchards that are wonderful to stroll or bike through. Jordan, in the Town of Lincoln, is part of Niagara's Benchlands, bordering Niagara-on-the-lake, a short drive from Toronto or Buffalo, New York. 

Niagara's Benchlands is a charming wine country pocket home to beautiful trails, quaint towns peppered with boutiques, farm-to-table restaurants, and, most importantly, some outstanding wine. With over 50 vineyards featuring many of the provinces best, boutique wineries, most are family run, award-winning estates, set in the majestic natural beauty of the Niagara Escarpment. The Benchlands landscape is often described as Niagara‚Äôs Sonoma Valley - unpretentious, high quality, down to earth and friendly. The rolling landscape is serene as you travel the route along sloping vineyards and roadside fruit stands. Visit farmers markets, hike scenic trails or shop in the most unique boutique shops in the historic Jordan Village shopping district. 

The property is also just 20 mins away from Niagara-on-the-Lake offering even more wineries and restaurants and 25 mins mins from Niagara Falls.
description.transit: A car is generally needed to get around with easy, free parking everywhere and there are plenty of bike trails and hiking trails nearby.

great stay & area!

Also, if able black bottom dress shoes leave marks on the maple flooring. Please put shoes on, on porch. Thanks again y‚Äôall.

name: The Hygge Box Hop - Hocking Hills
title: Rockbridge, Ohio

hosts.about: Administrative Assistant to The Box Hop

Hello! We are Emily & Seth. Along with our four kids, Mina, Emery, Estelle and Millie, we love traveling, exploring and all things coffee and food! We own five shipping container homes that we rent in the Hocking Hills region of Southern Ohio and we love people.

recent.comments: We loved our stay! It was beautiful and serene. It rained for most our stay but it was so cozy and there were a lot of things to do inside the home on a rainy day. Everything was really clean and clutter free, the hosts were incredibly responsive and easy to work with. Would highly recommend:)

items.comments: We loved our stay! It was beautiful and serene. It rained for most our stay but it was so cozy and there were a lot of things to do inside the home on a rainy day. Everything was really clean and clutter free, the hosts were incredibly responsive and easy to work with. Would highly recommend:)
Beyond what I expected! I took my employees and contractors for a team retreat and it was the best place ever for this. Will definitely be coming back

We have stayed at other places of Emily and Seth's and have enjoyed it both times. Whatever questions or issues there were they had a team to respond and take care of them. The home is beautiful and thought out. One thing to note is that sound does echo through the home so if you have kids you might want to take ear plugs to sleep. Our experience was great.

The home was stunning and just as it appeared in the pictures. The plan for one of the days was to go kayaking but the river was too high- we ended up just staying at the house and having just as enjoyable of a time. The projector was great for watching tv (the boys loved their sports on the big screen). 
Overall, the house was amazing and we had a great experience! 
Thank you!
NA
Such a unique, quiet, and beautiful space for a retreat! We loved it!

Really Beautiful house and a great stay with six guests. We loved the remote location and uniqueness of the home. Truly no one else in sight. Giant windows everywhere really let the light in and set the stage for a beautiful home. The hot tub and sauna are great and the kitchen is very nice.

Overall a great stay but there were a few issues. The Wi-Fi is rough. You will not be able to stream from any device to the projector due to the poor Wi-Fi. We checked throughout and the upload speed was close to .5-1.0 mbps upload speed in the house. This would be fine, but we weren‚Äôt told about this when booking.

There was some natural wear and tear on the house that took away from the luxurious experience. Nothing totally out of the norm though for a house used for this purpose. All in all, it was a great experience for a smaller group with a unique and stunning ambiance!

description.summary:
The Hygge [pronounced, Hoo-Gah] is the NEWEST build from the Box Hop team (Emily & Seth Britt). We spent OVER a year planning all the details and jumping through every hoop to make this 5x bedroom container home happen. We used three 40' containers and four 20' containers for the Hygge Box Hop which has 4x PRIVATE balconies and over 1,200 sqft of outdoor patio space. 
The interior is decked out with a Scandinavian d√©cor and has a 6x person Sauna and a Hot Tub located on the covered deck. 
We are BEYOND excited to share this vision with you and hope to have the honor of hosting you in one of our spaces.
description.notes:
To note: during the winter months, the cabin may be difficult to access due to weather on the driveway. It will be plowed, and maintained after each winter storm, but during those months an all-wheel drive or 4-wheel drive vehicle is recommended.

Guests may cancel for a full refund minus approximately 4% taken out for Paypal fees until 5 days before check-in. If the reservation is canceled after that, the guest is entitled to a 50% refund if canceled 24 hours prior to the beginning of the reservation. Within 24 hours of the confirmed reservation, if the guest cancels their stay, there is no refund.
description.neighborhood: Only 12 miles from Hocking Hills State Park, 5 miles from Cantwell Cliffs, 8 miles from Rock House trail -- there are endless activities in this area. To name a few: zip-lining & canopy tours, canoeing trips, hiking & biking trails, fishing,  and horseback riding. There are also several local shops, restaurants, breweries, scenic tours and the John Glenn Astronomy Park.

David and Melinda

description.summary: Come spend a couple of days in the mountains away from the hustle and bustle. Our Luxury-Romantic Modern home is a cozy, mountain oasis home nestled in Fairview, NC. Surrounded by the sounds of nature and a small creek, complete with outdoor hot-tub experience, outdoor fire pit, indoor electric fire place and a mountain-life. 9 mile drive (approximately 12 minutes) into downtown Asheville.
description.space:
We built this small home and couldn't bare to hide it from AirBnb! It is comfortable and clean, with all of the modern amenities a home should have. The hot-tub nestled in the mountains next to a small creek, in a romantic setting. Relaxing getaway any time of year!

The design intent of our guest home, by our architect, was to bring Mothers Nature indoors, as much as structurally possible, thus there is an amazing amount of glass windows throughout our home with blinds for privacy as  needed.  

No animals or pets are allowed due to owner-animal allergies.
description.access: The whole house is yours for the duration of your stay: kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, front deck, side deck, fire pit, hot-tub area on stone patio, indoor electric fireplace, washer and dryer, Keurig for coffee, and microwave. Cell service could be spotty in the mountains, depending on your carrier. WiFi is provided, however bandwidth in our mountain location is likely slower than you may be used to. If you wish to stream movies you may want to download them ahead of time before your arrival.
description.transit: Uber and Lyft are available
description.interaction: We will have fresh baked goods waiting for you on the first day of your stay. We DO NOT cook breakfast, however we do provide various breakfast items such as oatmeal, cliff bars and occasionally other seasonal goods.
description.house_rules: No animals or pets are allowed due to owner-animal allergies.

description.summary: The first Luxury Shipping Container in Warrenton, NC.  Built with the help from many of the talented community members and the finished product is something special.  It is 320 sq feet including the 80 sq foot bathroom with dual waterfall showers and 9 foot 6 inch ceilings.  It has a garage door that opens up to the 250 sq foot enclosed deck for your furry family member(s).  Smart lighting with 16 million color choices, Spectrum 400 MB Internet, Amazon 3D speaker, and TV with Prime and Netflix.

description.summary: Sk√∂v (forest in Danish) is a majestically glazed architectural Cabin combining natural simplicity and contemporary luxury, 10 minutes from the village of Mont- Tremblant. Newly-constructed  and perched in the treetops and with a fully glazed and bright living space, experience an immersive stay in nature. Enjoy the terrace with the spa for an unparalleled stargazing experience. Interior Designed by Renowned Canadian  designer.
description.space:
Featured in Boutique Homes, Welcome Beyond and Narcity as one of the best Cabins in Quebec! 
The Skov chalet is an invitation to Slow living, Book now for a stay out of time with its 50 linear foot panoramic bay windows less than 10 minutes from the Village of Mont-Tremblant.

Please note that the cottage is not located by the water. A small public beach on the banks of the Rouge River is a 5-minute drive away. Several lakes and beaches can be found in the Mont-Tremblant region.

Built in 2021, it is located in the heart of the private Chic Shack estate, just a few minutes from the Mont-Tremblant resort.
For a luxury escape , book this Superb 1300 square foot glass cabin. In addition to the fully glazed living space, you will find 3 spacious bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, a modern bathroom, high-end furnishings, a central rotating fireplace and a majestic terrace with private spa, Lounge and dining area. outdoor fire. 

Inspired by Scandi-Boho, the design of the Sk√∂v is signed by renowned designer Camille Charland-Perez. It is a mix of Nordic influences with a refined style and a bohemian soul.

description.house_rules:
RENT CONTRACT 

GENERAL
MAXIMUM CAPACITY OF THE CHALET: It is forbidden to exceed the the number of paid guests included in your reservation.. Possibility of a minimum fine of $ 500, eviction and / or prohibition of access to the chalet without reimbursement.
All persons, including children, are counted toward the maximum occupancy of a cottage.
The minimum age for all the adults guests is 25 years old. Proof of identity may be required.
VARIOUS PARTIES, EXCESSIVE NOISE, MUSIC, ETC. : The Tenant undertakes to respect reasonable rules of conduct and not to disturb neighbors and residents of the area and to keep to a reasonable noise level at all times but particularly between 9 p.m. and 8 a.m. 
The municipality is very strict on this. A complaint that requires handling with complainants will be at your expense, this is your notice. Outdoor music is prohibited at all times. In the event of a complaint, Possibility of a minimum fine of $ 500, eviction and / or prohibition of access to the chalet without reimbursement.
To ensure the tranquility of the neighborhood, a security guard makes random rounds from afar without disturbing your peace of mind. Also, outdoor cameras are installed pointed towards the parking lot for security purposes.

Surroundings are quiet and peaceful and we would like to stay that way! 


CHECK-IN
Check-in is¬†5:00 pm or later. Your chalet will not been cleaned up or available before this check-in time. The code lock associated with your reservation cannot be used before 17:00 the day of your arrival.
CHECK-OUT
Checkout is¬†11:00 am. Unfortunately, we are unable to accommodate late checkouts. Check-in and checkout times are strictly enforced so that we can make sure that each chalet is ready for our incoming guests. Late same-day checkouts will result in a¬†$100¬†fee¬†for each guest overstay without permission.

Before checking-out, please¬†:
Please place all garbage as it will be described in the check-out message
Please check that all windows and doors are closed and latched
Please run the dishwasher before you leave and wash anything that is not dishwasher safe.
Empty the refrigerator and microwave to return them to the same condition as when you arrived.
Please leave all bed sheets and towels. Do not wash them, we will take care of it.
Make sure that the cover of the spa is back in place and the temperature is set for 98 degrees
Make sure that the fireplace‚Äôs door is closed 
Do not put fireplace ashes in the garbage (cause of fire)

PETS
Pets are¬†not allowed.

NON-SMOKING
Please note that this is a non-smoking property. According to the Tobacco Act (T-0.01), a fine of up to $500.00 can be incurred. Our inspection team will assess the chalet after you departure. Any damages due to smoking indoors will be at the renter‚Äôs cost.
PARKING
Each chalet has parking for¬†three cars only.
Your vehicle must be parked only in the assigned spots at all times during your stay.
All illegally parked vehicles will be¬†towed at your expense.


Fireplace
Keep door of fireplace closed at all times
Do not place wet items to dry on fireplace and/or on fireplace floor plaque. This will cause items to burn and metal to rust.
Do not cut any trees down on the property
In case of fire, call 911 immediately

Spa
Use the spa at your own risk
Keep children under constant supervision
Take a shower¬†before¬†and¬†after¬†the use of the spa
Do not enter the spa if you have massage oil or sunscreen on your body
Do not enter the chalet wet
Do not use indoor furniture near the spa
Spa capacity 5 persons
Maximum suggested use is 20 minutes
For the respect of our customers, please do not spill any body fluid into de spa (urine, spit, blood, sperm, etc.)
Maximum water temperature should not exceed 100¬∞f
Do not sit or lie on spa cover
Please note that excessive or inappropriate use of the spa may result in a charge of¬†$350.00 plus taxes¬†for changing the water and for additional cleaning.¬†

INSECTS AND RODENTS
Please be aware that you are staying in the woods. Although we check our cottages on a regular basis, it is likely that you will see insects or rodents during your stay. We cannot be held responsible if you see insects or rodents in your cottage during your stay. Please make sure to keep the doors closed at all times to avoid visiting small intruders during your stay.

DAMAGE AND INSURANCE
You are personally responsible for anything you damage. Contact us as soon as possible to declare it. You are also responsible for your personal belongings. In case of personal injury, you should always contact your own insurance company. Suite Home Inc. cannot be held responsible but are available if you need help.
We reserve the right to charge your credit card for any damages or excessive cleaning, soiled dishes left in sink, cottage content in disarray from your stay. If you notice any problems upon checking in, please let us know right away to avoid any damages being charged to your account.
All appliances, ustensils, and disches are supplid.¬†Any missing items will be charged to guest.
SUITE HOME Inc. OBLIGATION
In case of unforeseen events out of our control (including those caused by Mother Nature), Suite Home Inc. will be provided to locate a similar rental property in the area. Suite Home Inc. will not be held responsible or liable for any further obligations arising from this event.
No responsibility can be accepted by Suite Home Inc. for any event resulting in death, injury, loss of personal effects, or damage whatsoever to the renter.
In case of an uncontrollable situation (power failure, spa malfunction, Internet interruption, water shortage, sewers failure, phot interruption, etc.), no refund will be processed. Please note that our cottage do not have generator.
Your verbal authorization at time of reservation, making an online reservation, payment of money and/or taking possession of the property is evidence of your acceptance of our policies and your intent to use the property as a rental.
I declare that I have read and understood each of the commitments.
_________________________________________ ______________

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, THE LESSOR AND THE TENANT HAVE DULY SIGNED THESE PRESENTS:
For the Landlord
Hind Barakat
Suite Chalets Tremblant
In behalf of Suite Home Inc.

name: Lizzy Lou's Flower House - The Rose
title: Currie, North Carolina

hosts.about: Small family farm just outside Wilmington, North Carolina. Specialty Cut Flowers, Classes, Workshops and Flower Cutting Events, Pasture Raised Black Angus Beef,  Bath, Body, Hair Care and Hydrosols from farm grown botanicals.

recent.comments: Beautiful view in the day and night. One of the nicest place with a sense of privacy. I would come back the next time I stay in wilmington!!!! 11/10

items.comments: Beautiful view in the day and night. One of the nicest place with a sense of privacy. I would come back the next time I stay in wilmington!!!! 11/10
It was a wonderful spot for a solo weekend getaway! Will be back üòä

This place was cute.  It is as small as the pictures indicate, but once settled in it was quaint and perfect for our first night of a week long vacation.  If you are staying in the dead of summer, it can feel like a sauna at first, but truly does cool down very quickly.  

The highlight for us, though, was all the animals!  Getting to wake up to roosters crowing and cows peeking at you though the back window, seeing (our name for him) Big Hoss the pig strutting out to the pasture and the little piglets running about was awesome.  The farm cats causing mischief on the roof was a nice cap for the evening, too.   If you want rural feel while still being close enough to town, definitely stay here!

Elizabeth‚Äôs place is beautiful, peaceful, clean, and matched the pictures. It‚Äôs conveniently located near Wilmington and we stayed there on the way back from the beach. If you‚Äôre hoping to spend some time there (beyond a quick overnight), perhaps wait until the weather is cooler unless some changes are made. The bath house is cute but has poor ventilation. Even with the AC on, it was hot inside at night and didn‚Äôt have a screen if you wanted to open the door. The AC in the sleeping space worked great and the space was well kept. For the price, it would be helpful to have some basic supplies (oil, salt, pepper, pan, etc.) on hand so guests don‚Äôt have to bring their own. Offering firewood as an add on‚Äîpurchase on site, would also be helpful. I enjoy being, camping, and cooking outside. Cooking/eating outside was in direct sunlight, so it was toasty / had to cover up even in the morning. The birds, flowers, and mist were lovely to wake up to. Thank you for having us!
A peaceful place with great hosts!
Great place for a weekend getaway! Very peaceful. Enjoyed our stay and hope to come back sometime in the future.

This Beautiful airbnb was soo Unique in a great way. The room itself was quiet and relaxing. The kittens, cows, piggys and rooster were so cool to be up close and personal with.  Would stay there again and recommend to anybody.

description.summary: This beautiful shipping container conversion offers a cozy spot for sleeping and an upstairs viewing deck situated right in the center of our small family farm.  Lookout over livestock grazing through green pastures. Catch the roses in bloom in early spring or a tropical feel in summer and fall. Kid friendly play areas.  A fire pit and gril for cookouts or soak in the farm while soaking in the outdoor tub!  Just 15 minutes drive to Downtown Wilmington!  Follow us @lizzylousfamilyfarm
description.space:
Unit #2 "The Rose" Sleeps a max of 2 adults and 1 child. Queen sized bed, half bath (sink, vanity and toilet) as well as a kitchenette with mini fridge, toaster oven, coffee maker and oversized farm sink. Exclusive use of the private bathhouse located just behind the rental. A front porch hammock swing and the most amazing upstairs deck area and bistro set for the perfect view of the rising or setting sun.  Guest have access to the pond side playset and seesaw as well as the firepit courtyard and grill in front of the airbnb's. Located just fifteen minutes from downtown Wilmington we have the perfect location to keep you out of the hustle and bustle of the city but close enough to make several trips to town in a day if you wished. Only thirty minutes from several local beaches; Wrightsville, Carolina and Kure Beach all within a half hour drive.  Enjoy the view as cows graze by your window, chickens, pigs and piglets even a naughty goat just beyond your door. ..
For larger families in need of a little more space check out our other rental "The Bluebelle" right next door to "The Rose" and book the pair for the perfect family getaway.

Guest have access to the airbnbs yard, alloted bathing areas, and pondside playset. 
Guests do not have access to barn stalls, pastures, woods, or growing areas.
description.access:
Pondside Playset
Firepit and Park Grill
description.notes:
Please Note .. We can not allow ANY visiting animals on the farm or in the rentals EVER. It is the job of the resident livestock guardian dogs to prevent predators and unfamiliar animals from entering the farm property and they will do so with force and without hesitation.

Our rentals have a two adult maximum occupancy, including children over the age of 12 years. 

Our rentals have a one child maximum including infants. No exceptions.

name: The Mahoning River Lodge Container with hot tub
title: Berlin Center, Ohio

recent.comments: Lots of fun! Great place for couples.

items.comments: Lots of fun! Great place for couples.

This place was an unexpected gem. We ended up booking after another airbnb host cancelled our reservation in a booking mix-up but we ended up
being grateful our original booking fell through as this was surprisingly awesome.  The pictures almost don‚Äôt do justice to how close you are to the river and what the view is like. Kayaking was so fun and easy. You can kayak for 20 minute and hop off at a local bar for a drink.

If you want a bit of an adrenaline rush, check out Noah‚Äôs Lost Ark, an exotic animal rescue where you get pretty up close to some crazy animals (Siberian tigers, baboons, leopards, lions, bears, etc‚Ä¶)

All in all it was a great trip. Hosts were friendly and responsive, our door code wasn‚Äôt working but they were quick to respond and help us get in.

We had such an amazing time getting away to this place it felt like it own vacation home in the cutest little beach town. We have already talked about coming back and I cannot stress how grateful we are for what the owner did for the special request I made for my girlfriends birthday arrival the first night!
Absolutely beautiful place enjoyed every minute of being there second time now‚Ä¶. Highly recommended for a very quiet getaway.
Great place

Lovely place for a getaway! Peaceful surroundings and gorgeous views. We most enjoyed the hot tub and fire pit. We also visited some local restaurants and wineries, which were nearby. The home was clean and had almost everything we needed! Great spot to recharge and relax!

This is such a cool Airbnb! Everything was so clean and the property owners were great with check in instructions. There are two others on the property and they‚Äôre all so unique and cute, but there is still privacy which is great. The area is beautiful and it‚Äôs the perfect place for a little romantic getaway. Having the kayaks to use is such a nice perk as well. We will be coming back!

description.summary:
You'll love this unique & romantic escape located on the Mahoning River near Lake Milton, OH.  The container features two floors & is perfect for a couples getaway or a business trip.  Upstairs you will find a full size bed & bathroom area with a custom tiled shower & access to the walk out patio with a hot tub. This is the perfect spot to enjoy views of the river & sounds of nature.
Relax downstairs in the living area or take advantage of the complimentary kayaks & take a trip on the river.
description.access: Guests will be able to access the shared sidewalk to the deck which leads to the shareable dock and the river.  Each unit on the property will have access to the dock, kayaks, and a kayak launch. Life jackets are located in the storage container on the dock.
description.notes: We are conveniently located within a 20-35 minute drive from Youngstown,  Boardman, Kent, Alliance, & Hartville.
description.neighborhood:
The Mahoning River Lodge is located just minutes away from Lake Milton, OH where you can enjoy all Lake Milton has to offer!  Swim at Craig's Beach, dine at one of the many local restaurants, enjoy a sunset over the dam at Halliday's Winery, sip a beer at the Lake Milton Brewery,  or get ice cream at Kyp's or Udderly Sweet Treats.  
The marina is the perfect spot to have a picnic & relax by the water or
head to the state park to play frisbee golf and/or take a hike. Check out the iconic gazebo where you can walk onto the pier & sit under the gazebo to truly enjoy the lake!
description.house_rules: No burning candles indoors or outdoors

name: Wildwood; One bedroom shipping container home
title: Dalton, Ohio

hosts.about: Hello! I‚Äôm Kathy. I love to travel and experience culture in all places. Being in nature, random connections with people are among my favorite things. I do also enjoy an occasional city experience where I can walk from place to place. Which is simply, coffee shops and cocktail bars. When the road trip bug bites, Air B n B is my first go-to, and have always had the best experiences!

recent.comments: My husband and I were looking for a quiet, secluded area for our very early anniversary trip. We found this gem and decided to try out a container house. It was so peaceful and the woods were beautiful to look at in the mornings. We got to enjoy building fires and just listening to all the birds. It was above our expectations of what a container house should look like. We enjoyed ourselves so much. Thank you Kathy for making our anniversary trip so memorable.

items.comments: My husband and I were looking for a quiet, secluded area for our very early anniversary trip. We found this gem and decided to try out a container house. It was so peaceful and the woods were beautiful to look at in the mornings. We got to enjoy building fires and just listening to all the birds. It was above our expectations of what a container house should look like. We enjoyed ourselves so much. Thank you Kathy for making our anniversary trip so memorable.

Kathy's place was a cute little hideaway, very peaceful.  Small but perfect for nights stay on our bike trip.
Snacks and drinks appreciated.

If you are looking for a peaceful, quiet, cozy getaway from the busy-ness of everyday life, this is the perfect spot for you. Do not be fooled by the small footprint of this amazing container home...Kathy has expertly maximized the efficiency of this space with everything you need for a comfortable living space. The outdoor deck area is the perfect extension of the indoor space. The way the door faces the wooded area makes this place so relaxing and quiet. I absolutely loved this space--it was hard to leave. I'd highly recommend bringing some pre-made meals or easy to heat food so you don't have to drive too far to find somewhere to eat and you can spend more time relaxing in this amazing space!
What a beautiful peaceful spot!

We really enjoyed our stay at Kathy's home. The place itself is a great exercise in design. While it is based on a shipping container, the space is utilized superbly, very nice furniture and finishes and comfortable and spacious feel. Also, beautifully integrated deck and trees. Very peaceful and beautiful surroundings. Home well stocked and very clean, making it a pleasant stay. To top it off, we had a great visit by super friendly chocolate lab, Baker, and an orange tabby, Simba, who hung around on a porch with us for bit. Highly recommended for a quick pit stop or a longer stay near Kidron. Thank you Kathy (and Baker and Simba), best wishes!
We had such a great time! Everything was perfect. Got a few buggies as visitors but thats expected when the place is so peaceful!

This was definitely a unique experience staying in a unit like this.  We appreciated the additional outdoor space which increased the overall stay.  The unit was well thought out and provided a comfortable time.  It was a little bit of a challenge to find the unit since it is tucked into the wooded area.  We enjoyed the quiet and peaceful atmosphere and would recommend this unit.

description.summary: Enjoy the sounds of nature when you stay in this uniquely designed space. Our modern, shipping container home is set in the heart of Ohio country side, surrounded by trees with an outdoor living space to maximize the privacy and beauty.

You may be visited by our friendly family pets, a huge chocolate Lab named Baker and two cats, Simba and Magic. Feel free to say hello and play with them, however they are not allowed inside the tiny home.
description.access: The whole place is yours! You can see our family home up the hill, and may see us coming and going, but we will not be entering your drive or living areas for any reason.
description.notes: A well equipped kitchen with a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, cooktop, electric kettle, and all the basic cooking utensils, pots and pans. Please note there is no oven. Also available is a charcoal grill.

recent.comments: This was our third time staying at Uncommon Accommodations, and we were so happy with our stay as always. Tyler is very communicative, the check out process is super easy, and the house was clean and comfy. Great place to choose if you are looking to visit Stowe!

items.comments: This was our third time staying at Uncommon Accommodations, and we were so happy with our stay as always. Tyler is very communicative, the check out process is super easy, and the house was clean and comfy. Great place to choose if you are looking to visit Stowe!
We had a relaxing stay.

This was a perfect option for us as we wanted a place to enjoy some outdoor activities and having no plans. We enjoyed golf at a nearby course and a couple breweries. We traveled an hour to Burlington for the day and it was a perfect ride over through the mountains. 

Unfortunately, we didn‚Äôt get to enjoy the river as much due to locate flooding and heavy rain in the area but it was very peaceful. 

Tyler was very responsive to messages especially after losing power due to a thunderstorm. He brought water to everyone and was able to get people on sight quickly.

Probably one of the best AirBnb spots in Northern VT, this tiny house was clean, easy to access, and within close proximity to many hikes and other things to do. Tyler was great, as well. A super lovely stay overall.
Did not get to experience the place to its potential, due to unfortunate floods the community experienced, but will be back for sure!!

Awesome spot! Very quiet, private, cozy, and welcoming. Went on daily walks on the property to the falls, soaked in the hot tub, and enjoyed polar plunges in the river! Tyler was great! Very friendly and welcoming. Had everything we needed for the 10 days we visited. Close to local restaurants, breweries, hiking trails, and waterfalls!

description.summary:
Welcome to Uncommon Accommodations, a collection of several unique tiny houses and glamping sites on a 14-acre property along the beautiful Lamoille River! Click on my profile to view all the listings & bring your fiends!

Enjoy sweeping views of the Green Mountains & a quaint farm across the river.  The property includes 2,000 feet of river frontage with multiple swimming holes and access to Dog's Head Falls. A beautiful spot for relaxing by the river, fishing, and enjoying nature.
description.space:
Experience the tiny house lifestyle in The Stem-N-Leaf. Tiny house includes a kitchenette, living area with television, private deck, two sleeping lofts, a convertible sofa, & more! 

Enjoy Elon Musk's high-speed Starlink Wifi. Cell coverage from Verizon & AT&T throughout the property, Johnson village is 5min away and has numerous restaurants, convenience stores, & other attractions.
description.access:

Less than 30 minutes to both Stowe & Smuggler's Notch Ski Resorts
description.notes:

Hot tub is year-round. Outdoor shower is seasonal May through October.
description.neighborhood: Uncommon Accommodations is located in the heart of Vermont's Green Mountains, offering endless opportunities for outdoor adventure, including hiking, skiing, and mountain biking. After a day of exploring, relax in our hot tub or gather around the campfire to roast marshmallows and stargaze. With its abundance of natural beauty, charming small-town atmosphere, and unique accommodations, Uncommon Accommodations is the perfect place to reconnect with nature and escape the stresses of everyday life. We look forward to hosting you!

Place was great, quiet, and clean.

The most fun spot for our staycation!

I stayed here with my husband and two small children. The place is ADORABLE! Also, the host was so helpful in terms of giving us local recommendations and making sure everything was suitable for kids (I.e. offering a crib, leaving an activity book, etc.). We will 100% visit again!

description.summary: The Trailer Park at Empire Yard offers a unique perspective of downtown Macon living. This shipping container home not only offers a quirky, fun atmosphere but also puts you within walking distance of the most popular downtown destinations. But why stop there? You will also have panoramic views of the downtown skyline, swimming pool with tanning shelf, wrap around deck, outdoor fireplace, and even a Tesla charging station! Whether in town for business or pleasure the Trailer Park can't be beat.
description.space: This shipping container home makes up the top container only. This space consists of a full size bed, let out sofa, and option of pack-n-play. Great space for a couple or small family. This is an open concept and does not have a door for the bedroom.
description.access:
This container home is part of a high end Loft complex. You will have access to gated parking (one car only), pool, outdoor fireplace, both gas and electric grill, and dog area. The complex is home to 28 residents so you will never feel "crowded" anywhere. The pool is usually empty unless it is a weekend during June, July, or August when a few residents may be around. 

If in town for business or if you need an office space you will have access to a separate space in the bottom container that will be private.
description.notes: We value security at this property and the entire complex is monitored by camera and owner is 10 minutes away in case any issue arises.
description.neighborhood: The Trailer Park is in the heart of Macon's Historic Railroad Industrial District. From Coal and Rail yards to Millwork shops and grocery stores if it was made in Macon it was probably made in this district. Macon's original cemetery is located down the street and one of the original Millwork shops, Willingham Sash & Door,  is still in operation one street over. Empire Yard was once a Coal yard, Ice House, and later, an Ice Cream facility.
description.transit: Sixth street offers free street side parking. You may walk to restaurants and venues downtown via the Poplar street tunnel or drive the short distance. Downtown does charge to park with a maximum of 3hrs. Central City Park and Luther Williams field is a 15 minute walk (0.8 miles). The Welcome center for Macon, Visit Macon,  is located 0.5 miles away at 450 MLK Jr Blvd. where many tours may be booked.
description.interaction: Owner is available for any questions or problems throughout stay and may be reached by phone or through app.
description.house_rules:
Children under 14 years of age must be accompanied by an adult in the pool area as well as by an active fire at outdoor fireplace. 

Guest must pick up after their pets in the dog park located at rear of property.

The cabin is beautiful! Awesome decor and immaculately clean! The touches are so nice, too. We enjoyed the hot tub and the nice TV space downstairs. It‚Äôs pretty isolated, but overall seems safe. I recommend stopping at a store beforehand as I didn‚Äôt have any creamer or coffee for the coffee machine. Very comfortable space. My 11-year-old loves the loft area.
great location close to our wedding venue

description.summary:
Tree-top living in the Red River Gorge at it's finest!
Canopy 7 welcomes you to unwind and enjoy SPECTACULAR RRG sunrise views in style. Snuggled into the tree-tops, enjoy waking up to the refreshing smells of the forest and the sounds of songbirds and the waterfalls below.
With an open floor plan with a wall of windows ensuring that no matter where you are, you can enjoy the views of the forest below and the ridge lines beyond.
description.space:
Professionally designed utilizing modern Nordic style and Mid-Century touches, you‚Äôll immediately feel the coziness of Canopy 7.
The main level features a retro inspired kitchen with dining table, living area, bedroom with a comfy memory foam queen-sized bed, a large walk-in closet, a full bathroom with soaking tub & shower. There‚Äôs also a laundry room with a full-sized washer and dryer.


THE LOFT
A floating stair leads you to the open loft with two twin beds, cozy bean bag chairs and a yoga deck with mats, blocks and a foam roller. The location is PERFECT for those morning sun salutations.


 THE LOWER LEVEL
With lofty ceilings and cozy nooks, you‚Äôll love spending your evenings or rainy days curled up with a book from the onsite collection, playing records on the record player, or maybe even schedule a game night with the various board games available.
For those who would rather curl up with a good movie, you‚Äôll enjoy the Amazon Fire TV with access to Prime and many other movie and TV options.
There‚Äôs original artwork, family heirloom furniture and many other touches that bring warmth and coziness to this space for you to enjoy.
For convenience, a half-bath is also located on this level and you‚Äôll absolutely love the sliding glass doors that invite you to enjoy the outdoor hammocks for afternoon naps.


OUTDOOR SPACES
Relax in the hot tub while stargazing on the attached ample deck space, or enjoy your morning coffee on the wrap around deck of the home with a perfect view of the sunrise.
You may even spot some local wildlife coming into the yard to enjoy the salt block, so have your cameras ready.
Spend your evenings around the cozy fire pit area complete with Adirondack chairs and a picnic table...perfect for making s‚Äômores.


FOR THE COOKS
If your love language involves food, you‚Äôll find everything you need in the kitchen.
With an induction cook-top, retro microwave, toaster oven, refrigerator, toaster and blender, you can whip up most meals with ease. There‚Äôs even a handheld juicer, garlic press, wine bottle opener, measuring cups & spoons, mixing bowls and more. Simply bring your ingredients and enjoy ample sunlight and relaxed cabin vibes.


COFFEE LOVERS
Whether you enjoy an entire pot or just a cup, you can choose from a standard coffee maker or a Keurig. Simply bring your favorite blend, brew and enjoy!
There‚Äôs also a lovely tea kettle for the tea connoisseur.

FOR THE REMOTE WORKERS
If unplugging isn‚Äôt an option for you, you‚Äôll appreciate the high speed fiber optic wifi and a dedicated workspace located on the lower level. Being located on top of a ridge, typically cell service is also reliable so you‚Äôll be able to enjoy the best of both work and play.


THE PROPERTY
With 140 acres to explore, the trail system is expanding. Trails are marked with brightly colored icons on trees. Trails are shared with the other cabins on the property. Trail descriptions and maps will be available soon on the Canopy Cabins social media pages. As always, we do encourage guests to practice Leave No Trace while exploring.


GREEN BUILDING & ENERGY EFFICIENCY
The Canopy Cabins and neighboring Boulder Cabins were built with cutting edge and best practices of green building techniques.
Built to maximize solar exposure for lighting, thermal mass for heating and cooling efficiency and incredibly insulated, you‚Äôll appreciate the astute attention to detail but not at the expense of the environment or the beautiful surroundings.

Located Near Red River Gorge Area Attractions!
1 Minute from Hemlock Springs Wedding Venue 5 Minutes from Muir Valley
10 Minutes from Red Point BBQ
15 Minutes to Miguel‚Äôs Pizza
Situated on a private 140 acres, feel free to enjoy the private hiking trails on the property leading to rock houses, waterfalls and more!
Easily accessible in any vehicle with flat parking for two cars. Simply look for the BLUE door and the 7 on the privacy fence, and you‚Äôve arrived at your very own private vacation home.


GIVE US A FOLLOW
We invite you to follow us on social media and tag us on your stay! Find us on IG and FB at Canopy Cabins RRG for more helpful house tips and videos.
Are you ready to run away to the woods for your next vacation? If so, we welcome you to stay awhile and unwind at our cozy tree-top escape.
description.notes:
Pets are not allowed at this cabin. Toiletries not included.
WiFi is considered fast and the cell service is good in the area.
This cabin has city water and is considered safe for all uses.
The road to the cabin is a very well maintained gravel road and you should expect no issues arriving there in any sort of car.

No ATVS or UTVS
No trailers
Max 4 guests and 2 vehicles
No parking on the road
No pets, a $500 fee will be added to your stay if we find you have one.
By booking you agree to the above rules.

Insurance required statement: 
I am voluntarily participating in the Activity and I am participating entirely at my own risk. I am aware of the associated HOT TUB RISKS which may include but are not limited to drowning, heat exhaustion, heat stroke, skin/ear/bladder/lung or other infections, chemical burns or irritations, physical/psychological injury, pain, suffering, illness, disfigurement, disability, economic or emotional loss, paralysis or death.  I understand that these injuries or outcomes may arise from my own or others‚Äô negligence, or from the conditions at the Activity location.  Nonetheless, I assume all related risks, both known and unknown to me, of my participation in this activity.

During periods of inclement weather please come prepared, drive an appropriate vehicle, check the weather, and plan ahead. In the event you need towing services, we have a local contact we can recommend. We cannot cancel or discount your stay, or pay for towing expenses in the event you find yourself in that situation.

recent.comments: Hidden Haven was so cozy! It is in a great location, central to many of the busier areas, but secluded enough that you can just sit back, relax, and enjoy. I didn‚Äôt get to spend much time on the property, but I absolutely can not wait to come back to do just that. Thank you so much for hosting myself and my family (at Out Happy Place)! looks exactly like the pictures. The cabin is very private. It has everything you need for a relaxing getaway.

We loved our stay at Hidden Haven! It‚Äôs a small space, so every furnishing and amenity was carefully chosen and high-end. The setting is unbeatable‚Äîso peaceful and beautiful. We watched and listened to the songs of all kinds of birds in the trees and on the lower deck during the day and we were serenaded by the tree frogs while we enjoyed the hot tub and screened porch in the evening. The internet isn‚Äôt made for multiple devices to stream at once, but this isn‚Äôt that kind of vacation spot! Don‚Äôt get me wrong, we streamed peaceful music when we wanted, and even streamed a few shows, but we napped, we chatted, we read, we spent time together. The perfect spot for our anniversary trip!

Sarah outdid herself in every way! Our stay was perfect in so many ways. We have stayed at a lot of cabins for our anniversaries and this was hands down the best experience we‚Äôve had. Peaceful, unique and so so private. You often feel like the rest of the world has disappeared. The Italian place she recommended had incredible pizza and cheesesteaks and the La Naranja had incredible Mexican food. The flatbed grill on the deck was easy to use and made stellar breakfast and burgers. There‚Äôs a speaker that you can Bluetooth your tunes to and I‚Äôve never heard a small speaker have such fantastic bass response. And don‚Äôt get me started on the cigar and bourbon bar in the cabin. Sarah knows how to create an Airbnb! I would not hesitate to recommend this cabin ever! I want to go back in the fall to experience it with some cooler weather.

Hidden Haven, is just that a serene haven hidden in the trees! From the moment you arrive you notice that not one detail has been overlooked, it feels like a 5 star hotel suite! The porch was our favorite spot with the hot tub and fire pit and the way it opens right into the living space with the garage door. Looking forward to a return trip!

Hidden Haven is one of the best airBNB‚Äôs we have ever stayed at.  Sarah, was such a wonderful host and provided recommendations for local fishing/ swimming spots.  Small town vibes, definitely recommend to anyone looking to get away .
This place was amazing and was the perfect weekend getaway! Sarah is a wonderful host and she was fast to answer any questions we had. Loved the space and will definitely be coming back again!!

description.summary: Hidden Haven is just that! A 600 square foot romantic, private, peaceful, little haven. Hidden in the woods just 6 miles outside of the Town of Orange.  Open the garage door in the living area and step out on the 300 square foot screened in porch where you can relax at the firepit under the covered roof. On the porch at Hidden Haven, we like to say, "time wasted is time well spent". The romantic vibe and modern amenities make it a prefect place for a couple's getaway.

description.summary: Glamping tiny home located in the finger lakes region, nestled between Keuka & Canandaigua Lakes. The tiny home is located in a forest setting (hike in) area on our property, with access and views of a 10 acre pond. We provide a canoe and a row boat for use on the pond. Limited kitchen....outdoor cooking only, a propane grill is provided. This is more of an off grid site and we encourage you to enjoy the outdoor surroundings & wildlife. (Note the pond is shared with owners and other guests).
description.space: Tiny home open concept in the woods, hike in hike out trail. 1 queen bed in loft area, 1 day bed. Limited kitchen (mini fridge & kettle), outdoor cooking only, propane grill provided. Cell phone coverage is limited, & no WiFi. We strongly recommend hiking boots/snow boots (in winter) as well as a head lamp or flashlight during evening hours. There is approximately a 200 yard trail to access the tiny home, that is not plowed or shoveled. We strongly recommend SUV or 4 wheel drive vehicles during the winter months. If you plan to have a campfire, we do not provide firewood, so please be sure to bring your own.
description.access: All space inside and woods adjacent to pond. We include use of our canoes.
description.notes:
You will be surrounded by nature and the sounds of frogs, coyotes and owls at night. Also lots of fireflies, will not disappoint. There is also an outdoor fire pit and two Adirondack chairs. Other things to note: the property is quite large, and shared with other guests. There is one cabin we rent to ongoing tenants and we are working on building another Airbnb on the other side of the pond.

NO SMOKING.

NO PARTIES.
description.neighborhood: Keuka and Canandaigua Lakes within 10-15 mins. 10-20 minutes to Naples NY & Penn Yan.
description.transit: Plenty of room to park a car or two in the driveway as we have two and it‚Äôs a short walk down to the tiny home.
description.interaction: Our air b n b is self checkin, but we ask that you communicate ahead of time for weather conditions & your arrival time so we can better prepare our guests. We have designated signs showing you where to park and trail access to the tiny home.
description.house_rules:
No smoking and no candles allowed. Dishes to be washed if used. Soiled linens to be removed and placed in hamper in bathroom closet. All food garage placed in garbage can.

You must empty the liquid tray (number 1) after each use. Number 2 container, 1 scoop of peat moss must be placed on top for each use.

If you leave the toilet a mess or leave our place a mess we will take your security deposit.

We ask that you leave the place as clean as you found it.

There is one sink for your use located in the kitchen.
