description.access:
During Your Stay, You Will Have Access To The Entire Cottage, Parking And As Much Outdoor Living Space As In.

The Kitchen Is Fully Equipped With Pots, Pans, Cooking Utensils, Etc. You Will Also Find Some Small Appliances Such As A Toaster, a Drip Coffee Maker And A Blender. You Should Have Everything You Need To Enjoy Time In The Kitchen, Preparing Meals And Savouring Your Creations.

There Are Linens, Bath Towels And Beach Towels As Well As Extra Blankets And Pillows To Make Your Stay Extra Cozy.

The Hot Tub Off The Back Deck Is Available Year Round And Is Definitely One Of Our Favourite Spots To Relax And Stare Up At The Starry Night Sky.
description.notes:
There Are Certain Areas Inside The Cottage That Struggle To Receive Cell Coverage So We Would Suggest Using Wifi Calling Or To Step Outside For Clear Reception.

Bedrooms Accommodate 6 Guests Comfortably But For Group Sizes Up to 8, The Sofas Are A Sleeping Option As Well.

The Upstairs Bunk Bed Has a Max. Weight Limit of 170 Lbs. 

If You‚Äôre Curious About Shipping Container Living Or Are Just Looking For a Peaceful And Relaxing Getaway Come Check Us Out! We‚Äôd Be Happy To Host You!
description.neighborhood:
The Tiny Township And Penetanguishene Area Is Rich With History, Beauty And Nature.

Whether Visiting One Of The Main Attractions Like Awenda Provincial Park, Discovery Harbour Or Sainte-Marie Among The Hurons, Or Simply Taking A Walk Through Penetang And Checking Out The Local Small Businesses And Restaurants, You‚Äôll Be Sure To Find Some New And Interesting Things To Do.
description.transit: Guests Have Parking for Vehicles on Site and Have Easy Access to Get Anywhere by Car or A Variety of Attraction Spots Within a Short Walk.
description.interaction: Our Neighbour is the property caretaker and will be around during your stay for any immediate needs or assistance!
description.house_rules:
**Please Be Advised That the Door May Not Lock Automatically. You Will Have to Make Sure It Is Locked Before You Leave the House. ** -

 

1. Quiet Hours Start At 10pm Until 8am the Following Morning.

 

2. NO SMOKING Inside the Property. All Guests Must Dispose of Cigarette Butts in A Specified Container and Thrown Out Off the Property. Evidence of Indoor Smoking Will Result in a $500.00 Fine.

 

3. Furry Friends Are Welcome! But Please Note, Pets Are Not Allowed On Fabric Couches/Chairs And Beds. Any Evidence Or Damages As A Result Will Require Additional Cleaning And Will Be Charged Back To Your Reservation.

 

4. No Parties And/Or Undeclared Social Gatherings. Guest will be charged $500.00 for breaking rule.

 

5. A Surcharge Of $100.00 Per Undeclared Guest Per Night Will Be Applied For Unapproved Guests. Please Be Honest. This Is For Liability Purposes. Additionally, We Must Coordinate Cleaners And Inventory Based On The Number Of Guests That Occupy The Unit.

 

6. Lock All Windows And Doors If You Are Not Home.

 

7. Security Cameras Monitoring The Entrance Of The Home Is In Place For The Safety And Security Of The Home And Our Guests. DO NOT Touch/Tamper With These Cameras  Any Form Of Tampering Will Result In Immediate Cancellation Of Your Reservation.

 

8. Noise Monitoring - We Have A Zero-Tolerance Policy For Parties Or Large Gatherings. To Ensure This In The Most Comfortable And Least Intrusive Way Possible, We Use A Noise Sensor That Simply Measures The Decibel Level Inside The Stay; It Does Not Record Anything. Please DO NOT Touch/Tamper With This Noise Device. Any Evidence Of Tampering Will Result In Immediate Cancellation Of Your Reservation.

 

9. If Any Of The Listing Rules And Above Additional Rules Are Abused, You Will Be Subject To Additional Charges And Your Reservation May Be Terminated. You Will Be Asked To Vacate Immediately Without Refund.

name: The Overlook Box Hop - Hocking Hills
title: Rockbridge, Ohio

hosts.about: Administrative Assistant to The Box Hop

Hello! We are Emily & Seth. Along with our four kids, Mina, Emery, Estelle and Millie, we love traveling, exploring and all things coffee and food! We own five shipping container homes that we rent in the Hocking Hills region of Southern Ohio and we love people.

recent.comments: The Overlook was a wonderful place to stay with my family. It was very unique and peaceful; I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in staying there. Seth and Emily were amazing hosts and I even got to go look at another new build they are working on‚Ä¶. sooo cool. I also wanted to let people know that Seth also showed me their wedding venue on the property they have as well and it‚Äôs absolutely beautiful and a great place to look at to have a wedding. Thanks again Emily and Seth for all your hospitality! We had a great time!!!

items.comments: The Overlook was a wonderful place to stay with my family. It was very unique and peaceful; I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in staying there. Seth and Emily were amazing hosts and I even got to go look at another new build they are working on‚Ä¶. sooo cool. I also wanted to let people know that Seth also showed me their wedding venue on the property they have as well and it‚Äôs absolutely beautiful and a great place to look at to have a wedding. Thanks again Emily and Seth for all your hospitality! We had a great time!!!

I had stayed at the Overlook previously with friends and brought my family back for my daughter‚Äôs birthday. Such a cute place!  Decor is great and plenty of space for the 4 of us! Emily and Seth do a very nice job of making you feel at home! I hope to check out their other properties soon!
Great time. Thanks!

We had a wonderful stay at the Overlook. The place was serene and peaceful. We enjoyed cooking in the kitchen and the patio. 

There were a few items that weren‚Äôt available as promised like the French press and firewood, but once I reached out they were able to assist and make things right. Much appreciated!

Emily and Seth‚Äôs place was incredible! I‚Äôve always wanted to stay in a container home and this one was super luxurious. The kitchen was beautiful, hot tub was perfect, beds were very comfortable. Everything was clean with a setup that makes sense for sleeping or gathering. My entire group had a great time with the location being so close to all of the hikes of Hocking Hills and quick trip into Columbus for nights downtown. Thank you!!!
Place was beautiful. Seth and Emily were the most helpful, responsible, and prepared hosts that we‚Äôve stayed with.

The overlook is a fantastic stay! The views are incredible. It was very peaceful and relaxing. Emily and Seth communicated very well from the moment we booked the overlook! Everything was well done and the beds were super comfy! We stayed 4 days and had an absolute great time and didn‚Äôt want to leave.

description.summary:
Calendar for 2022 & 2023  is up to date. Please subscribe to our mailing list to be notified of cancellations and other Box Hop happenings: www.theboxhop.com 

The Overlook Box Hop - is our newest build by the Box Hop team (Emily & Seth Britt). The name speaks for itself, as it "Overlooks" the beautiful rolling acres of Hocking Hills, Ohio. Using four 40 foot shipping containers, we have transformed and recycled these once cargo containers into an experience in and of itself. 

The interior is a transitional design that will make you feel right at home. The kitchen flows right into the dining and open living space, perfect for entertaining. 

The Overlook features 3 bedrooms (one a bunk room perfect for kids), 1.5 baths, and a hot tub. It is enough space to host 7-8 people. 

Lastly, it's worth noting that the property is a total of 75 acres, home to 2 waterfalls and a plethora of hiking possibilities right on site. 

We are SO thrilled to share the newest Box Hop, the Overlook, with you and we cannot wait to host you. 

Xo  - 
The Britt's
description.notes:
Guests may cancel for a full refund minus approximately 4% taken out for Paypal fees until 5 days before check-in. If the reservation is canceled after that, the guest is entitled to a 50% refund if canceled 24 hours prior to the beginning of the reservation. Within 24 hours of the confirmed reservation, if the guest cancels their stay, there is no refund.

Please note: The house does have WiFi,  however, due to the secluded setting of the property, we are limited to satellite service which can be finicky, especially in inclement weather. We normally test at speeds of 15 MB down and 2 MB up which is within zooms requirements

We have made SC home with our boys for over 10 years now. We love to paddle, climb, hike and ride.  Together we have owned and mangaged multiple long and short term properties.

recent.comments: Great place to relax and wind down.

items.comments: Great place to relax and wind down.

Cute place! Perfect location to lots of parks, Greenville, SC and Cashiers, NC. Nice deck to sit outside! Pictures make it seem like it is closer to the lake and dock access than it really is. Still totally accessible, but def a short hike to get to the lake and dock.
We enjoyed the place. Everything was great and  was as described. Great location as well.
Great place for a weekend at the lake.
Such a great place to stay! Perfect for a family getaway. Kids loved the paddle boards and jumping off the deck! Will be back in the future
Easy to check in and out. House was as described. Very peaceful and private. Nathan and Carson responded quickly with any questions we had.
perfect in every way, fisherman's dream spot

description.summary:
Water front cottage with the best long range mountain views on the lake.

Cozy 2 bedroom home (800 sq ft) with open floor plan that has a large fantastic deck and swimming dock for your get away. This beautiful 100 acre lake is nestled in the mountains of South Carolina and is a perfect base camp for just relaxing or adventuring.
description.space: The space is open with lots of light and feels like your staying in a tree house above the water. Open floor plan allows for the space to feel much bigger than it is.  We have provided updated modern furnishings that will allow our guests to hopefully feel at home. The house sits at the end of the road and is in a very quite wooded area. Wifi and a 40 inch Smart TV are available when not enjoying the lake or all of the nearby recreational opportunities.
description.notes:
Things to know..... 

Because we are in the mountains and the house sits up high on a hill there is a short down hill walk to the dock along a narrow trail. 

Home is on a septic and will clog if anything other than toilet paper is flushed. No wipes of any kind. 

An outdoor security camera is present. No cameras indoors. 

Well behaved pets are ok with an additional 40$ pet fee per pet. No more than 2 pets in the house. We ask that pets please stay off furniture and not be left alone in the house. Pets must stay on leash when outside and not roam the neighborhood. 

While the HOA lake rules do not allow outside watercraft (boats, kayaks etc) we do allow guests to use our paddle boards. Please read the lake rules concerning floating on the lake and wear a life jacket found in the dock box. 

All trash must be in bags. We pay for a private company to pick up garbage. They do so by hand and will not pick loose trash in the bin. 

There is no Washer or Dryer or Dishwasher available. 

More details on the house and area can be found in the house manual.
description.neighborhood:
This is a small private community and the neighborhood and lake is quite and peaceful. We respect and care for our neighbors and the members of the lake community and we want our guests to do same. Please review the lake rules and be respectful of our community. 

Special Lake Use Rules for Short Term Renters: 
1. Short Term Renters are extended the privilege to fish, swim and use nonmotorized watercraft in the lake. Non-motorized watercraft includes canoes, kayaks, john boats, row boats, body, stand-up boards, and any other small craft that is not powered by gas or electricity. Use of watercraft by short term renters shall be in any cove and within 50 feet of shoreline. 
2. All watercraft used by renters must be registered and the lake association will provide the vessels with proper identification that should be attached to the right side of the vessel. Softsided or inflatable craft does not require ID. 
3. NO OUTSIDE WATERCRAFT IS ALLOWED is allowed; all craft in lake must be owned by the property owners and be registered. 
4. No swimming or use of watercraft without proper lighting after dark. 
5. Guest of the lake are NOT allowed within 25 feet of dam or dam equipment. Guests are not allowed to use the boat launch area. 
6. All fishing shall be in accordance to SC laws and trot lines, fish baskets, jug fishing, or netting of fish is not allowed. 
7. All renters should be directed to these rules and acknowledge that they understand the lake use rules prior to arrival. Property owners (members) are responsible for guests and guests use of the lake.
 8. Renters are subject to all local and state laws. Any violation of these laws/rules will result in loss of lake privilege for the guests, and could result in fines, loss of deposits, eviction from property. 
9. Guest and owners both agree that if a guest breaks rules or/and causes issues that the owner will give a negative rating on the rental agreement site. 
10. Quiet hours are 11PM to 7AM 11. Our lake is a beautiful mountain treasure, we want residents and guest to have a safe and enjoyable time at the lake and in the mountains. Please keep our area clean and the lake free of trash.

title: Logan, Ohio

hosts.about: We are new to vacation rentals but dedicated to making our guest feel relaxed in our spaces.

recent.comments: Unique space perfect for relaxing. My son and I loved the game room and enjoyed chatting with other guests. The upper deck provides perfect viewing for sunrises and sunsets.  Host communication was quick, informative and accurate.  Thank you for a wonderful place to stay!

items.comments: Unique space perfect for relaxing. My son and I loved the game room and enjoyed chatting with other guests. The upper deck provides perfect viewing for sunrises and sunsets.  Host communication was quick, informative and accurate.  Thank you for a wonderful place to stay!

Such an adorable place and we had such a good time. The owners were super responsive and allowed us to check in earlier last minute üòä The game room was super fun located on the property and I loved all the personal touches!
A nice place to stay!

We loved our stay at the Blue Bird! The unit was beautiful and well appointed for a small space. Everything was clean and comfortable, and the outdoor space was inviting. The game room in the barn was an awesome extra touch! My husband and I enjoyed playing shuffleboard, pool and soaking in the hot tub in our down time.

Hillside retreats was everything my wife and I needed for a weekend away to decompress. Beautiful and clean grounds with nice gameroom that guests can enjoy. We stayed in the bluebird shipping container and throughly enjoyed it. Their yurts look equally as nice. Units are spaced well to allow each unit to feel private. Would recommend to anyone looking for a unique stay.

Extremely nice and responsive host!! The place overall was perfect. My wife and I wanted a private weekend. This was secluded and quite about 20 minutes from town. We will be going back for another weekend.

It was a beautiful stay; super quiet, remote enough to feel away from the world, but close enough to town to ensure you have the items you need. If you plan to use the hot tub be sure to bring an extra towel just in case. Otherwise, clear instructions are given and support for your stay. We will book again for sure. It was a needed retreat from the world, with opportunity to go out and hike, while an equal opportunity to stay in and stay remote.

description.summary:
Check out our 20ft 
 shipping container, that recently added a 10 by 16 bedroom addition to the space too!. The shipping container sits on a 40ft by 20ft deck, which includes a 20ft by 12 ft cover area that has out door love seats, hot tub, fire pit and gas grill. If you are feeling adventurous you can walk up the stairs case to hang out on top of the shipping container that has a sitting area on that 20ft by 8ft deck.
description.space: The inside of the shipping container includes, bathroom, shower and sink combo room. Kitchenette that includes a kcup machine that your favorite coffee grounds can be added, toaster, mini refrigerator/freezer, microwave, single burner hot plate, pots, pans, dishes, etc. Also includes a 2-TV's, and electric fireplace mounted on the wall the has led black lighting that you can change the interior of shipping container to your mood. The bed use to be Serta that easily coverts into a couch for more seating, but we just added a new bedroom addition on this unit! You can hang out in our common area pole barn that includes a pool table, shuffleboard, darts, large sofa, mini refrigerator/ freezer, full bathroom and high top table.  Come rest, and restore at our Hillside Retreats location.
description.access:
Guest have access to their own private unit, fire pit and hot tub area. 

You also have access to our private game room for guests only. The game room is located in the pole barn that sits in the center of the property. The door to the right will take you in the game room. The game room includes pool tables, shuffleboard table, darts, Kan jam, giant jenga, yardzee, putterball and more. ( Please sanitize your hands prior to entry and upon exiting sanitize any games played.)
description.notes:
Please read below what's provided.

Here is some information on what's provided to help you while you pack! 

Items that come with your rental for 2 night stays. If you are staying longer it will be multiplied for each extra day. 

4 Kcups
2 Black tea packets
2 Mint tea packets
4 creamers
4 Sugar in the raw packets
4 Sweet in low packets
2 bottles of water
2 skinny pop-pop corns
2 little Debbie coffee cakes snacks 

There are pots, pans, dishes, coffee cups, cups, wine glasses,¬† rubber wine glasses, utensils, knives, scissors, can opener, wine opener, 2 induction cook top burners, toaster, grill tongs and spatula, measuring cup, measuring spoons, lighter. Kcup machine, gas grill, propane for grill, microwave and mini refrigerator freezer combo. 

1 Steamer for clothes, hair dryer, 4 large towels, 4 wash clothes, 2 make up towels, 2 hand towels, 1 bath mat. 
There is a shower dispenser with shampoo, conditioner, and body gel for your use. You will be also provided 1 small hand soap bar. 
Few board games. Use of pole barn game room right as well. 

Tv is a smart tv you will need to log into your streaming service. Each unit has its on wifi hot spot, as we are in the country you can stream but does not work as it would in the city. 

All bedding is provided for the bed.
description.interaction: During your stay if you have any issues or question please text our office line provided on your access information sheet.
description.house_rules:
Additional rules  " No smoking/vaping of any kind in our rentals or game room. No incense or candles. A clean fee will be charged if smoke is detected.  
-Due to the material of the dome, if you smoke/vape, it must be off the deck area or by the fire pit area only.   
Prior to Stay.  You will need to send us a copy of you and your guest IDs for our file and your preferred email for us to send lease to sign electronically via dotloop.  Upon completion, you will receive your access information for your stay.   During your stay.  
-After check in please check please check your welcome basket for instructions for items in the unit prior to calling our office please. 
-Hot tub. Upon arrival, view instructions on how to turn up to the desired temperature. Please see the welcome basket on how to take out of eco mode and turn up. (When the hot tub is not in use, you must cover as it will not stay heated. If not, do not take any glass glasses or bottles in the hot tub. "There are rubber ones provided for your safety." 
-If shoes are muddy, remove shoes and place them in boot tray provided or outside, please, and thank you.   Please do the following prior to leaving.  
-Dishes to be washed and placed in dishes strainer and placed in sink.  
Place all used towels, wash clothes, robes if present, make up towels, and hand towels in plastic hamper located in the bathroom.  
-Please remove trash from both trash cans provided in the room and place a trash bag in the dumpster by the exit of the property on the right.  
-Prior to leaving if fire pit is cooled off, please cover it with provided cover. (Do not put anything but wood in fire pit).  
-Do not flush any disposable wipes, feminine products, or toilet wipes in toilets. The units have septic systems and are not meant for these products to be flushed down.  
-View checklist on door to make sure you followed the instructions.

hosts.about: From Ohio and traveling has become a big part of my life now that I am out of college and have funds to do so.  Always looking for unique homes and rooms that don't fit the cookie cutter hotel format!!

recent.comments: Great place, super clean and convenient.

items.comments: Great place, super clean and convenient.
Amazing cabin for an intimate getaway. The place was squeaky clean and had great amenities.
Had a super relaxing weekend getaway everything was amazing.

Great stay! Place was clean and smelled great! A small group of us stayed for a quiet bachelorette night. We enjoyed the hot tub, plenty of clean towels, and enjoyed the arcade games! Definitely would stay again.

We took my sister and brother-in-law with us to the Hoot. A beautiful weekend that we took advantage of while hiking the Hocking Hills area. The Hoot was very clean and comfortable. We made use the the grill and hot tube  and Pac Man game :-)  We highly recommend the Hoot.

We loved this house! One of the nicest houses I have ever stayed in! Was super clean, loved the decor, beds were comfy and had a great time at Justin‚Äôs place! The hot tub was amazing too! Would stay here again next time we come to the Hocking Hills area. Justin was also a great host, check in and out was seamless and he even checked in with us before and after our stay. We were very impressed with the property.
Everything was amazing

description.summary: The Hoot is made from two 40 Foot containers and sits on 5 acres with a view for miles.  We are just a 5-minute  drive to Rock House and 20 minutes from Old Mans Cave and Ash Cave and other Hocking Hills State Park locations.  We have 3 bedrooms, all queen beds, full kitchen with fridge/stove/dishwasher, 2 living rooms with smart TV's for your favorite streaming services and an arcade with Buck Hunter and Pacman.  There is also a large deck with a hot tub and a grill and Fire-pit are below.
description.space: Guests will be able to enjoy the entire 5 acres which also offers a fire pit.  Just fyi we do NOT provide wood for the fire pit.  The nearest place to get wood is at the gas station located just 8 mins away in Laurelville.
description.access: Guest have access to both floors.  Upon arriving you will walk down a stone path and enter onto the deck.  Once on deck you will enter the Hoot through the main door via the code entered on the lock.  Finally, the guests will also have access to the fire pit outside which  you can access via the steps from the deck or the slider downstairs.
description.notes:
Due to the previous guests checking out and giving adequate time for cleaning, check in will be 4pm the first day of your stay.

There is NO SMOKING anywhere inside the house or on the deck area. A $200 fine will be charged if this house rule is broken.
description.neighborhood: We are also located just 8 minutes from Laurelville which has a full grocery store, gas station and 4 restaurants.
description.interaction: Love interacting with guests so if you have any questions please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out!!

Our newest renovation. Two 20 feet containers stacked on top of each other. Creating a Livingroom, kitchen upstairs and bedroom, bathroom downstairs, with a walkout patio.

hosts.about:
I‚Äôm a commercial pilot and living in Ontario but love to travel! Always looking for new places to stay and explore. 

Also a co-host at Inn The Orchard in Jordan Station!

We are Jan & Fabiola Prins, born and raised in the Westland greenhouse district in the Netherlands. In 1998, we fell in love with the space and opportunities we saw in Canada, specifically in the Niagara region.

We own and operate Prins Grow Inc, specializing in cut flowers since 1998. We have been blessed with two girls (Sarah and Fay). Over the years, as we grew together as a family, we saw the need for Inn the Orchard, a place where couples could celebrate and a space where business could benefit from a fresh air perspective -a farm stay that offers rest and inspiration for both body and mind. 

In 2019, we expanded into the hospitality industry opening Inn the Orchard. Our 17 acre property, is nestled among Niagara‚Äôs fruit trees and grapevines, sitting on the shores of 16 Mile Creek.

recent.comments: An incredible host and place to stay! Highly recommend.

items.comments: An incredible host and place to stay! Highly recommend.
Enjoyed a 2 night stay at the orchard Inn. Was quiet and relaxing. We were able to pick peaches right on the property and they were delicious. Would definitely recommend.

We felt welcome and at home instantly. Fabiola is kind, responsive, and ready to meet any needs. The location is beautiful and peaceful, and the container unit is cozy and comfortable with that desired modern touch!  We would stay there again in a heartbeat! Highly recommend.

The container home was small but cozy and tastefully decorated. The hot tub was fantastic as well as the indoor and outdoor seating areas, barbecue and cone chimney. Unfortunately, the home was tilted slightly and we had to be careful descending the stairs. This was not mentioned before, like the fruit flies.
It was nice to be surrounded by peach trees and others. Unfortunately, we were never able to get close to the ripened fruits at the back of the main house, due to their semi-guard dog. It was a little scary since I had been bitten by a dog as a child.
Despite instructions about there being a basket for fruit picking, there was no basket in the home and after texting the owner as to where it is or what to do, we were told that the basket was simply in the barn. We were not given directions as to where or what the barn looked like. There were some nearby unidentified fruit on trees but after inquiring by text, we  did not receive an answer as to what they were.

This was a fabulous place to stay.  The host is nice and very responsive.  the place was clean and looked just as beautiful as the pictures. 10 out of 10 would recommend and will definitely be going again!

I recommend this place. Fabiola was very friendly and responsive. Nice and quiet area. It‚Äôs about a 20 minute drive from Niagara Falls. AC works extremely well üòÜ - We also enjoyed picking a few peaches üçë just a few steps away.  If we visit Canada üá®üá¶ again, this will be my first choice.
We really enjoyed our stay! Private, and very clean. We really enjoyed the hot tub. Fabiola was very responsive to messages and questions

description.summary:
Enjoy the sounds of nature when you stay in this unique place. Our newly renovated "Valley View, Container Home" in beautiful Niagara at Inn The Orchard, has been designed with all luxuries of home but created guaranteeing a relaxing atmosphere and simplicity that you'll never forget. We love creating spaces allowing you to escape the city, be surrounded by nature while remaining in the heart of Niagara's Wine Country!
Enjoy this unique spot, with a beautiful view. Surrounded by fruit orchards.

description.summary:
*Newly renovated and styled by a designer* Welcome to the most romantic cabin in the Smokies! Modern and newly built, this tiny home is perfect for couples looking for the perfect mountain getaway.

Come enjoy the Fall Season in the Smokies! Conveniently located within a short drive to major attractions in Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge & Dollywood, this cabin also provides a quiet vacation in a private neighborhood.

*Wi-Fi
*Hot Tub
*Fire Pit
*Charcoal Grill
*Smart TV
*King Bed
*Electric Fireplace
description.space:
Located in a quiet and brand new neighborhood, our cabin is packed with everything that you need and features the following: smart TV, fully equipped kitchenette for home cooked meals, cozy electric fireplace, outdoor seating, relaxing hot tub, fire pit, charcoal grill and starter kits to help you get started on your perfect vacation! 

Key features: 
* Hot Tub
* Fire Pit
* 1 King-sized Bed (sleeps 2)
* Smart TV
* Comfy loveseat sofa
* Electric fireplace
* Bar table and barstools 
* Iron & ironing board

Check out some of our most recent reviews:

"My husband and I truly cannot say enough things about this cabin! The location is absolutely perfect! Main attractions are only a short drive away; however, the cabin definitely feels very safe, peaceful, and romatic! The house was incredibly clean and it was stocked with all of the needed supplies! The house decorations are very cozy and the bed is beyond comfortable! We loved how everything was on one floor so our little one could run around without worry! The hosts were incredibly kind, and responded quickly! My husband and I can't wait to return! We would definitely recommend this cabin to couples or small families for a relaxing getaway." - Timothy

"I truly wish I could give them more than 5 stars. We loved everything about this Airbnb. It is perfect for a couples get away. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need, the bed is comfy, they provide towels, wash cloths, and min shampoos and body wash. The place is incredibly clean and check-in was a breeze. Location is great. The hosts were lovely and answered quickly. On our first night, we were already thinking about when we were coming back!" - Sydney

"This cabin was amazing! My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights and it was definitely worth it! The cabin was very clean and decorated nicely. The hot tub worked perfectly, and the electric fireplace is a nice at night. Adriano is an amazing host. He quickly responded to whatever I asked. He is friendly and will do whatever he can to make the best out of your stay. We will certainly come back!." - Roberto

Kitchenette: 
* Fully equipped with pots and pans, glassware, plates and silverware
* Major appliances: microwave, 2-burner cooktop & refrigerator
* Coffee Maker 
* Toaster Oven
* Spatulas and cooking spoons
* Cooking spices, salt and pepper
* Coffee condiment starter kit (sugars & creamers)
* Starter kit that includes: 1 roll of paper towels, dish detergent, sponge & 2 trash bags. 

Bathroom: 
* Shower
* Hair dryer 
* Amenities starter kit includes: 1 travel size shampoo & 2 body bar soaps
* Starter kit of 2 toilet papers
* Hand & body towels

Outdoor space: 
* 2-person hot tub
* Outdoor seating includes: Adirondack chairs by fire pit, outdoor chairs set in both the front porch and deck areas.
* Fire pit: **please note that we do not provide firewood, so please bring your own**
* Charcoal Grill: **please note that we do not provide charcoal, so please bring your own**

Book with us today and experience the Smokies like never before!
description.access:
*	Access to the entire cabin.
*	Free parking on premises. 
*      Self check-in with keypad entry. You will get your own code prior to check-in, so there‚Äôs no need to meet anybody to get keys!
description.notes:
* This little gem is located in a peaceful and brand new neighborhood with just a few neighbors around. While the roads are paved, they can be narrow and winding leading to the cabin (we are in the mountains after all). The drive will be a breeze once you have done it for the first or second time, however, if you are not comfortable driving in the mountains this may not be the place for you.
* No pets/No smoking (inside or outside of the property) is allowed. 
* No parties allowed.
* 4WD or AWD vehicles are recommended during inclement weather.
* WiFi Internet is provided for your enjoyment but speeds are not guaranteed and should not be relied for work.
* The cabin is in the mountains, cellphone service can be spotty. 
* The cabin is regularly treated by pest control, however, please keep in mind that we are located in the mountains and it would be impossible to prevent all critters.
* You will be provided with a starter pack of bathroom toiletries, dish detergent, trash bags, paper towel and toilet paper. You will likely need more if your stay is longer than a few days. 
* The cabin is equipped with a convenient coffee maker. We do not provide coffee, so please bring your own.
* Firewood is not provided. They can be purchased at any of the local grocery stores.
* No refunds are given for weather/power outages. Travel insurance is highly recommended.
description.neighborhood:
‚Ä¢	Located in a tranquil neighborhood close to Douglas Lake. 
‚Ä¢	Conveniently located close to grocery stores, restaurants, gas stations and pharmacies.

description.house_rules:
- All guests must be over the age of 25 to place a booking and must be staying. 
- No RVs, campers or camping tents can park in this cabin. 
- Quiet hours are from 10PM ‚Äì 7AM
- Before you leave, we ask that the items below be completed to help our housekeeping team quickly prepare for the next guest: 
1.	Please empty the refrigerator and place all trash in the trash can. 
2.	Please hand wash all the dishes. 

By confirming your booking, you agree to adhere to the short term rental rules set forth in this listing: 

SHORT TERM RENTAL AGREEMENT 

This Short Term Rental Agreement (the ‚ÄúAgreement‚Äù) is made by and between Adriano Kira and Yamel Arvelo, Owners of this Cabin and GUEST, (‚ÄúGuest‚Äù) as of the electronic acceptance date of this booking. For good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the parties hereby agree as follows: 
1. Property. The property is furnished and includes household appliances, furnishings, decorations, artwork, linens, towels, kitchenware, audio/video equipment and personal property. 
2. Rental Party/Maximum Occupancy: The rental party shall be limited to the number listed on the rental reservation. The maximum number of guests is limited to 2 persons, unless a specific written exemption has been made by Owner. An additional charge of $100 minimum per person per night for guests in addition to above guests may be assessed. At all times during said rental period, Guest agrees to have no more than the allowed number of guests for occupancy, (including children). If more than the stated number of guests are found to be occupying the unit, without prior written permission, Owner has the right to terminate this contract and Guest will forfeit all monies paid, including rent, cleaning, and deposits. 
3. Term of the Lease. The rental period begins at 4pm on the dates in the reservation and will end at 10am, on the checkout date. Check in time is 4pm and check out time is 10am. 
4. Rental Rules: Guest agrees to abide by the Rental Rules attached as Addendum A at all times while at the property and shall cause all members of the rental party and anyone else Guest permits on the property to abide by the following rules at all times while at the property. Should Guest violate these rules, Owner reserves the right to cancel this rental immediately with no refund due to Guest. 
5. Noise: Guest understands and agrees that they, and all members of their rental party will be respectful to our neighbors, including, driving slowly on the road to the property, not creating any noise (including music) which the neighbors can hear, especially in the evening and during the night. Any violation of this rental agreement and Guest will be required to leave immediately, with no refund for any unused rental time. 
6. Access: Guest shall allow Homeowner access to the property for purposes of repair and inspection. Homeowner shall exercise this right of access in a reasonable manner. 
7. Rental Rate and Fees: The rental rate shall be as stated on booking platform. 
8. Security Deposit: Guest shall deposit a security deposit per the terms of booking platform for any damages to the property. Said security deposit shall be returned to Guest after departure, less any deductions for damages. In addition, should said damages exceed coverage, Guest hereby assumes all liability for reimbursement to Owner for any damages caused by Guest and their party within 5 (five) business days of receipt of invoice from Owner. 
9. Condition of Property: Guest shall return the premises in the same condition as received. As a part of the rental agreement, Guest will pay a $125 cleaning fee which includes normal ‚Äúturn‚Äù cleaning. Guest agrees they will be responsible for excessive additional cleaning if needed, and hereby agrees to have excessive cleaning deducted from their security deposit, at Owner‚Äôs sole discretion. Guest also agrees to leave the property in good condition with all items, furniture, etc in the same place as where they found them upon move in. 
10. Cancellation Policy: Guests are advised that cancellation policy shall be enforced as described on the booking platform. 
11. No Assignment or Subletting: This Agreement shall not be assigned, nor the premises sublet without the prior written consent of the Owner. Guest acknowledges that they will personally occupy the property for the entire lease or rental period and will not sublet any portion of the property. Violation of these terms shall give Owner the right to immediately evict Guest and terminate this Agreement, and Guest will forfeit any right of return of any monies paid to date including any security deposit. 
12. Indemnification: Guest agrees to indemnify Owner and Owner‚Äôs Agent and save Owner and Owner‚Äôs Agent from and against any and all claims, actions, damages, liabilities and expenses, including reasonable attorney‚Äôs fees in connection with the loss of life, personal injury, illness, and/or damage to the property arising from or out of any occurrence in, upon, or about the premises, occasioned by an act or omission by Owner, Owner‚Äôs Agent, Guest or other occupants. OWNER and OWNER‚ÄôS AGENT SHALL HAVE NO LIABILITY FOR DAMAGES OR INJURY to Guest or Guests: It is expressly understood and agreed that Owner and Owner‚Äôs Agent will not be liable for any damages or injury to Guest or other occupants and their property from whatever cause arising from the occupancy of said premises, both inside and outside of the house, whether on the property or elsewhere. THE SUPERVISION AND SAFETY OF ALL CHILDREN ARE THE DIRECT RESPONSIBILITY OF GUEST OR PARENTS, OR CARETAKERS OF ANY CHILDREN ON THE PREMISES, including but not limited to decks, hot tub and any and all other activities on the premises. Guest specifically accepts ALL liability for use of hot tub on the property and understands that Owner and Owner‚Äôs Agent shall have no liability from any accidents, injuries, or death that may result from the proper or improper use of said hot tub. Guest accepts said liability by voluntary use of said hot tub. 
13. Entire Agreement: This document and any attached addendum constitute the entire agreement between the parties. No oral statements shall be binding. This Agreement may only be amended by a written document duly executed by all parties. It is the intention of the parties that if any portion of this Agreement is invalid for any reason, such invalidity shall not void the remainder of the Rental Agreement. 
14. GUEST ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THEY HAVE REVIEWED AND UNDERSTAND THE TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT and the Rules and Regulations attached, and agree to be bound by them. 
15. Guest and Owner acknowledge that this document is available for review on the booking platform and is implied that this Agreement is legally binding acceptance of all terms and conditions, the same as if Guest had actually executed the Agreement in person. 

ADDENDUM A RENTAL RULES 
By making a reservation at this Cabin, Guest agrees that Guest and Guest‚Äôs party will abide by these Rules and Regulations, as well as any other Rules and Regulations posted in the Guidebook or on the property. 
1. The Guest understands and agrees that the Owner and/or Owner‚Äôs Agent of this Cabin are not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. Guest specifically indemnifies and holds the Owner and Owner‚Äôs Agent harmless from any liability. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise. If all guests on this reservation do not personally sign this waiver of liability, then the primary renter accepts liability for all guests and hereby waives any Owner or Owner Agent liability on their behalf. 
2. Owner and/or Owner‚Äôs Agent are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. 
3. Access to the property will be available at 4pm, the starting day of your rental. Guest will be given a code for the key pad on the door, for private access to the cabin. The code will be provided to you prior to check in. 
4. People other than those in the Guest party set forth in the Rental Agreement may not stay overnight in the property. The property shall not be used for gatherings of any kind for anyone other than registered Guests (i.e. dinner parties, weddings, etc.) without advance express written permission of the Owner. 
5. Guest promises to keep the property and all furnishings in good order and to leave the property in the same (or better) condition than when it was rented. 
6. Guest promises to only use appliances and amenities of the vacation rental for their intended uses. 
7. A virtual guestbook will be provided for instructions on use of hot tub, fireplace, thermostat, and other cabin notes. Guest will abide by instructions for use of such items. 
8. Children: This cabin is family friendly and welcomes well-behaved children who are respectful of the property. Parents hereby agree to supervise their children both indoors and outdoors, especially in and around the hot tub, and deck areas. 
9. Electric Fireplace: Please read the guidelines in the virtual guestbook on how to use the fireplace properly. This fireplace will get HOT so take precautions to keep children away from it when lit or when it is hot. 
10. Plumbing: The septic system is very effective; however, it will clog if improper material is flushed. DO NOT FLUSH anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products should be flushed at any time. Please use only the toilet tissue that is provided. If there is a clog in the system, Guest will be charged damages accordingly. 
11. Hot Tub: Guest understands that a hot tub is available on the property for their private use. Guest assumes any and all liability from use of said hot tub. Guest is aware that consuming alcoholic beverages while in the hot tub increases the alcoholic effect of the alcohol. Guest will keep the hot tub closed and cover locked when not in use, and will supervise any children when using the hot tub. By using the hot tub, Guest agrees to assume all liability from said use and hereby indemnifies Owner. 
12. Weather: this cabin is located in a mountain setting. While the road is typically clear and accessible in any vehicle, winter weather is possible during certain months. We love the snow but local roads can be snow covered, curvy and steep. Owner highly recommends four-wheel drive and/or chains during winter events, and cannot refund anything due to road conditions or power outages caused by inclement weather. Travel insurance is recommended. 
13. FALSIFIED RESERVATIONS: Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of advance payment, deposit and/or rental money, and the party will not be permitted to check-in. 
14. STORM POLICY/ROAD CONDITIONS: No refunds will be given for storms. If your vacation is during the winter months, please come prepared to drive in snow and/or ice to reach your rental property. We do not refund due to road conditions. 
15. WINTER CONDITIONS: Tenants are notified that this home is in a mountain location where winter conditions may apply. Walkways, driveways, sidewalks, stairs, etc‚Ä¶ may be slippery due to ice and snow. These areas may be slippery even when they do not appear to be. It is advised that caution be used. Please step carefully on all outdoor surfaces. It is further advised that shoes be removed upon entering the home as wet or icy soles can cause slippery conditions on floors inside the cabin. 
16. Pets: No pets are permitted at this cabin at any time, not even visiting pets, inside or outside. Penalties and/or cancellation of reservation without refund will be enforced. 
17. Smoking: Smoking is NOT allowed anywhere in the property, inside or outside. 
18. Alcoholic Beverages & Drugs: Guest agrees that there will be no illegal activities on the premises, including but not limited to: possession, serving or consumption of alcoholic beverages by anyone under the age of 21; or the possession or use of any illegal drugs. Additionally, Guest accepts full responsibility and liability and hereby indemnifies Owner and/or Owner‚Äôs agents for anything that happens in reference to Guest and/or Guest‚Äôs party partaking of any alcoholic beverages or drugs on the property. 
19. Fireworks: Although fireworks may be legal in Tennessee, they are not permitted at this cabin at any time. 

By making a reservation at this cabin, Guest agrees that Guest and Guest‚Äôs party will abide by these Rules and Regulations, as well as any other Rules and Regulations posted in the Guidebook or on the property.

name: 1-Bedroom Shipping Container Plant-Home
title: Wilmington, North Carolina

gallery.caption: BOOTS. This is her neighborhood. She visits several houses around Kidder for food and to keep the humans in line. She stops at the container for a meal, likes to come inside and will meow for treats. She is the sweetest and is flea treated.

Grey Cat. He usually lives in the forest in the front yard of the container and is truly freaked out by being inside. He is super sweet, love-able and flea treated. He will eat food if fed outside and will lounge around the front yard... then vanish!

Cute Cat. He's adorable and can't help it, but will bite your hand off if you pet too much. Be wary. Boots and Grey cat are harmless, but cutie here will maim. He's new and doesn't always show up. He may also try to come inside.

Boots and Grey Cat come around nearly every day, if you aren't comfortable with cats, let me know! And, just keep Boots from coming inside, they will eventually leave you alone because they have stuff to do!

hosts.about: I love to travel, especially internationally. I play tennis. I like to explore like Bourdain, always looking for an authentic cultural experience. I love all food and look forward to trying new things. I hope you do too! :)

recent.comments: Reid and Jamie‚Äôs place was exactly as described in the listing. It was clean and simple. We loved the grey kitty and coffee options. We would return!

items.comments: Reid and Jamie‚Äôs place was exactly as described in the listing. It was clean and simple. We loved the grey kitty and coffee options. We would return!
Loved my stay this place was awesome! Thank you

Our stay at Reid‚Äôs place was great! Really comfy bed, great lighting, place looked exactly like the pictures, and it had a homey feel! The neighborhood overall is a little sketchy, but we had no issues with it at all! Reid was very responsive and very friendly. Definitely would stay again!

Had a wonderful stay with my girlfriend at Reid‚Äôs place for while we were in town for GRiZMAS in July. The place was clean and had everything we needed plus the grey kitty was a bonus! We fed him every morning and gave him lots of love. I will add that it can be a bit noisy since there are train tracks a street over from the container and it‚Äôs not in the nicest area of Wilmington but it definitely served its purpose and is about a 5 minute drive to Historic Downtown Wilmington and Riverfront Park. I never felt unsafe staying here and Reid and Jamie were very helpful and responsive when we had some issues with the lock on the front door. Thanks for the cool and unique stay!
Reid was very communicative and accommodating. Enjoyed my stay!

Nice and easy stay if you need a place for a night or two. It's relatively small, but that was expected. You'll be greeted by a (very friendly) local cat that will hang out on the front porch for a while.
Didn‚Äôt end up getting to stay due to personal reasons but the place was adorable!! Wish we could‚Äôve stayed

description.summary: It's a shipping container! A cozy, actually luxurious 1-bedroom home with a hand-made walnut counter-top and Plants Everywhere, bringing a bit of nature indoors. A reverse osmosis drinking water system, 55-inch television, full-size refrigerator, full-size bed with Tuft-and-Needle mattress. There are two outdoor cats, you can feed them if you like... Boots likes to come inside to eat. The neighbor might ask you for a dollar, don't do it! This place to stay is truly one of a kind.
description.space: It's cozy, so cozy. And, planty! Indoor plants everywhere with nice views of outdoor greenery through large windows. The couch is comfy for watching TV or taking naps and there are outdoor cats to provide entertainment.
description.neighborhood: Walking distance from Greenfield Lake (gorgeous park), The Rusty Nail (Dive Bar), The Harp (Irish Pub with food), Benny's Big Time Pizzeria, Mariposa Tapas Bar, Blok Taco and Satellite (Bar). Very short drive to Seaview, the best seafood in ILM. The immediate neighborhood is a little funky and sometimes a little noisy, but it won't get in the way of a good night's sleep!
description.interaction: I'll provide a code to get inside and I am always available via phone! Or, I can come by if needed.
description.house_rules:
Don't set anything hot on the counter-top, it might burn the wood. Please, place hot things on the glass cutting-board, on the wood cutting-board or on top of the stove.

Feel free to remove your shoes when you enter, but this is not a requirement. 

Don't leave any cat inside unattended, they are notorious for peeing when they need to pee.

Nature's beauty located all around the property.
Front porch rocking chair and side table.

The Charlotte Motor Speedway is located 11 minutes (7.3 miles from the tiny house). 
RV and campers are welcome to park on the Airbnb property during your stay.
Concord Mills Mall is approximately 7 minutes (5.6 miles) from the tiny house. Enjoy one of the largest malls in North Carolina!
Super Target is a 3 minute drive (1.1 mile) from the tiny house. There is also a Burlington, Message Envy, Dick's Sporting Good and countless other shops in the same shopping area.

Chipotle, Wendy's, Zaxbys and Dunkin Donuts is a 1 minute drive (0.5 miles) or a 10 minute walk from the tiny house. 
With just a quick walk through the neighborhood you can be at some of your favorite eating places!

hosts.about: Alpha Maintenance and Property Management - AM/PM for short - Morning to Night we are available for any and all your needs.

Hi there from Reggie and Teka! We have two amazing sons; Owen (2 years old) and Noah (newborn). Teka is a personal trainer with a passion for fitness. I am a business owner and financial professional. 
We love to travel (favorite place being Hawaii so far). We love going to the movies, eating out and spending time with family and friends! Of course, anything with our boys!

recent.comments: Such a nice and unique stay. Will definitely be returning next time we are in town if it‚Äôs available! Excellent choice of wine complementary was a nice touch along with the awesome space on top made for a great afternoon and evening!

items.comments: Such a nice and unique stay. Will definitely be returning next time we are in town if it‚Äôs available! Excellent choice of wine complementary was a nice touch along with the awesome space on top made for a great afternoon and evening!
The host was very responsive and helpful. The house was very clean and even included a nice bottle of wine. We loved the hot tub. Me and my wife very much enjoyed our stay there.
Perfect little get away with our pets, we all enjoyed our stay. Easy to find and very close to restaurants and shopping. Host is friendly and responsive!
Loved this place it was so nice and quiet. It was cozy and felt right at home for such a small space! The hot tub was nice along with hammock in the back and bond fire. Definitely would recommend!

This was the perfect getaway! As beautiful as it is in the pictures, it still doesn‚Äôt quite do it justiceüíõ the area on the roof is absolutely fabulous! We roasted marshmallows, sat around the fire pit and  drank the wonderful wine the the hosts left for us. Mike and Reggie were fantastic,  couldn‚Äôt ask for better hospitality. They made it clear that if we needed anything at all, or had any issues to let them know and they would be right on top of it. They had everything there that we needed. We took advantage of all the fun things outside and spent several hours in the hot tub! We enjoyed our two nights there so much, I wish we had a few more nights. It was fun, relaxing and romantic, this will definitely be our go to place anytime we are in Charlotte. Thank you Mike and Reggie üôèüôè

You can tell that the indoor and outdoor spaces were really thought out and it is definitely unique. The swing was cool and the fireplace area was really nice. Although I didn‚Äôt take advantage of the amenities, they would have been fun. The indoor space was very clean. The hosts were very accommodating. The coffee was good. The neighborhood was so peaceful. I enjoyed walking my dog around. It was very peaceful
Great stay will be visiting again

description.summary:
You'll love this unique & romantic escape! This one of a kind oasis is tucked away in a private neighborhood cul de sac with a nature feel.
Experience a quiet getaway but yet 1 minute drive or 10minute walk to all of your favorite places to eat & shop!  
Enjoy the well-appointed custom shipping home!
 *Roof Top Deck
*Hot Tub
*Fire Pit
*Grill
*Hammock area
*Putt putt
*Horseshoe 
*Comfy outdoor furniture
Relax & refresh while experiencing the joy of tiny living!

RVs/Campers are welcome!*
description.neighborhood:
This is a quiet secluded neighborhood with the home located in a cul de sac. There are plenty of trees and greenery around for nature lovers. 
However, it is just a few minutes walk or a minute drive to all of your favorite shopping and eating places.

name: Shipping Container Tiny House - 2 miles from UF
title: Gainesville, Florida

hosts.about:
My husband and I make plug & play/portable shipping container offices and homes, and when we are not creating these super cool units, we like to do gastro-tours to discover the gastronomic secrets that are hidden in each place. 

We are passionate about the adventure of knowing new places, new people, and natural landscapes (those that take your breath away). 

As travelers we understand that having a good rest and feeling comfortable in clean and welcoming spaces is a real pleasure, and we want to provide that pleasant experience to our container studio guests.

recent.comments: This tiny house was cute and cozy. The pictures are accurate and the hosts were very helpful with any questions I had. The check-in/out process was very simple with easy to follow instructions.

items.comments: This tiny house was cute and cozy. The pictures are accurate and the hosts were very helpful with any questions I had. The check-in/out process was very simple with easy to follow instructions.
This tiny home was very cute and clean! We loved our stay and would definitely return!
It was a great experience. Very cute tiny home that was near downtown area which was convenient for our trip.
We loved staying in the container home! It had all that we needed. We really appreciated the clear details for check in/out, clean and comfortable environment, and the complimentary coffee and beer!
Very nice!!
This was an incredibly unique, chic, and comfortable spot! I absolutely loved staying here and will certainly return.

The place was clean and a lot more spacious than the photos make it seem. Private outside seating area and extremely close to the downtown area. We had a lovely private stay and experienced no issues finding the place or getting in to the container

description.summary:
Experience the container home living in this neat unique tiny home! 

The industrial style is harmonized with minimalist & comfortable interiors for a memorable stay.

Built by Welding to Recycle
description.space:
This container is perfect for a solo traveler, or a couple. Sleeps 2 people in the mezzanine bed with a super-comfy queen size mattress with soft, hypoallergenic and comfortable fabrics to enhance your experience. 

There is a brand-new kitchenette with Mini fridge, Sink, Microwave, Toaster, Nespresso¬Æ coffee machine and basic kitchen supplies. TV in the living room with access to Netflix, Hulu, and Prime Video, Minicloset, and Water heater for shower and sinks completes this fascinating container home.

This incredible place is just over one mile from Downtown Gainesville area and about 2 miles from University of Florida campus as well as Shands and the VA hospitals.

It is close to all that Gainesville has to offer: parks, UF golf course, theaters, art studios, museums, restaurants, local breweries and music venues. Nature parks, tree climbing, tubing in springs, and cave diving are only a few of the many things that you can find around Gainesville (we have 2 bikes to borrow).
description.access:
Guests have full access to the container and its front porch. Enjoy an outdoor coffee at the front porch of the container while watching the trees dancing to the rhythm of the Florida breeze.

Please be mindful that this property is in a residential neighborhood and that neighbors do reside next door.  Please respect times of the day in which loud noises should be reduced.
description.neighborhood: If outdoors activities are your thing, you will love taking a walk or a bike ride to the duck pond, enjoy a picnic at The Thomas Center or Depot Park, explore Payne‚Äôs Prairie Preserve State Park to watch some gators, or enjoy the charm of Gainesville downtown. We have 2 bikes available for you.
description.transit: We think that a good way to now a place is by walking or riding a bicycle, but if that is not for you, you can use your car, Uber or bus.
description.interaction: We will gladly help with special arrangements and/or any recommendation to make your stay memorable. Just call or send us a text.
description.house_rules:
Maximum capacity: 2 Adults. 

Check-in is at 3:oo pm. There is a $50 fee for early check-in. Availability for early access cannot be confirmed until your arrival day. 

Please respect privacy of next door neighbors and avoid loud noises. 

The electric toilet has a macerator pump and it takes some seconds to flush, don‚Äôt stress!!! Also, the pump makes the typical noise, it could be loud, so don't be scare.

Please flush only human waste to avoid severe damage to the system. If system is damaged, we will charge $1,500 for replacement + plumbing bill. 

Use the black MAKEUP towel to remove your makeup. 

Please do not sit or lean on the dining table.

Watch your step when entering or exiting the container, the shower, as well as when using the mezzanine ladder. 

Smoking and partying is not allowed within the premises.

Check-out is  at 11:00 am. There is a $25 charge for every 30 minutes late up to 1:00 pm. A full day fee will be charged after 1:00 pm.

name: Tiny House on the Lake
title: Jackson, Michigan

gallery.caption: Propane grill and fire pit with firewood for use.
Microwave, air fryer, and convection oven.
Full size bed in front loft.
Stairs to front loft with full size bed.
Queen size bed in the back loft.
Lake Map
Life vests and paddles located in shed.
Pontoon Boat for rent. Check for availability.

hosts.about: Lori and I are the parents of four wonderful daughters, we love the Lord and our family. We enjoy camping and spending time together at the lake with bonfires and s‚Äômores. We love sharing our space with others so they can enjoy the same experiences our family enjoys!

recent.comments: Two words=Lake Life! Most beautiful tiny house and I only hit my head once! jk ;) Luke and his family were wonderful, friendly and very responsive. We rented one of their pontoon boats as well and had a blast on the gorgeous lake. Excellent weekend! I want to do it again already.

items.comments: Two words=Lake Life! Most beautiful tiny house and I only hit my head once! jk ;) Luke and his family were wonderful, friendly and very responsive. We rented one of their pontoon boats as well and had a blast on the gorgeous lake. Excellent weekend! I want to do it again already.

The tiny house was exactly as described and pictured.  Very well decorated and clean!  We had a great time on the lake, fishing on the dock and kayaking.
The home had everything we needed, and it was great to have access to kayaks, fishing poles, firewood, etc.
Luke‚Äôs dad lives on property and was very helpful and friendly.
When we had bad storms come through and lost power for several hours. Luke‚Äôs dad came right away in the middle of the storm and got a generator hooked up to be sure we weren‚Äôt without power.
I would definitely recommend this place for getaway in the woods on a peaceful lake.
One thing that would have been nice is more substantial outdoor seating, since there‚Äôs obviously not much space inside to sit!
There is a picnic table and some plastic chairs on the small patio out front, but it would have been nice to have a better table and chairs.
Also of note - it‚Äôs not easy getting up to the beds and not enough space to sit up straight. We managed fine but it was tricky!

The little house nestled in the woods, walking distance to the lake, private beach. Walking paths through the property,  got to see the cranes, a pair of twin fawns, and little bunnies. The perfect girls weekend getaway! Luke and his dad were so helpful and just a msg, text or call away! The pontoon rental is a must, cruising between the small lakes and hanging out on the sandbar was just what us girls needed!
I loved this tiny house!  it's set back and private.   For a small space it was a well supplied kitchen and it had extra bedding.  We thoroughly enjoyed our time there.
Great fun place

This was our first tiny home experience, and it was a tiny slice of heaven and more. We can‚Äôt wait to go back. Luke and Lori and their family are amazing, as well as the place the lake, the kayaks, the sunsets, the quiet, the swans, it was everything we could‚Äôve asked for and more for a short tiny little weekend getaway! We cannot wait to return!

Luke and Lori were out of town during our stay but were extremely easy to reach! Luke‚Äôs dad Tim was very friendly and helped us with questions about the kayaks/hot water. We had a peaceful getaway and would stay again

description.summary:
Experience tiny house living in a serene location on beautiful all sports Big Wolf Lake, on a chain of 7 lakes. 
Just minutes from I-94, Michigan International Speedway,  Skydive Tecumseh, and Lefglen Nature Sanctuary .
Enjoy paddling the lake and it's channels in our kayaks available for use. We have dock space, but no beach area for swimming,  although the lake does have a large sand bar for swimming and a small county park with a beach area.
Outdoor grill and fire pit with wood provided.
description.space: Situated on a dead end private drive, guests will enjoy a quiet  setting where they‚Äôre likely to see wildlife, enjoy beautiful sunsets, and unplug.
description.access:
Available for use are kayaks and life vests, picnic tables, grill, fire pit, roasting forks, and lawn chairs.
Inside we have a fully stocked kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, gas cooktop, toaster, waffle iron, and electric skillet.
description.notes:
We suggest bringing drinking water since this is a mobile Tiny  House it‚Äôs water supply comes through a water hose.
Pontoon boat rental is available through a local marina just minutes away, dock it right at the Tiny House after renting.
Fishing boat available for rent also.
description.neighborhood: This property is a quiet setting on a dead end private driveway shared with another rental property. It receives very little traffic, giving nice privacy.
description.house_rules:
Must be 25 or older to rent.
No day guests without prior permission.
Unauthorized guests may be assessed a $20/ day per guest for use of facilities.
Quiet hours after 11pm.
 No shoes or food in the lofts it on steps to the lofts. 
Please do not move mattresses or furniture to different areas. 
Please do not adjust the water heater without permission.

Clean grill after use. 

No trash burning in the fire pit. (plastic, cans, bottles, metals)

$50 additional cleaning fee will be assessed for trash burning or dirty grill.

CLEAN and Return all kayaks, paddle boards, and equipment to their respective locations.

description.summary: Featured in Apartment Therapy and news outlets around the world, the PRCH is a unique art-filled combo of top line tech and vintage mid-century; working 50's  jukebox with classic records, 65" Sony Bravia 4k OLED TV with Bose sound, Chef's Kitchen featuring a 6 burner Viking Gas Range, Slayer Commercial Espresso Machine, 50's restaurant booth , Intellibed Midnight bed in master suite and  premium beds in others plus vintage MCM furniture and chargepoint 50amp Level 2 EV smart charging station.
description.space: the PRCH is an amazing combination of unique, warm, colorful and imaginative furnishings, decor and art. There are special spaces throughout the house like the cozy landing overlooking the living room perfect for intimate conversations, reading or watching the abundant nature out the floor to ceiling windows. The large covered outdoor deck gets a nice breeze and has a comfy sofa for relaxing. There is also a Big Green Egg grill for cooking out.  ADDED OCTOBER 2022: Finnish Sauna. Constructed of Canadian Red Cedar and featuring a Huum Drop 9kw heater with wi-fi control. Seats 4.
description.notes:
PRCH ON THE WEB

find the prince road container house on Apartment Therapy, Atlas Obscura, Ig
description.neighborhood: the PRCH is located in St. Augustine South (SAS), a mature subdivision located 4 miles south of the heart of downtown St. Augustine, the Nation's Oldest City. SAS is bounded on two sides by water; the Intracoastal Waterway (ICW) on the East and Moultrie Creek on the South. PRCH resides 100 meters from the 10 meter high bluffs of Moultrie Creek, a tidal creek of brackish water that is a prime fishing and paddle sports spot. A boat ramp, fishing dock/pier and boardwalk are located 100 meters from the house. Dolphin and Manatee are easily spotted along with many bird species including Roseate Spoonbill, Blue Heron, Bald Eagle, Red Shouldered Hawk, Barred Owl and Osprey. Armadillo, Opossum and Grey Squirrel are plentiful and fun to watch. Shore Drive is a lightly trafficked road that borders the creek/icw and is wonderful for bike rides.
description.transit: the neighborhood is very walkable with a riverfront boardwalk and quiet residential streets. scenic shore drive runs along moultrie creek and the intracoastal waterway and is perfect for long strolls and bike rides.
description.interaction: The Prince Road Container House (PRCH) is my primary full time residence and I am excited to share it with you when I am away. Although I built and decorated the house for myself and my daughter I have also considered my guests to make a warm, comfortable and fun environment for all.  I welcome well-mannered dogs and children (age 7+) and only ask that you treat my home with care. Please do not smoke in the house. As a lifelong graphic artist and former Art Gallery owner of 10 years, I have hosted many visiting artists and musicians into my home over the years. As a small business owner of over 40 years, I know the importance of prompt, concise and considerate communication. I will always make the effort to answer all your questions before, during and after your stay. Please feel free to contact me with specific questions and I will do my best to answer.
description.house_rules:
Thanks for booking the Prince Road Container House. This is my Personal Home and not a business so please treat my home with respect. It is not to be utilized as a party house. The maximum number of guests allowed is 6 and each must be listed in the booking prior to arrival. Additional guests are not allowed. Visitors that are not part of the booked guests are also not allowed. All guests must be 21+ unless your group is a family with at least 1 parent present. If the number of guests in the house exceed the number booked or the No Smoking rule is violated you will be subject to immediate eviction without refund and be required to pay extra cleaning fees. If there are well mannered children over the age of 10 in your group please be aware that there are fragile items, adult themed artwork (NOT PORNOGRAPHY) and stairs in the house. Well trained and house broken pets are also welcome however they must be caged if they are left alone in the house. Please place a blanket (provided if requested) under the cage to protect the wood floors. 

Please have a minimum of 2 positive reviews from previous airbnb stays

Please remove shoes when in house

Please no smoking in house or on deck

Children under age 10 are not allowed

Slayer Espresso Machine to be used by adults only                                                                    

Jukebox to be used by adults only

Vintage TV is for display only

Please watch the videos on my YouTube channel in advance of arrival to learn the operation of items within the home.  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCO61Aksxpn7W2ax2G4ztVQ/videos

CHECK OUT:

Thanks for leaving the PRCH tidy when you leave. Please leave the bedding intact and place dirty towels in the shower stalls. While you are welcome to use the washer/dryer for your personal items I prefer to wash the sheets and towels upon my return. Also, please place garbage and recyclables in bins downstairs on the left side of house. Feel free to contact me if there is an issue. If you need to wash dishes during your stay feel free to use the dishwasher. Please rinse all food from dishes before loading. If there is only load at the end of your stay I will be happy to run the dishwasher upon my return.

recent.comments: Absolutely perfect! Wish I could have stayed longer.

items.comments: Absolutely perfect! Wish I could have stayed longer.

My partner and I loved our stay at Porters cabin! Very well considered location and amenities. If you aren‚Äôt the most camping-savvy person this stay could pose a few challenges (learning how to build a fire, remembering to heat up your shower water ahead of time, etc.) but Porter was always responsive and ready to lend us a hand! Once we figured things out, our stay was fabulous and totally worthwhile. Would definitely visit again especially in cooler months

AMAZING!!! My husband and I spent a restorative weekend at Porter's place and it completely exceeded our expectations. The container is the ideal setting to get back to nature, with such beautiful surroundings - very private and peaceful. We will be back for sure!!!
Amazing location, very responsive host
Very cool space! We had a great time

Wonderful, private getaway - tons of natural light, gorgeous views, delightful little woodstove and indoor sitting area and a beautiful back porch. Lots to do in the little towns nearby, but also a great place to just get away from the world. Would absolutely stay there again!

description.summary: *Click on our logo image to book another cabin on our property. Our 4-season 40-foot container cabin is set on a stream and 20 acres of mountainside wilderness. Warm in the winter and cool in the summer...gaze at the stars from the deck, enjoy the Solo fire ring, yoga platform, DIY wood-fired hot tub and hammock. The cabin is two hours north of NYC, with 110v power, propane and wood heat and a compost toilet. Woodstock, Kingston, the Hudson River and hiking trails are 15 min away.
description.space:
**Click on our logo image to book another cabin on our property.

"One of the best Airbnb cabins we‚Äôve rounded up from all across the U.S." - Architectural Digest, 2022

"Top 12 Airbnbs in the Catskills" - Time Out, 2018-2023

We took everything we learned building our 20-foot container cabins and incorporated it into our deluxe 40-foot container cabin. The 40-footer is a "high cube" container, with 9' 6" ceilings, household 110v electricity, a dedicated bedroom (with a door and room for a crib or luggage), indoor bathroom with shower, EVERGREEN STITCHES organic percale linens, and a beautiful deck overlooking it's own waterfall and stream. It is not like other tiny home compounds in the area that have dozens of units set 10 feet away from one another. It sits on its own stunning 5-acre parcel in the middle of an old-growth forest, slate ledges, a stream and resident owls and deer.

The cabin is toasty in the winter with a propane Rinnai heater‚Äîin addition to the wood stove. There is a hammock and an adjacent promontory with a second fire ring and seating. The wood-fired hot tub is very DIY, but amazing once you get it going. The bathroom has a compost toilet and a shower. The sitting area in the cabin is elevated with an L-shaped Ikea Friheten sofa (bedroom has a traditional bed) opposite two contiguous 5'x5' windows to stare at the forest and wildlife. The writing desk is an original Mohonk House secretary. The sofa converts into a queen-size sofa bed, that we often leave out for maximum-lounging space.

Staying in a 4-season container cabin is not like living in a house or a hotel room or a glamping tent. It is like living in the wild, except you are encased in high-efficiency insulated walls with giant low-energy windows‚Äîand sleeping on a comfortable bed. You can watch shooting stars from the living room. You will likely see a family of deer wandering through the woods while you make coffee. If it's cold outside (with the direct vent propane heater and wood stove it's always warm inside) we usually fire up the sauna and lounge around drinking coffee. (You can book multiple 120-minute private sauna sessions.) If it's warm, we leave the double doors open and lounge around the patio.

Living in a container cabin is kind of like living on a boat in the middle of the woods. Our inspiration was to create an immersive wilderness experience with the comforts of home. There is solar power in the 40-footer with outlets throughout the cabin. The heater has a thermostat‚Äîset it and forget it. The bathroom is tiled and located inside the cabin. The wood stove has a glass door with ceramic baffles, reburners and a blower for maximum heat. High-efficiency insulated walls and low-energy windows keep the cabin warm in the winter and cool in the summer. There is a refrigerator with a freezer box. The bedroom is like a nature capsule with a 7'x7' picture window at the foot of the bed and a 7'x8' sliding glass door on the south wall.

Staying in the cabin is an experience, not a simple overnight. On a 20-degree night in the middle of a blizzard, it is 80 degrees and silent inside. There are enough pots/pans/kitchen tools to cook whatever you want. (Yes, we have a coffee grinder.) There is a gas grill and a two burner propane cooktop in the kitchen. In the summer, a breeze off the 3,645-foot mountain behind us keeps the container cool, and the sound of the waterfall will put you to sleep.

The cabin is cleaned immaculately after every stay, now using CDC disinfecting standards. It is set on a truly gorgeous 20-acre plot on the eastern edge of the Catskill Mountains. It feels a bit like Maine, or Alaska. You can't see any neighbors from our property, but there are neighbors, great ones. (Please be courteous and respectful to them.) We are on the side of Kaaterskill High Peak and have tons of wildlife on the property. (Listen for the barred owls at night!)

All guests are left with 15 gallons of filtered potable drinking water. (The sink uses a foot pump.) There are drawers under the bed for clothes, room in the bedroom for a crib or pack-and-play, and a mudroom for jackets, shoes and backpacks. No smoking inside, please, plenty of room to smoke on the deck outside...

We have a cell signal booster in the cabin, so service is good. The other 20-foot containers are divided by driveways and each are private. (We designed it that way.)

Saugerties is a gem. Miss Lucy's (dinner), The Dutch (drinks), Circle W General Store (breakfast/lunch) Love Bites (breakfast) and Diamond Mills (fancy!). Walking to the lighthouse is a must, as is hiking to Kaaterskill Falls, Huckleberry Point and North and South Lakes. Hunter Mountain is also 30 minutes away. Food shopping and farm stands are 10-15 min away.
description.access: You have the entire property on your side of the driveway. Streams, woods, cliffs and marsh.
description.notes: The shower is a simple battery-operated camping shower that you fill with hot water. (Heat it on the stove.) Toilet is a compost toilet, simple and clean.
description.neighborhood: We are 15 minutes from Saugerties, Woodstock, Kingston, Catskill and the Hudson River. We are about 500 yards from Kaaterskill Wild Forest and 3,645-foot Kaaterskill High Peak. West Saugerties is rural, full of farms, horse properties and the high peaks of the eastern Catskills.
description.transit: Parking is ten feet from the cabin. Buses to Saugerties are an option, but we highly recommend bringing a vehicle.
description.interaction: We or our caretakers are available all of the time. Just give a buzz and we can help out.
