Rachel and Scott were fantastic people! We loved our stay on their beautiful property and they were on top of it anytime we needed anything. They made our girls trip perfect!!

The property is amazing. It was very peaceful and relaxing. I would‚Äôve moved in if I could. It was out a little in the country, but the city was near by. Clarkston is just a few minutes down the road with some amazing restaurants and shops. Rachel was very welcoming and introduced me to all the larger 4 legged friends. They definitely have some good personalities. I would go back in a heart beat and have already recommended it to a family members.
Rachel and Scott are awesome hosts they are very friendly,  very accommodating and responsive. This place is amazing simply beautiful, and very quiet.  We would definitely stay there again.
Very quiet and peaceful place to stay.
I love this place. Super peaceful and beautiful.  Rachel and her husband are both really nice. Would highly recommend this place!

Extremely beautiful place. Surrounded by immense nature and beauty. Hiking trails and the pedal boat were some of our highlights. Clean, safe, private. Hot tub was a great touch. Host was amazing. Highly recommend.

description.summary:
This is one of 4 cabins on the property. We are an adults-only venue except for special Family Weeks. View the images to see kid-friendly dates.

You will stay in an upcycled shipping container that is nested in an old-growth forest perched 70‚Äô above Perry Lake. New in 2022, the premium interior feels fresh and modern. Visiting the horses, bird watching, and hiking are guests' favorites.

This cabin has been carefully placed to offer a private, 360-degree view of the surrounding wilderness.
description.space:
Your cabin is an upcycled shipping container. Brand new in 2022, its clever design is stocked with goodies like heated towel bars, quartz countertops, and fast Wi-Fi. Huge, fixed windows make it feel light and modern (but don‚Äôt worry‚Ä¶ there are shades in case you need a break from all that nature!). Around you is a mix of open horse pastures, densely wooded trails, and a natural lakefront. 

Stillwater Stables also hosts a revolving art show; guests will find their cabins filled with original art from local artists that is available for sale.
description.access: Guests can enjoy the trails that wind throughout the property and can access the lake via our new dock. There‚Äôs also a paddle boat available to use during the summer.
description.notes: Your cabin is tucked into the woods! It gets dark and the footing can be tricky so try to check in during daylight hours. If this is not possible, let us know and we will assist you.
description.neighborhood: As I bet you can imagine - our farm is located in a rural area! Expect to drive about 2 miles along a dirt road before you arrive at the turn into our driveway, which is almost a quarter mile long.
description.transit:
Your car will be the best way to explore the area. 

Also, we have a private ride service provider (a former Uber and Lyft driver) that services the farm. Please request that information after booking.
description.interaction: We live on the property so you'll likely see us around! We are happy to greet you, share time with the horses, or answer any questions you have, but otherwise expect to have a very quiet and private experience.
description.house_rules:
Special Events and Commercial Use:

For extra guests, special events, or commercial use - please reach out to us while booking to discuss your plans. Additional fees, permits, or accommodations might be required. 

Neutral Scent Policy:

We aim to provide a scent-neutral environment to ensure that each guest experiences a healthy, comfortable, and enjoyable stay. Please respect the next visitor by not using heavy perfumes, medicinal oils, cannabis, or air fresheners.  Burning, vaporizing, smoking, diffusing, or cooking anything that can be detected in the air or on the fabrics after your departure could violate this policy and you may be charged up to a $250 restoration fee.

recent.comments: place was exactly what we were looking for. Extremely beautiful and so peaceful. If you‚Äôre looking for a sign to book this place, this is it! :)

A beautiful stay! The host Tony is super helpful and responsive!!

The location of this vacation home is perfect- literally a few feet from the river, Outdoor amenities( hot tub , barbecue , fire pit) were great. However they can only improve the cleaning of the place .The host was friendly and attempted to accommodate
Overall great getaway spot .

This was the perfect getaway for my wife & I for a vacation! Very private, peaceful & felt like a home away from home. Tony was very responsive & made sure all of our needs were met! The listing states there are neighbors close by but it was never a problem for us, it felt like a little quiet community! The deck was our favorite part & where we spent the majority of our time. The only gripe I have is the walking distance to the river. Not to far at all I was just hoping for a path straight through the woods instead of up & around! Overall a very good spot 10/10 recommend & will be back!

My husband and I spent 2 nights at rivers edge. It was the perfect mountain getaway. The tiny house had everything we needed. We coles most meals inside and on fire pit. The hot tub was clean and we spent a lot of time relaxing in it. 

The cabin is right next to a popular drop off on Shenandoah. We should have taken that as a hint, drop off. We brought an inflatable kayak and attempted to paddle around the access and quickly realized that was not possible. My husband did a 3 hour, 7 mile paddle and I picked him up across from downriver canoe company. He had a great time and I had some alone time too! . 

We had a great night out in Luray. We went to dinner at watch and warrant (delicious food) and checked out the local, small, quaint theater and we had a wonderful time. 

Tony, the host was extremely helpful and texted daily to see if we needed anything. We hope to come back one day!

description.summary:
River Edge is a modern tiny cabin located directly on the Shenandoah River and just minutes from the national park ‚Äì the perfect location for your getaway in the mountains.  

The highlights:
 - Relax in the outdoor hot tub!
 - Swim, fish, or go tubing on the river ‚Äì just steps from your front door
 - Grill & relax with a glass of wine on the deck
 - Cook s‚Äômores around the fire pit
 - Drive 15 mins to Luray Caverns or into Shenandoah National Park

Enjoy!
description.space:
Our modern, beautifully-designed tiny cabin has all the comforts of home, just nestled away in the Shenandoah mountains.  River Edge is packed with amenities and fun for couples or a special personal retreat ‚Äì and is the perfect home base for your getaway!

The cabin includes:
- High-quality pullout queen sofa bed (it‚Äôs very comfortable and large)
- Fully-stocked kitchen with fridge, microwave, and two-burner hot plate
- Central heat and AC to keep you comfortable, no matter the weather

Outside, you‚Äôll also find:
- A large hot tub, perfect for relaxing after a long day exploring
- Outside fire pit with seating for the whole gang
- EV charging station
- Kayaks, canoes, tubes, paddles ‚Äì all located right on the river for you to enjoy

But the best part about the cabin is its location:  River Edge is located directly on a 1,200 foot section of the Shenandoah River.  When it‚Äôs warm, it‚Äôs perfect for swimming, tubing, canoeing, and kayaking.  We have canoes, kayaks, and tubes for you to use too!  There‚Äôs also great fishing (we‚Äôve caught bass and channel catfish).  And at night, we love dozing off listening to the sound of the river rushing by.

Note:  River Edge is part of a large private retreat, with two other cabins on the property ‚Äì another tiny cabin about 50 feet from River Edge, and another larger cabin about 150 feet away.  You will likely see guests at the other cabins, and they may also be enjoying the river (and kayaks/canoes/tubes) during your stay.  That said, the property is very large ‚Äì so you should easily be able to find a quiet spot on the river to call your own.  And of course you‚Äôll have your own personal hot tub, and fire pit. The cabin has an EV (Electronic Vehicle) charger that you may use during your stay. There is an additional charge of $15 per stay. Please let us know if you would like to add this to your stay.

(By the way, the other two cabins sleep 2 and 5 people each, respectively ‚Äì so if you‚Äôre looking to book a stay with a larger group, please contact us.  Between River Edge and the other two cabins, we can accommodate up to 9 people on the entire property.)

Lastly, beyond the cabin itself, we love how close we are to downtown Luray and the famous Luray Caverns ‚Äì both just a 10-minute drive away.  Beyond the caves (which we recommend you definitely check out), the town has fantastic breweries, restaurants, and shops for you to enjoy!  And of course, you‚Äôre also just minutes from Shenandoah National Park ‚Äì with amazing hiking trails and views!

I wouldnt knock stars off for this but we thought it was 2 beds from the listing and theres only one, BUT I didnt check to see if the couch was a pull out or not so that could easily be my fault. 
Michelle was also super responsive, gave clear instructions and was very accommodating. She even let me check in early and have guests over for the afternoon because we all had flights canceled. 
Ubers are really hard to get and take a long time (again nothing to do with her) so the recommendations she gave us about where to go and eat etc were really helpful. All in all loved my stay and would stay again if I was back in the area!
Love that unique place! Very cozy! So close to Asheville downtown. Definitely will come back and stay that place again.

The unit was clean and looked exactly like the pictures. We had no complaints and will be going back.
Loved the place. It was very different and I will most definitely stay again.
This is the second time we have stayed here! Got a chance to talk to her and she was very polite & easy to talk to. We love this place and plan on staying again

description.summary: This modern shipping container home has everything you need for your Asheville getaway! Lounge on the deck and relax, step into the luxurious shower for an energy boost, then soak up the spacious feel of this converted world-traveled container. 5 minute drive to local breweries and 10 minutes from downtown AVL and Biltmore Estate! House is walking distance to Blue Ridge Parkway hiking. Hosts live next door and are here to help if needed. Guests will enjoy complete privacy during their stay.
description.space: The home is made out of a retired shipping container that's been around the world!  We have left the outside more or less true to it's original exterior, but inside you will find all brand new luxury touches.  The house also has a fabulous deck for relaxing.

description.transit: Very easy to get to all of the area attractions by car, Uber or Lyft.

description.summary:
Our container home, custom built for us, was designed to meet our need for a guest house that took advantage of a small footprint while offering maximum comfort & amenities. 

We are centrally located halfway between Wrightsville Beach and downtown Wilmington. 

It is a perfect spot, private and quiet, with easy access to I-40, Market Street and College Road.

Wrightsville Beach: 5 miles
Downtown: 6 miles
UNCW: 3 miles
Mayfaire: 2 miles

No Cleaning Fees.
description.space:
Burchlynn Cottage was custom designed to fit our tastes and needs. We wanted to be able to share our beautiful, quiet neighborhood with our family and our special guests. 

The cottage has a very generous bathroom, with full walk in shower, a dedicated bedroom with full sized bed, a living area with convertible couch, and a fully functional, stocked kitchen. 

Enjoy your time in the private, fenced in yard. Just off the deck, there is a table and four chairs (and a sunshade umbrella), perfect for enjoying outdoor dining.

Guests can also use the outdoor shower to rinse off after a day at the beach.
description.access: Our guests have access to the private, fenced yard, that is separate from the main property.
description.neighborhood:
We are close to Wrightsville Beach, Downtown Wilmington, UNCW and Mayfaire.

It is a perfect spot, private and quiet, with easy access to I-40, Market Street and College Road. Guests have a private gated and fenced yard and deicated parking space.

Wrightsville Beach: 5 miles
Downtown: 6 miles
UNCW: 3 miles
Mayfaire: 2 miles
description.transit: Wilmington is easiest to navigate by car, Lyft or Uber
description.interaction: We are more than happy to help our guests with anything that they might need. A printed visitors guide is provided in the cottage.
description.house_rules:
Smoking is not permitted inside the unit. If you smoke outside, please do not discard butts in our yard ‚Äì we will be happy to provide a disposal container ‚Äì just ask!
 
Quiet hours 10:00 pm ‚Äì 7:00 am. This unit is in our back yard in a residential neighborhood therefore we ask our guests to be respectful of our home and our neighbors. We also must abide by county noise ordinances. 

Visitors are allowed however any overnight guests not included in the original booking must have prior approval ‚Äì no exceptions!

Pets are not allowed

I love my lil mac and mini so much and hosting has been a very positive and fulfilling experience for me.

Marion is a great location with close proximity to so much beauty and the added appeal of it being a bit of a hidden gem still.

items.comments: Carrie communicated in the beginning and throughout stay.  Wee needed location close to family at Lake James.  The Mini was perfect and only 12 minutes away.

Mini was small but clean and well organized. I would say 2 people is the max for this space. The house itself is hotel quality in cleanliness but has a "homey" feel. The host clearly cares for her guests and thinks of the little things like instructions for the shower, restaurants and attractions nearby, fully stocked bathroom with first aid kit, and much more! I would definitely stay here again!

Mini was a great base for a visit to see family and go to a reunion. It is a few miles from Marion, but very easy to get to restaurants, tap rooms and hikes. And it is very peaceful and quiet- perfect to relax at the end of the day.

Carrie has a number of great recommendations for restaurants, coffee shops and taprooms. Or just wander around in town and do your own investigations. And Carrie‚Äôs enthusiasm for Western North Carolina and Mini is infectious.

Mini does have a few quirks, as it is a Tiny home, but follow the instructions provided and all will be well.
Enjoy!

Mini was a great visit! For a tiny home, they utilize the space they have really well! It was really clean, quiet and relaxing. Carrie was very responsive, friendly and proactive. She generously offered early check in and late check out without us even asking and she provided so many great recommendations! I would highly recommend staying at Mini, and we might even try to stay at Mac in the future with our kids (Mac is a little bigger than Mini). Mini was located right between Black Mountain and Boone so we had plenty to do. I 100% agree that Carrie is a super host!

We loved our stay! Property was well maintained. The house was beautiful and clean. Outdoor sitting space was wonderful and the communication from the host was excellent! Overall a terrific experience!!

Carrie was an amazing host. Very attentive. The ‚Äúmini‚Äù was perfect for our getaway. So beautifully decorated. She took the time to personalize our visit, and all our needs were more than met. The outdoors space was so peaceful and relaxing.  We were close to downtown, which offered a variety of restaurants and cute shops. So much to explore including lake James, Morganton, blowing rock and of course the beautiful views from the parkway. We definitely will be returning.
Best host yet!! Y‚Äôall need to give her a visit when y‚Äôall can!!

description.summary:
"mini" is one of two private tiny houses on a 1.34 acre lot in a modest, quiet neighborhood 2 miles from marion's cute main st shops + eats.

tons of gorgeous scenery, hikes, bike trails, lakes, rivers, state parks, wineries, good eats, and other activities within easy reach to keep you hopping or just hang out & relax!

mini is the perfect base camp to explore the many riches of the area and the bonus is that asheville is just a beautiful 40 min drive!

mini knows love is love & welcomes all!
description.space:
mini is situated on a 1.34 acre plot in a modest, quiet, residential neighborhood 2 miles from marion's historic main street. the large lot and the distance between mac and mini give both their privacy.

marion is a growing, friendly, small town with good eats that is a favored vantage point for numerous outdoor activities in the area. 

mini has a 2021 queen tuft and needle original mattress.

the internet is strong!

the fire pit is cozy and great for firefly watching in the summer.

the Bluetooth speakers in the ceiling are a fantastic feature and can be controlled with your smart phone.

*bath lovers, please note mini does not have a full sized tub! it's mini sized! mini's shower (as with most tiny houses) takes some finessing. it may require some patience and practice at first. there are detailed instructions in mini. it is not possible to just turn it on and jump in (if you want it hot) *

samsung 160 free channels, hbo max, disney +, hulu+ 

a mini fridge, microwave, toaster, corded water kettle, and mini coffee maker are on hand. ground coffee, assorted teas and creamers are provided.

i love mini and my guests do, too! if you are interested in booking, be sure to read the "other details to note" section!
description.access: mini + fire pit+ picnic table + mini's half of the acreage.
description.notes:
PLEASE, IF YOU ARE NEW TO ABB OR HAVE NO REVIEWS -  Welcome! 

If you would like to book, please upload your picture ID to your profile prior to making the request, please read the entire listing and all the house rules to be sure mini is a good fit for you, I want you to be happy! (scroll to bottom of listing page to find the rules and click on SHOW MORE). Please give me your full name and home town & confirm with me in your first message that you have read the listing, rules, and that you understand that mini is located in a residential neighborhood and that the shower takes some finessing. Thank you so much, this will make everything move faster.   :)

hot water in mini is plentiful and attainable, but the directions must be followed to a t! it is actually not difficult if you follow the instructions. bath lovers - expect about 12-15 minutes to draw a bath and please note that mini has a mini sized tub. this is just part and parcel of tiny house living! 

the work area is simply a tv tray you could put your laptop on! wifi is excellent. the outdoor eating area is a nice picnic table and the clothes storage is a wardrobe rack with hangers and two shelves as shown in the photos. 

kitchen is checked as a yes, because there is a microwave in which a frozen meal could be cooked. mini has a mini fridge, as well. 

please note: I do not accept pets but my neighbors right next door have two cute tinies and accept dogs! they have awesome sunset views and are a wonderful, kind couple. the cabins are called Bitty and Itty Bitty and it is dog heaven over there!
description.neighborhood:
mini is an excellent base camp/vantage point for many different year round  adventures in beautiful and unique western north carolina. 

mini and her companion cabin, mac, are situated on a 1.34 acre plot and are quite private. please note, you will not be out in the woods - it's best described as being on a very large, private lot in a modest, quiet, residential neighborhood. 

the town of marion won "north carolina small town of the year" in 2018, has a  cute lil downtown (The 310 District), an interesting history and an annual BIGFOOT festival!  marion is a very welcoming, growing community and there is good food to be had and options for vegans! marion was recently number one in the nation for second home purchases, likely due to its proximity to so many beautiful places. 

the linville gorge wilderness, blue ridge parkway, lake james state park, catawba falls, catawba river, mt mitchell, pisgah forest, linville caverns, linville falls, tom's creek falls, crabtree falls, little switzerland, table rock, hawksbill mountain, shortoff mountain, south mountains state park, and too many to mention other beautiful places are in close proximity. 

hike, explore, bike, golf, float, kayak, canoe, snow tube, ski, spelunk, and more! mac and mini are just 45 minutes from asheville!

check out romanticasheville.com for a comprehensive guide. alltrails.com is a great resource, as well, to get an idea of all the amazing hikes within reach.

the close proximity ( 5 miles) to interstate 40 affords easy trips to the super charming towns of asheville, morganton, black mountain, old fort, and many more depending on how far you wish to travel.  burnsville, blowing rock, banner elk, & boone are all gems and gorgeous drives. 

the way mini and mac are situated provides privacy from each other, so if both are booked, you will still enjoy your privacy or you could always make new friends, maybe even BIGFOOT!    :D
description.interaction:
hi and thanks a million for choosing mini!
i will respond quickly to all inquiries and needs.
i want my guests to have a 5 star stay!
description.house_rules:
Thank you for your interest in mini!

Following are the rules/guidelines that I require guests to abide by, they are simple and meant to protect both you and me! I love hosting and am so grateful for my amazing guests! 

By booking mini you agree to adhere to check in and out times, duration of stay, cancellation policy, and all the following guidelines - please read them in full to be certain mini is a good fit for you! 

2 adult guests maximum/no exceptions - no unregistered guests on the premises at any time during your stay. no pets, infants, or children. 

No third party bookings as they are against ABB's terms of service.

I require a picture ID on file with Airbnb - just as a hotel does. ID's can be uploaded to your profile.

*Please note that I do adhere to my cancellation policy with no exceptions. If your credit card does not offer it, travel insurance is highly recommended, it is inexpensive and so worth it! Airbnb now offers travel insurance! For as little as $25, your trip can be covered! The website insuremytrip dot com is also a great resource! (if a cancellation resulted in a booking by a new guest, I would absolutely refund the original booker, but this is not always the case.)* 

Absolutely no food/coffee grounds etc.  - nothing but non solidifying liquids are to go down the drains, the sink will back up and require a service call from a plumber at guest's expense. All waste must be disposed of in the garbage. This is also very important bc mini is on a delicate septic system. 

Nothing but toilet paper can be flushed! No "flushable" wipes, kleenex, dental floss etc. - strictly TP. This will keep you, me and her septic happy and healthy!    :D

For a variety of reasons, electric griddles for cooking in mini are not allowed. 

No vaping or smoking in or on the premises.

mini is not a party house, she is very square!  :D

Please note a cleaning fee is not in lieu of guests keeping the space reasonably clean. 

I do not accept pets and my guests w allergies expect to arrive to a dander free place. My neighbors right next door have two cute tinies and accept dogs! The cabins are called Bitty and Itty Bitty and it is dog heaven over there!

Thank you a million, have a fantastic time and come back!

name: Nature lover/Artist cabin peaceful Rescue Farm
title: Live Oak, Florida

gallery.caption: Romantic dinners under the oaks

hosts.about: Trudy is a Vegan organic vegetable farmers in North fl. Our animals are almost all rescue animals. We love the outdoors and gardening, kayaking, camping, etc. We enjoy hosting our guests and trying to make their stay as comfortable as possible. Trudy was a special needs teacher and enjoys traveling,  baking and cooking. Kokomo Farms  is  proud to have been a Filming Location For Animal Planet  and a member of the Florida Agritourism Association.

recent.comments: Great 3 nights on a farm with chickens and roosters :)

items.comments: Great 3 nights on a farm with chickens and roosters :)

Perfect getaway! I stayed in the shipping container, and it was the perfect choice to unplug and reset. I loved that it was off the grid and yet was still very comfortable. Being at the back of the property, I had privacy and could easily walk to the garden, barn, or porch of the main house if I wanted to look around or use WiFi. I loved the garden area and the animals. Greg and Trudy have created quite a little paradise. They are so welcoming and clearly great humans.  I definitely plan to return! Do yourself a favor and spend some time here. You'll return to your daily grind renewed and refreshed.

The goal was peace and quiet relaxation, and the shipping container tiny house was perfect as it had it's own private area of the farm. Canopied by beautiful mossy oak trees, we enjoyed just relaxing and reading in the hammock there and then could go inside the cabin when we were ready to enjoy the air conditioning. We brought most of our food precooked or simple meals easy to warm up. There's no microwave just the grill with one range. We loved the fresh farm eggs Trudy gave us to use! The cabin had everything we needed. Be aware there are no electrical outlets. They use power banks for the lights and solar power for everything else. Super simple and eco friendly in addition to beauty and comfort. I loved it! The farm was a delight to enjoy and Trudy and Gregg made us feel so welcome but also provided us privacy as well. My favorite by far was feeding the horses!! So bring your big bag of carrots and handsome Jett will gobble them right up! lol! We will definitely be back!
We had such a great stay at Kokomo Farms!

Kokomo was absolutely breathtaking. We were greeted by our host at the entrance. They provided us with a brief tour of the property as well as our cabin. Everything was eco friendly and peaceful. All the places to stay are nice and shady. There is lemongrass everywhere. This is a wonderful bug repellant. 

My wife and I took advantage of the jacuzzi under a beautiful oak tree. the oak tree had Spanish moss and lights hanging. This element gave it a whimsical/ romantic feel.

The location of Kokomo is near all the springs in north Florida. We took a cold dip in them and admired the beauty, went back to Kokomo and enjoyed a nice hot shower.

We are both ready to go back. Thank you friends, for a wonderful stay! See you soon!

What a hidden gem! I had been looking for a ‚Äúcontainer‚Äù stay and found Trudy‚Äôs place by accident. Such a peaceful setting. Chickens came around to greet us several times during our stay. Star gazing at night. Trudy was lovely and gave us a great recommendation for a dinner spot. Can‚Äôt recommend enough.

Trudy was responsive and sweet and the place was wonderful.
 We really enjoyed our stay!  Would stay again!

description.summary: Kokomo has a variety of unique accommodations including a tree house, tiny house, yurt tent, Shipping Container house, Hanging round bed glamping room & more just click on my profile picture to see all . Visit our barnyard rescue animals, relax in the Zen garden hot-tub, play yard games, paint the artwall, enjoy a community fire pit, relax in the enchanted forest hammock, or walk a trail. Try our stargazing bed to Experience a beautiful starlit sky and wakeup to the sounds of nature all around.
description.space: The cabin is set in a private area at the edge of our enchanted forest where wildlife abounds and the stars are amazing. Just a short walk to the Hot tub Zen garden and community fire pit. It is 320 square foot open plan( kitchen bedroom and living room) A Queen size bed with memory foam ,  a separate large bathroom and a deck outside to enjoy the sunset and the beautiful skies. Is completely off grid  in a minimalist setting(seasonal heat and ac are offered, solar electricity is only to power cabin's  essential  needs) gas BBQ, kitchen sink, mini fridge and full Bath. Come visit some of Florida's most gorgeous Springs and of course the famous Suwannee River.  Complimentary use of (adults only) Hot tub .Please click on my profile to see all of our unique accommodation options.  If this space isn't what you are looking for or it is unavailable please see our other unique spaces like our treehouse, Happy House tiny home, or tiny home cottage, etc just  click on my profile .
description.access: Guests have access to the  Zen garden Hot Tub and plenty of space for walks thru open grassy areas, wooded hammock,  our community open fire pit(host lights on fri and sat weather permitting) and barn.   The cabin has an outside barbecue grill   . We look forward to you enjoying the great outdoors and Florida farm life we are so proud to share with you!
description.notes:
Very peaceful, enjoy hanging with our friendly diverse buddies. Bring carrots to make friends with horses. Complimentary use of Hot tub and Bikes. Optional Kayak excursions available . As a shared space and due to allergies and a safety concern for pets who are unable to share space with other animals we are unable to accept assistance animals. Entire property is a nonsmoking area.

description.summary: Come get cozy at Catty's Cub House! This brand new open concept tiny home is fully equipped with everything you need for a peaceful and memorable getaway!  Nestled in a quiet community just minutes from Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Dollywood, Douglas Lake and the Great Smoky Mountains. Catty‚Äôs Cub House is the perfect place for a romantic getaway, small families or individual explorers. Packed with everything you need to kick start your vacation!
description.space:
Catty's Cub House is a tiny house built for comfort and efficiency. There‚Äôs plenty of room to prepare dinner in the fully-stocked kitchenette or out on the charcoal grill, cuddle up on the sofa for a movie marathon or game night by the electric fireplace, outdoor porch with seating, roasting smores by the fire pit, enjoy the seasonal mountain view from the relaxing hot tub, bathroom with standing shower and comfy queen-sized bed. 

This home is far enough away to avoid the traffic yet close enough to see the attractions and dine out with ease. Local there is fishing, horseback riding, river tubing, golfing, hiking, helicopter rides and zip lining. It‚Äôs close to Dollywood, Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg, Douglas Lake and experience the wildlife of Cades Cove.  

Distance to Grocery Store: 4 miles 
Distance to Dollywood: 12 miles
Distance to Pigeon Forge: 15 miles
Distance to Gatlinburg: 20 miles


Two night minimum stay for reservations including a weekend night (Fri & Sat). One night minimum stay offered Sunday-Thursday.

recent.comments: It was a very nice remote getaway. Accommodated all of our needs.

items.comments: It was a very nice remote getaway. Accommodated all of our needs.

Colby and Angela‚Äôs place was beautiful and located so close to the Gorge. We enjoyed walking the property and sitting around the fire place at night. Perfect spot for our small group celebrating a 40th birthday. Thank you so much for the stay

This place is a hidden gem!! We have 3 teenage boys and stay in the gorge often‚Ä¶. The Rae was by far our favorite property we have stayed at. The property was gorgeous. The house was very clean, with everything you needed. The hosts were very helpful and responsive, we even landed a late check out so we could enjoy one last morning. We had a party of 8 and the house suited us perfectly. 2 adults, 6 teenagers and a lab. Will definitely be returning!!! We had planned going into the gorge each day, but only ended up going to Jump Rock‚Ä¶ plenty for the kids to do, right there at the property. The hike up to sunset point was an added bonus‚Ä¶. Don‚Äôt be fooled though, it is a tough one. The creeks were enough to keep the kids entertained all weekend. It was an awesome weekend at The Wilds.
Very nice house (or group of houses) in a beautiful location. Will definitely be coming back!

Great stay with our family! The grounds at The Wilds are gorgeous and so private. The hosts are very responsive and helpful. The home is beautiful and very comfortable with all the amenities we needed! So much to see and do! We are so glad we chose to experience The Wilds!!

What a beautiful and relaxing place!  We stayed the weekend and The Wilds. The kids were able to play outside in the creeks and pond. They really enjoyed the kayaks and stand up boards. The laughter and good times were priceless.  The patio was the perfect place to end the day after hiking at near by Red river gorge and Natural Bridge state park. The place was just as described, clean, well designed and did not disappoint.  We would love to visit again.
Really nicely put together place. We felt very comfortable staying there as a family. There are very friendly camp animals (Buddy the dog and a very vocal cat). Great for a long weekend getaway!

When searching for the location, using car directions on G-maps will definitely assist you (When using the walk directions, it took me down an adjacent road that didn't have a clear pathway to the Airbnb). The unit is located on a small dirt road that passes by 2 small houses. The shipping container was a neat experience and it provided all the essentials necessary for a comfortable stay.

One thing to note is that walking around at night might be a bit intimidating due to the condition of some nearby houses needing some care. However, despite this, I didn't encounter any problems during my stay and would certainly consider booking this place again in the future.
Soo cool!! perfect little spot for my time in Gainesville. Close to everything, very comfortable.

The place was in a secluded area which offers lots of privacy! Staying in a shipping container was also cool to cross off my bucket list! Unfortunately  I did not get much sleep as the AC unit made a clunking noise all night and then I saw 3 wood roaches. The host did respond and apologize but I had to cancel meetings the next day since I only got 2 hours of sleep.
Was a beautiful location. Peaceful and quiet.

Loads of mountain biking trails just down Front Road
Port Dover has adorable shops, restaurants + local theatre
Long Point has incredible birding opportunities.

Norfolk County has an amazing selection of trails that will take you through forests, wetlands, grasslands and farmers‚Äô fields. Explore areas you‚Äôve never been before and experience all the outdoor adventure the county has to offer!
You can virtually fish all-year-long in Norfolk County, home to some of the greatest fishing opportunities in Southern Ontario, including smallmouth bass, trophy walleye, brown trout or steelhead.

hosts.about: My husband Nick and I own this cozy cottage. We're local folks with a passion for everything Norfolk. Ask us about where's best to dine out, get farm-fresh ingredients to cook at your home-away-from-home and what wine or beer you should try!

recent.comments: Great stay.

items.comments: Great stay.

A hidden gem and will be back to
Stay the next time we are in the area.  If you a looking for a romantic getaway or a place to stay after exploring everything to do in the area look no further. Nick was great and explained how everything worked and was very helpful. The staff at the Front door cellar were super friendly and made check in a breeze.  Thanks for the great stay!

The space was very unique and one of a kind! Very clean and private at the back of the winery. Nice to walk through the blueberry fields in-front of the airbnb. Hosts were very nice and accommodating. Fast responses and very friendly.

We had an amazing stay here! The owners were lovely & showed us how everything works as it is a bit off grid. It was a beautiful location. We did have issues with the shower not working & it was very humid inside due to heat but the AC unit helped after we had it running for a bit (it is July to heat is to be expected, just wish we had a working shower). Everything was very clean for it being ‚Äòoff grid‚Äô. So nice that it‚Äôs just the one unit back there too, beautiful!!!! We will be telling everyone!!
Great stay!

I hope to come back for another stay. I especially enjoyed the variety of birds, and frogs. I was surrounded by nature, and had incredible privacy. The cooking facilities worked well for me to cook all my own meals. There was a good amount of outdoor seating, and shade.  Solar-power was a huge plus for me.  There were many luscious blueberries in the field and I came in the middle of blueberry season and had lovely fresh berries for my breakfasts.

Had an amazing time!! Nice private little cottage on a beautiful blueberry farm. All the staff on the winery were so friendly ans helpful. Super close to the beach and other wineries. The hosts sets the place up with everything you need, kitchen tools, firewood, even shampoo and conditioner for the outdoor shower! So much fun! Thank you again!!

description.summary: Adventure and nature seekers know that after a day spent on the road, trail or water, you're looking for more than just a place to crash. Camp Cabernet is central to all sorts of activities, yet provides a moment to unwind in nature and make unforgettable memories. Our charming farm suite is just that wilderness escape, with the amenities you desire from home. Enjoy a visit to our onsite winery + cidery, sit out on the deck + star gaze, or cozy up around the fire pit.
description.space:
Enjoy all that Norfolk County and wine country has to offer! This quaint country-living oasis is a great place to get away, unwind, and enjoy peaceful rural living - while at the same time being only a minute away from the nearby towns of Port Dover + Simcoe, picturesque beach villages of Turkey Point or Long Point, and quaint Port Rowan.

The cozy solar-powered space is open-concept with a queen bed and small kitchen ‚Äî perfect for chilling some local wine, or making a cozy breakfast with some farm fresh eggs! Fall into a blissful sleep to the peaceful country sounds of the crickets and the breezes, and enjoy stunning sunrises and sunsets all year. The kitchen includes a mini fridge + sink, with plates/bowls, glasses/mugs, cutlery, cookware + utensils.

Try some of the nearby restaurants for a taste of Norfolk, or grab some steaks or sausages and grill them on the Napolean BBQ (with side burner) to enjoy a quiet outdoor meal cooked on your own schedule. 

A picnic table is supplied so you can enjoy al fresco meal and there's a fire pit for relaxing under the stars. An outhouse-style portable washroom is located next to the unit tucked beside an outdoor warm water shower (seasonal, not available once the ground freezes.) This washroom has no plumbing and is not a flush toilet.

Since this suite is located at the back of the farm, wifi is not available - there is cellular service depending on your provider. Unplug and unwind. 

Front Road Cellars + Inasphere Wines are within a stone's throw, and many other wineries are within a short drive.¬†If you're more of a brewery buff, the lovely Charlotteville Brewing or Hometown Brew Co are nearby, with lots of local brews to try!

The location is also ideal if you‚Äôre interested in a quick round of golf at Pine Valley Golf Course or spending the day fishing on Lake Erie. Book a spa day at Elements Day Spa, see a show at the Lighthouse Theatre, stop and shop at one of the region's antique shops, or explore even more of the eco-adventures nearby, like ziplining, mountain biking or birding.
description.access:
The tiny house is located at the rear of the farm property, about .75 km from the main winery building. Guests will have the hilltop around the tiny house to themselves, where they can make a fire,  lounge on the private deck, or go for a walk in the woods. 

You'll have your privacy, but please note, it's not a secluded location ‚Äî this is a fully-functioned family farm. You will see us driving tractors, maintaining the crop and otherwise running our business. Please be mindful of your surroundings when walking/driving around the farm. 

The space is designed with lots of natural light and unique d√©cor to make you feel right at home in this adorable tiny home that was made with comfy weekend getaways in mind!
description.notes:
The rural location guarantees there will be insects and other wildlife around and possibly indoors, especially if you leave the doors open. There are sounds of wildlife, domestic animals, and other farm noises. 

The access to the cabin is driving up a gravel laneway, there may be sticks/branches/twigs on the route. The parking area is grassy, but can get muddy in heavy rain. 

There is a portable air conditioner with ice blocks supplied. You may need to rotate these with frozen ones (supplied in mini fridge) to keep the temperature down in the extreme heat. In the cooler seasons, we do have a wall heater available.
description.neighborhood: Front Road is home to three wineries and a brewery, with others a short drive away. There is a convenience store with beer and wine outlet around the corner. Turkey Point is a short 7-min drive away from the cabin. There is a beautiful sandy beach, a handful of restaurants, hiking + biking trails and golf course. Port Rowan is a 7-min drive away, with quaint shops, a weekly farmers market and grocery, beer and liquor store. Port Dover is a leisurely 20-min drive with more shops, another beautiful beach, plentiful restaurants and our local theatre.
description.transit: The cabin is located down a gravel pathway, 3/4 km past the main farm buildings through the blueberry patch. There may be branches from the plants, puddles from rain, farm equipment driving or staff working enroute to the cabin. The parking area is grassy, but may be muddy on rainy days.
description.interaction: We work on site every day + live across the road. We will respect your privacy, but this is a fully-functioning farm.
description.house_rules: Any damage to persons and/or personal property while visiting is the responsibility of the guest(s). This is a fully functioning farm with insects, wildlife + hazards.

Joel was amazing at keeping us informed through text with instructions on how to get there, how to use hot tub and sauna, plus local recommendations. The sweet surprise of a candle and local wine was the Cherry on top!

What a beautiful spot! We felt like we were away from everything and it was very peaceful.  We were looking for 2 days of relaxation and the sea can delivered.

Perfect for two people.  We loved the sauna. Can‚Äôt say enough about this place. It was very clean and well curated. 

We would definitely love to rerun one day.

description.summary: At the RR your close to it all (5-15 by car ) to hartwell  lake, tiger town, Clemson university, shopping, restaurants , sunset views etc. Waiting for you back at the space is 1 bedroom featuring a full size bed, 1 bathroom fully stocked, small kitchen w/ pots+pans and a cozy living space with games, dvds, fireplace and tv provided. Outside, Enjoy the hot tub, outdoor games, a fire or an afternoon grill out on the porch along w/ a bbq grill. Kayaks+corn hole boards are available upon request.
description.space:
You are equipped with all your essentials here at the rustic rectangle . If you need to do laundry  there is a close by laundry mat up the rd right in downtown Pendleton. 

In the living area you are provided a drop leaf bar top for your work, or eating convenience, just pull up and it‚Äôll lock, when letting back down there are four leavers to unlock below. The couch let‚Äôs down to an xl twin to allow for more sleeping and use for seating at the bar, (please pickup to move rather than dragging). Enjoy a charging station From the Usb located in the lamp.

In the kitchen you‚Äôll find your paper towels/or Kitchen towels, salt, pepper, sugar,  plates, bowls, cups, silverware, pots (specific for induction cook top), coffee and  kureig coffee maker, microwave along with a toaster oven which can air fry, toast , bake and and more in the labeled cabinets. The stove top is an induction cooktop and the pots provided under the stove are required for it to work efficiently and properly .(they must be on the stove top prior to turning it on for them to heat, then just turn on and use as normal). Unfortunately there is no oven , but we do also provide two grills for your convenience outdoors. 

Make your way to the bathroom and it‚Äôs supplied with extra towels, razors, shampoo, conditioner, hairdryer, hair brush, body wash and more for your convenience. 

In the bedroom you‚Äôll find a full size  bed, closet with hangers and two shelves for your suitcases or other items , there is also one open storage space under the bed for additional space . 

If using kayaks please use at own risk and expect to bring transportation that will accommodate the two single, standard sized kayaks, straps are provided for use ( located in the deck box on the porch), lake is not in walking distance, but short ride up the rd to both leisure and sunset areas. 

There is a bbq grill for guests use, when finished with it we ask that you please clean it to the best of your ability:) and enjoy 

When using hot tub PLEASE USE AT YOUR OWN RISK. FOR STAYS LONGER THAN 4 NIGHTS THE HOT TUB WILL NEED TO BE CLEANED during your stay to insure filters are clear and waters stays clean. (I will be happy to do so without bothering you , and I‚Äôll mention this in your welcome message day of arrival) There are chemicals used to keep water clean we will not be held liable for burns or skin irritation. DO NOT FOR ANY REASON TURN POWER OFF OR HEATED FEATURE OFF  UNLESS INCASE OF EMERGENCY . WHEN NOT IN USE PLEASE PLACE LID BACK ON AND CLIP LID TO SEAL. We want to insure it stays clean and warm for next guests use . 

WHEN PETS ARE AT THE SPACE PLEASE USE PROVIDED PURPLE TOWELS TO WIPE ANY PET PAWS IF NEEDED. DO NOT USE WHITE TOWELS, HAND TOWELS RAGS FOR PETS, BLANKETS OR PILLOWS. IF YOUR PETS REQUIRE ANY BEDDING OR PILLOWS PLEASE PROVIDE YOUR OWN. 

A $55 PET CLEANING FEE WILL BE APPLIED TO ALL GUESTS WITH PETS, this should automatically be factored in at time of booking if added into booking, if not and we see/hear a pet was brought we will assume you missed this detail and will charge you.  

There are SECURITY CAMERAS outside every corner of the home. For your safety and the safety of others there is a monitor located in the bedroom for guests to view footage. If the light at night is bothersome , you can turn the monitor off :) Cameras do not pick up sound.

Please let us know if you have any questions and we‚Äôd love to help in any way. We hope you enjoy your stay and thank you for looking/choosing the rustic rectangle for your visit.!
description.access:
Guests have access to entire home space, hot tub, porch. Corn hole boards and kayaks if requested and available .

To use kayaks (please bring transportation to accommodate the one or two single standard sized kayaks . Lakes are not in walking distance but just a short drive up the rd to both leisure and sunset areas . More areas available within farther distance.

BBQ grill provided for guests use as well. Please when finished , clean it to the best of your abilities .
description.notes:
Pets live next door and have an invisible fence. Will bark if they see activity but are harmless. 

Although we do allow pets because we know how important they are to our guests we do require a $55 cleaning fee for all dogs on top of our $90 cleaning fee per booking. This should automatically be included into your total if you added a pet at time of booking, if not and see/hear a pet was brought we will assume you missed this detail and will charge you.

There are security cameras outside every corner of the home. For your safety and the safety of others there is a monitor located in the bedroom for guests to view footage. If the light at night is bothersome you can turn the monitor off at night ! Cameras do not pick up sound.

description.interaction: We are right next door and are here with as much or as little interaction as needed.
description.house_rules:

THERE IS NO SMOKING ALLOWED INSIDE OF THE HOME>

‚Ä¢ Please during your stay remove your shoes before entering the house. You‚Äôre welcome to leave them on the shoe shelf by the door. 

‚Ä¢ Please wash dishes as you use them and place them back where you found them once dried. 

‚Ä¢ If you are hosting an event , let us know prior to stay so we can be aware of parking and please be respectful of the space.

‚Ä¢Please place all towels in clothes hamper placed in closet.

We hope you enjoy your stay.

description.summary:
Huddle at Crooked Creek has 4 tiny homes and a central amenity area in a 40' repurposed shipping container, named "The Huddle" for grilling and gathering.  The property also has 2 fire pits. The tiny house has open concept living room and full kitchen. Upstairs, the open loft has a king size bed and plenty of charging points. The Sealy Queen Size sleeper sofa is located on the main level.
Lumpkin County STR-22-0061
Owners of Huddle at Crooked Creek hold real estate licenses in GA
description.space: The space in Magnolia Tree Tiny Home is designed to accommodate up to 4 people.  There is a king size Sealy Posturepedic bed with luxury linens in the 10' x 10' loft upstairs.  There are also two nightstands and several outlets/USB charging ports in the loft.  In the main living space, the sofa pulls out to a queen size bed with a Sealy sleeper sofa mattress.  A cozy chair in the reading nook is the best place to curl up with a book.  Our smart Toshiba Amazon Fire TV is on a rolling cart, so you can move the TV wherever you like in the house.  Fresh linens including blankets and pillows for the sleeper sofa are stored in a plastic case in the laundry closet.  The open kitchen includes a stainless steel refrigerator/freezer, stainless steel oven/stove, stainless steel dishwasher, microwave/vent hood, double sink, toaster, Keurig and traditional carafe coffee maker.  In the cabinets you'll find a set of plates, appetizer size plates and bowls, in addition to a plastic set of dishes, coffee cups, glasses, stemware, cutting mats, mixing bowls, bakeware, knives,  cooking utensils and cutlery.  We provide coffee pods, mini vanilla creamers, stevia and sugar packets.  The bathroom includes a large tile shower with a rain head shower fixture, European shower wand and sliding glass door.  The vent fan/light in the bathroom over the shower is a Bluetooth Speaker.  Connect to Homwerks and listen to your favorite music or podcast while you‚Äôre taking a nice hot shower!
description.access: Guests have access to the shared fire pits (there are two on the property for the four tiny homes). Additionally, guests have access to our central Huddle area. We repurposed a 40‚Äô shipping container to house our outdoor living room and attached a 40‚Äô wide deck to hold our Blackstone grill, prep station and outdoor games!    All of our guests have access to our on-site level 2 Electric Vehicle Charger that is located on the side of Magnolia Tree Tiny Home.
description.neighborhood: Huddle at Crooked Creek is located in a residential neighborhood only 10 minutes to Dahlonega‚Äôs historic town square and the University of North Georgia. We are 2 minutes from a convenient Dollar General store, 5 minutes from Montaluce Winery, Accent Cellars and about 15 minutes from GA-400.   Within an hour are the beautiful mountain towns of Ellijay and Blue Ridge.
description.transit:
When you enter the property on the gravel road, you will be on Margaret Drive, which is a shared road with our neighbors.  Look for the sign directing you to the Tree Tops and Mountain Trail Tiny Homes and drive down around the property. 
 Mountain Trail has plenty parking in the gravel area in front of the Brown and Green tiny houses.
description.interaction: Secure unique coded access will be provided to guests the day prior to check in.  Your hosts live in Metro Atlanta, however our team is always close by.  Please reach out if you need anything before or during your stay and we will be happy to assist!

Rachel and Scott were very attentive hosts. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would love to come back! We enjoyed visiting the horses and walking the property. Great spot which is really laid out well.  The grounds are amazing and I wish I had more time to explore. You are close enough that if you are amplified people may hear outside.  Getting a Lyft or Uber is extremely hard but possible,  it took about an hour and a couple of tries to get allocated a car though.   I was unfortunately only on property for about 14 hours :(

We didn‚Äôt spend a lot of time at the cabin but it was the perfect place to come back to after a busy day. So peaceful! I would highly recommend this experience to anyone looking for some time away. The cabin was clean and exactly as described. I‚Äôm sure we will be back to spend more time on the property and meet the horses.
We absolutely adored this cabin. Exactly like the photos if not better. Cozy, clean, modern, comfortable, and peaceful.  We hope to be back soon!
Another great stay! Love staying here. So cozy and fun!

description.summary:
This is one of 4 cabins on the property. We are an adults-only venue except for special Family Weeks. View the images to see kid-friendly dates.

You will stay in an upcycled shipping container that is nested in an old-growth forest perched 70‚Äô above Perry Lake. New in 2022, the premium interior feels fresh and modern. Visiting the horses, bird watching, and hiking are guests' favorites.

This cabin has been carefully placed to offer a private, 360-degree view of the surrounding wilderness.
description.space:
Your cabin is an upcycled shipping container. Brand new in 2022, its clever design is stocked with goodies like heated towel bars, quartz countertops, and fast WiFi. Huge, fixed windows make it feel light and modern (but don‚Äôt worry‚Ä¶ there are shades in case you need a break from all that nature!). Around you is a mix of open horse pastures, densely wooded trails, and a natural lakefront. 

This cabin is nearby other units but has been carefully placed to offer a private, 360-degree view of the surrounding wilderness.

Stillwater Stables also hosts a revolving art show; guests will find their cabins filled with original art from local artists that is available for sale.
description.access: Guests can enjoy the trails that wind throughout the property and can access the lake via our new dock. There‚Äôs also a paddle boat available to use.
description.notes: Your cabin is tucked into the woods! It gets dark and the footing can be tricky so please check in during daylight hours. If this is not possible, let us know and we will assist you.
description.neighborhood: As I bet you can imagine - our farm is located in a rural area! Expect to drive about 2 miles along a dirt road before you arrive at the turn into our driveway, which is almost a quarter mile long.
description.transit:
Your car will be the best way to explore the area. 

Also, we have a private ride service provider (a former Uber and Lyft driver) that services the farm. Please request that information after booking.
description.interaction: We live on the property so you'll likely see us around! We are happy to greet you, share time with the horses, or answer any questions you have, but otherwise expect to have a very quiet and private experience.
description.house_rules:
Special Events and Commercial Use:

For extra guests, special events, or commercial use - please reach out to us while booking to discuss your plans. Additional fees, permits, or accommodations might be required. 

Read This Before Entering the Hot Tub:

The detergents, oils, and chemicals found in body lotions, deodorants, and makeup will clog the spa filters and foul the water so you must remove these before entering. If special cleaning is needed to restore the spa water after your stay, then a materials fee of $75 will be assessed along with any additional costs resulting from issuing refunds or cancellations to the guests who are scheduled to arrive after you (and who will not be able to use the hot tub due to this servicing).

Neutral Scent Policy:

We aim to provide a scent-neutral environment to ensure that each guest experiences a healthy, comfortable, and enjoyable stay. Please respect the next visitor by not using heavy perfumes, medicinal oils, cannabis, or air fresheners.  Burning, vaporizing, smoking, diffusing, or cooking anything that can be detected in the air or on the fabrics after your departure could violate this policy and you may be charged up to a $250 restoration fee.

name: Appalachian Container Cabin
title: Otto, North Carolina

gallery.caption: After you pass our gate and navigate the long winding driveway you will approach a modern tiny home built out of shipping containers, tucked high in the Smokey Mountains.
The front view of the Appalachian Mountain Container Cabin.  Check out that new 40 ft x 8 ft covered front deck!
The side view of the cabin shows off the new sloped roof that'll keep you dry while you enjoy the front and back decks.
The 40' x 12' deck sits on top of two additional 20' containers and includes a large covered space underneath it.
Looking back at the cabin from the fire pit gives you a sense of how big the property is.
The back deck has two outdoor living areas with a six person table as well as a couch and two chairs. Photo credit: @brettmhenderson
The beautiful stainless steel spiral staircase takes you up to the observation deck where you can gaze at the stars at night. Photo credit: @brettmhenderson
The 40' x 8' observation deck has some truly amazing views.  It's also really great for watching the deer, fox, bear or other animals that wander through.
The top of the deck has two chairs designed for taking in the sunrise in the morning, the views during the day and the stars at night.  Credit: Max & Me Photography
Life really is better at the cabin.
The kitchen and living room share the view of the mountains through the large patio door that extends the living space onto the back deck.
The kitchen area features bowling alley countertops and modern appliances.
The open air kitchen shelves are built using reclaimed wood from a nearby Architectural Salvage yard and some black piping.   Photo credit: @brettmhenderson
The living space has a full size couch, electric fire place and 55" TV (2018 Vizeo) where you can stream Netflix, Amazon and a number of other services.
The living room includes an electric fireplace and smart TV (Amazon Prime, Netflix, Disney+ and Amazon Alexa all included).
The master bedroom features a queen size bed and a huge window to enjoy the view while you read your favorite book. Photo credit: @brettmhenderson
Beyond the kitchen is the bathroom, laundry room and bunk beds. Photo credit: @brettmhenderson

The bunk room has three sleeping bunks which are perfect for kids (or adults). 
You can store your your suitcases on top of the electric washer/dryer.
There are two steel framed hiking backpacks (stored below the deck) that you can use during your stay.  After your hike, you can wash your clothes with the GE washer and dryer.
A new bathroom was installed in October 2020 that features a transitional design, with traditional subway tiles and a modern penny pebble floor.
The back deck includes a large outdoor dining table.
The back deck also includes a great outdoor seating area.
One view of the evening sunset from the back porch.  Credit: Max & Me Photography
Every single sunset is different.  This is a sunset captured by Max & Me Photography in mid October.
Take the path downhill from the cabin to the firepit.
Watching the sunset behind the mountains while cooking s'mores over the fire is definitely something you'll want to do at least one night while you stay at the Appalachian Container Cabin.
Adults love campfires too.
Our boys absolutely love cooking smores by the fire.  The firepit is huge (we kinda got carried away).
A view of the fire and cabin, just before sunset. Credit: Max & Me Photography
Just beyond the firepit is an enormous granite rock where you can sit and watch the sunset over the Appalachian Trail in the distance.

Our cabin makes the perfect place to relax for the weekend, gaze at the stars at night, enjoy a fire with your friends, or get engaged to the one you love!  Congratulations to two of our recent guests who shared this photo of their special moment with us.
A view from our property in the middle of the Nanthala National Forest during the fall.
Finally, here is one last summer-time view from the top of our property with the Nantahala National Forest blanketing the mountains in the background.
Many of our guests come to watch the stars and astronomical events.  This shooting star was by @brettmhenderson in January 2019.
An aerial view of the cabin.  Credit: Max & Me Photography

Most of the photos are of the back of the cabin, but this one showcases a sunrise from the front.  The photo is taken mid-October when the leaves are in full color and long shadows are cast.  Credit: Max & Me Photography
On more view of the back side of the cabin.  Credit: Max & Me Photography
The cabin is located on this mountain deep within the Nantahala National Forest.  Credit: Max & Me Photography
A aerial view of the sunrising and the fog burning off over the Nantahala National Forest.  Credit: Max & Me Photography

From the back deck, you'll be able to enjoy your coffee as you watch the morning clouds roll through the valley below.  This aerial view captures the mountain the cabin is on as well as some of the surrounding mountains. Credit: Max & Me Photography

From the back deck, you'll be able to enjoy your coffee as you watch the morning clouds roll through the valley below.  This aerial view captures the mountain the cabin is on as well as some of the surrounding mountains. Credit: Max & Me Photography

There are many great hikes in the area - including Pickens Nose and Albert Mountain Firetower, both which look back down on our cabin.  Just out the front door is a view from the top of our mountain which is equally stunning.
The Appalachian Container Cabin is positioned high on a mountain at 2,495 feet elevation.
The floorplan of the 40' container so you can see how everything is configured

recent.comments: One of the best airbnbs I have ever stayed at! Super cozy and peaceful environment with everything you need. Host was extremely kind and made sure we were taken care of. Would recommend this airbnb to anyone wanting to stay in NC!

items.comments: One of the best airbnbs I have ever stayed at! Super cozy and peaceful environment with everything you need. Host was extremely kind and made sure we were taken care of. Would recommend this airbnb to anyone wanting to stay in NC!
This was such a fun weekend! The covered porch is phenomenal. What a view!
Great host! Great place!
Another great stay! The rain made our stay even more magical. Great amenities, beautiful views, and awesome host! Will be back soon!
Thanks so much for sharing your amazing container cabin!! Stunning views, very peaceful! Loved it and would definitely come back.
Great overall experience! Would definitely book again!

WOW! Our stay at the Appalachian Container Cabin was absolutely incredible. Nick, the host, was amazing from start to finish. The moment we arrived, we knew we had chosen the perfect spot. The breathtaking views left us in awe; of course no photo does it justice.

Not only was the location stunning, but Nick's hospitality was exceptional. He went above and beyond multiple times to make sure our stay was perfect. It's rare to find such a dedicated host.

After searching extensively, this Airbnb is by far the best we've ever encountered. We had an unforgettable experience and even got engaged during our stay - this place has a magical touch! It's truly a slice of paradise.

If you're considering staying here, don't hesitate any longer. Trust me, you won't regret it. We highly recommend extending your stay if possible, as leaving was the only downside.

Thank you, Nick, for an unforgettable stay! We're already planning our return to relive those blissful moments.

description.summary: Stay at one of the most unique and stunning vacation rentals in the Smoky Mountains! The "Appalachian Container Cabin" is a modern tiny home with an unparalleled view overlooking the Appalachian Trail, built out of shipping containers, and was recently featured on the new HGTV/DIY show "Containables".  The cabin is located at the end of private road deep within the Nantahala National Forest, but located conveniently between Franklin, North Carolina and Clayton, Georgia.
description.space:
The interior of this modern cabin is thoughtfully designed and includes one queen bed and three bunk beds. It's well designed for a couple with small kids. If you have more than one couple, the sleeping space will be the limiting factor. An additional person could sleep comfortably on the couch or you could camp outside on the deck or by the firepit.

The View - There are a lot of beautiful places in the Appalachian mountains, but one of the most amazing views is just out your back door.  You can watch a thunderstorm roll through over the Appalachian trail in the distance, enjoy a blazing sunset after dinner, gaze at the Milky Way and brilliant stars at night, roast marshmallows by the fire or enjoy a hike through our 100 year hardwood forest on top of our mountain.
description.access: Guests have access to the top 40' container and all outdoor deck space.  Guests do not have access to the two bottom 20' containers.
description.notes:
We now have high speed internet, thank you Starlink!

The kitchen has the following amenities: Microwave, Toaster Oven, Keurig Coffee Maker, Regular Coffee Maker, Assorted Pots and Pans, 2 Burner Electric Cooktop Stove, Dishwasher, and a Full Size Refrigerator. The kitchen does not have an Oven.  We have a Blue Rhino Razor Black 4-Burner Liquid Propane Gas Griddle Grill which is perfect for cooking up breakfast or dinner on the deck.

A detailed cabin guide will be provided the week of your stay. It includes directions to the cabin as well as a recommendations on where to eat, adventures to check out and ideas on where to shop.
description.neighborhood:
Everything you need is close by - including grocery stores, farmers markets, great restaurants such as the Dillard House, and micro-breweries such as Lazy Hiker.  If you are here to hike, check out Pickens Nose or Albert Mountain.  The Pickens Nose trailhead is only an 8.1 mile drive from the cabin.  

If you are looking for a nearby adventure, explore Black Rock Mountain State Park, Tallulah Gorge State Park or a waterfall.  There are 7 waterfalls within a 45 minutes drive from our cabin to explore!  We recommend Dry Falls, Bridal Falls and Big Laurel Falls.

After you are done hiking and visiting waterfalls, check out the Lazy Hiker Brewery.  It‚Äôs one of our favorite spots around to grab a drink, catch up with friends and meet locals.  All the beers are named after famous hikes around the area.  

For food, there are a lot of Farmers Markets nearby, but our favorite is Osage Farms. Try some Georgia Peaches or get the Apple Cinnamon Donuts (you have to get there early for them, they sell out quick). 

Finally, if you are interested in shopping, check out Culpepper's Otto Depot.  You‚Äôll see this huge train depot building about 2 miles from our cabin.  It‚Äôs a unique architectural salvage business and definitely worth stopping in to.
description.transit: Although not absolutely required, we (highly) recommend a vehicle with 4-wheel drive.  The cabin is located at the top of a steep gravel road.
description.interaction: You can call me at anytime, text, or direct message if you have questions.
description.house_rules: 4wd or all wheel drive vehicle highly recommended.  Prior to leaving, please wash dirty dishes and take your trash with you.  You can deposit your trash at the Otto Recycling Center located at 2877 Addington Bridge Road, Franklin, NC.

recent.comments: Absolutely loved the experience! This was my first time booking an Airbnb as well as staying in a tiny home. The home was clean, quiet,  peaceful, and relaxing. The host were very professional, responsive and friendly. I surprised my husband for his 40th birthday and he was in such  awh of the work completed in the home. We really enjoyed how the owner tied in airplane pieces for decoration and furniture throughout the tiny home. Looking forward to future stays in the near future!

items.comments: Absolutely loved the experience! This was my first time booking an Airbnb as well as staying in a tiny home. The home was clean, quiet,  peaceful, and relaxing. My husband and I loved this place. Perfect for a little weekend getaway

Ashley & Dusty have a terrific tiny house you really must see to appreciate! There are so many cool details in this little space, we were simply amazed! The kitchen is a dream, the beds comfy, & the bathroom pretty darn spacious for a tiny house! We enjoyed making s'mores at the pitfire & just relaxing in the peaceful surroundings--it's a great, quiet location that feels rural, but is within a few miles of shopping, restaurants, & entertainment options if that's what you're seeking.
The house was lovely! I had a fantastic trip!

Returning guest speaks for itself!! We love this tiny house so much that it was our fourth or fifth time booking this place !! Clean, quiet and peaceful. Super easy check-in. Dusty and Ashley are super easy to get in touch if you have any questions or concerns. We will be back
What a cool place! Clean and peaceful! I look forward to having a reason to stay again! Don‚Äôt miss out it‚Äôs everything it shows.

This little home was so cute! My husband and I loved it. We had always wanted to stay in a tiny house and had recently been toying the idea of building our own. This really gave us a ballpark idea of what we could and could not do in terms of size and space. Ashley & Dustin‚Äôs place is wonderful, AND we had no idea we‚Äôd be staying in a famous tiny house! üòâ 

The only downside was the air did not work and sleeping in a loft with no air was not fun. The ceiling fan gave its best valiant effort, though!

description.summary: Take some time to kick back and enjoy the simple life. Experience Tiny House living at its finest. Our Tiny House was built with love by my husband and family. Our Aviation themed Tiny Home was featured on TV, in our local Lynchburg Living Magazine and we are proud to say that we are the 1st legal Tiny House in Lynchburg City! We are conveniently located 5-8 minutes from Downtown and 10-12 minutes from Wards Road and LU. Our home has the country feel, but near the stores and shops. See you soon!
description.notes: We are located not too far from the train tracks.
description.house_rules:
- If you cook please wash and put away dishes or leave clean dishes in the drying rack. 
- When you use the washer/dryer leave the washer/dryer door cracked after a load so it can dry out.
- We have a small burner available for those not familiar with cooking on a gas stove. Please use small burner if you are not familiar with gas.
- We have zero tolerance for smoking and if you are smoking in or on our property you will be asked to leave, with additional $250 cleaning fee.

description.summary:
Welcome to our unique cabin rentals. My husband and I started our journey in February 2019 to bring a more unique modern lodging experience to the Hocking Hills. Being raised here and wanting to share our love for the area we decided to embark on a journey to building creative cabins. I hope you decide to stay at one of our creative cabins

Attention: There is a Rental Agreement that will need to be signed within 48 hours of your booking via DocuSign that will be sent to you Airbnb email.
description.space:
Parker‚Äôs Point, has 3 levels, 2 spiral staircases and is located in Hocking Hills Logan Ohio. Hangout on the front porch rocking chairs and enjoying the scenery, or maybe the back deck, with grill and outdoor eating area. Our lower level has a small game room and the hot tub is right outside the door. And of course the fire pit is always ready for a fire. 

Inside.. gas fireplace, with Smart TV in our cozy living area. 2 Queen bedroom‚Äôs with connecting bathrooms, small eat in kitchen with everything you need including a coffee bar. Half bath located right off the kitchen. The cabin sleeps 4 (not recommended for children under 5).

The entrance to the property is gated for your safety. The cabin is equipped with smart lock entry.
description.neighborhood:
We are Nestled on 30 acres of wooded terrain perfect for hiking in Hocking Hills, Logan Ohio.  Sorry no four wheelers or Side-by-side UTV‚Äôs allowed on the property. 



We are right on OH-664, just 5 mins from the entrance of The Famous Old Man‚Äôs Cave.
description.transit:
Car, SUV, or Pickup

4x4 is highly recommended for the winter months.
description.interaction:
We are Nestled on 30 acres of wooded terrain in Hocking Hills, Logan Ohio. We are right on OH-664, just 5 driving minutes from the entrance of The Famous Old Man‚Äôs Cave. (There is no walking trail from our property to Old Man's Cave)



The property is also gated for your security. There is also other cabins located throughout the property. You will see a sign on a tree after entering the gate on where Parker's Point is located on the property.
description.house_rules:
If we as the owners find out that there are more than the number of guests permitted, we have the right to terminate your stay

NO 4-wheelers, ATV's, or hunting on premises- $500 fine

Sorry no pets allowed.- $500 fine

ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING OR VAPING OF ANY KIND...$500 FINE FOR VIOLATORS

NO Parties (bachelorette, bachelor, weddings, birthdays, etc.) You will be asked to leave the property with no refund.
